No Re-Entry Allowed
generalInfo.childRule: Children tickets vary for each event. visit www.bjcc.org/events.php for show information.

name: U.S. Bank Stadium

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: 612-777-8787 U.S. Bank Stadium 612-33-VIKES Minnesota Vikings
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Tickets can be purchased online only.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: VISA, Mastercard, Discover Card and American Express. U.S. Bank Stadium is a cashless venue.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: The will-call windows are located at the U.S. Bank Stadium Ticket Office, on the Northwest corner adjacent to the Polaris Gate. Will-Call will be available for pick-up beginning one hour prior to the event being attended, unless otherwise noted. Tickets are released only to the person whose name appears on the Ticketmaster transaction. Proper photo identification is required. A signature from the person authorized to pick up the tickets will be obtained at the time of pick up.

parkingDetail: Parking is available in ramps and lots to the North and West of U.S. Bank Stadium.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available throughout all seating levels of U.S. Bank Stadium. For accessible seating accommodations, please contact Ticketmaster at 1-800-745-3000. A specifically dedicated ADA Pick-Up/Drop-Off zone is available during events. The designated ADA Pick-Up/ Drop-Off zone is located on 10th Avenue South, between 6th Street South and 7th Street South. Game Day Team Members will be available when you arrive for any additional assistance.

generalInfo.generalRule: No cameras, video cameras, or recording devices are allowed. Prohibited items: Coolers, duffel bags, packages, backpacks, fanny packs, beverage containers, alcohol, mace, laser pointers, noise makers of any kind, metal or wood poles, weapons of any type, and large purses are banned from NFL stadiums. Items of this nature will need to be returned to your vehicles prior to stadium admission. Nothing larger than a small purse, which will be subject to inspection, will be allowed for fans to carry into the stadium. U.S. Bank Stadium is a completely non-smoking facility. All guests are prohibited from smoking (including electronic cigarettes, vaporizers or similar products) inside of the stadium and outside of the stadium within the security perimeter at any time.
generalInfo.childRule: For all Vikings games and concerts everyone needs a ticket.

name: GIANT Center

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: 717-534-3911 www.Hersheypa.com, www.hersheyentertainment.com
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Monday - Friday 9am - 5pm Box Office is located to the left of the Main Entrance.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, and all major credit cards.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Customer must present a Photo ID, Ticketmaster Confirmation Number and the credit card number used to purchase the tickets.

parkingDetail: There is ample parking at GIANT Center. Parking fee is charged.
accessibleSeatingDetail: This building is fully Accessible and ADA Compliant. There are elevators available to all floors and accessible seating is available throughout GIANT Center. You must contact the Box Office at 717-534-3911 for Accessible seating, as it is NOT available through TIcketmaster.

generalInfo.generalRule: Cameras, audio & video equipment are never permitted except by special permission of the artists's management. No food, beverages, or coolers permitted. Once in the venue, you may not leave the premise. If so, you will be recharged admission to enter. No camping or loitering Posters and signs are not permitted into the Venue All events are all-weather events. Concessions are available throughout the Giant Center. No Smoking in the Building. All hand carried items including backpacks, belt bags and purses will be searched. Guests are encouraged to keep nonessential items in their vehicles.
generalInfo.childRule: All patrons who have reached their 2nd birthday need a ticket, however, for some family shows ( ex. Sesame St.) anyone aged 1 or over needs a ticket. Please check with the Box Office or Ticketmaster before purchasing.

name: Gillette Stadium

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Gillette Stadium Ticket Office is located in the Enel Plaza, outside of the Ticketmaster gate at the north end of the stadium. The Gillette Stadium Ticket Office is open on event days only and will open with parking lots.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa only for New England Patriots. Visa, Mastercard, Amex, Cash-For all other events
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will call is located at the ticket office. Customers must present photo I.D., the actual credit card used to purchase tickets and the confirmation number. NOTE: If picking up your tickets at Will Call, we strongly recommend arriving at the Ticket Office with a photo I.D. one hour prior to kickoff to claim your seats and avoid any prolonged wait times.

parkingDetail: Opening and price varies per event. Please check www.gillettestadium.com for more information.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible Seating available through Ticketmaster and the box office.

generalInfo.generalRule: No umbrellas, coolers, cans, bottles or alcohol allowed in stadium. Tailgating, picnicing, BBQ's allowed in specific areas of parking lots. No open fires. Gillette has a new Clear Bag Policy! Bags of any kind will not be permitted except for gallon size clear freezer or authorized clear bags measuring 12"x 12" x 6" and women's clutches not to exceed 7" x 4" x 2" (approximately the size of a hand). For more information visit: WWW.GILLETTESTADIUM.COM/BAGPOLICY

name: Arizona Financial Theatre

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Due to the ongoing global pandemic, and to protect the health and safety of our guests and venue staff members, the box office at Arizona Federal Theatre will be open on-day-of-show only. If you’d like to purchase tickets, please visit us at www.livenation.com. If you’re looking to obtain a refund for a show that was either canceled, postponed or rescheduled, please visit us at www.livenation.com/refund for more information. We look forward to seeing you at our next show at Arizona Federal Theatre
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Arizona Federal Theatre box office is located on 4th Ave and Washington in downtown Phoenix. Please have a PHOTO ID, the CREDIT CARD the tickets were purchased on, and your CONFIRMATION number. WILL CALL PICK-UP: Arizona Federal Theatre requires that customers picking up WILL CALL tickets furnish the following: 1) PICTURE IDENTIFICATION THAT MATCHES THE PICK-UP NAME 2) CONFIRMATION NUMBER THAT MATCHES THE CUSTOMER ACCOUNT ALTERNATE WILL CALL PICK-UP: If another person, other than the person ordering and paying for the tickets, is picking up a WILL CALL order, the ALTERNATE PICK-UP name MUST be on the account. To get the alternate pick-up name noted on the account, the original purchaser MUST contact Ticketmaster at (800) 745-3000, ask for customer service, verify account information and request alternate pick-up.

parkingDetail: Adjacent parking garage is at 4th Ave and Adams (Adams Street Garage). Spaces are available to purchase on line and through the box office. Pre-buy and secure a covered space for only $10.
accessibleSeatingDetail: To purchase accessible seating please call the box office at 602.379.2888. Limited Mobility seating is available. To purchase limited mobility seating please call the box office at 602.379.2888. Sight and Hearing impaired seating is also available.

generalInfo.generalRule: No backpacks or large purses will be allowed. Small purses and fanny packs will be subject to search. Every individual entering the Theatre will be subject to search. No outside concessions allowed. No pets other than "assisting" animals. Smoking in Facility: The Arizona Federal Theatre is a non-smoking facility. Smoking areas outside building are available, depending on event. Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. Binoculars are allowed No Laser Pointers allowed No Video Cameras allowed No Recorders allowed CHILDRENS RULES: Everyone including infants must have a ticket.

ada.adaCustomCopy:
Special needs seating can be purchased at the Arizona Financial Theatre box office by calling 602-379-2888 or online at arizonafederaltheatre.com
* Box office information is subject to change.
ada.adaHours: The box office is typically open from 5pm-9pm on SHOW DAYS ONLY. For morning or afternoon shows, the box office will open one hour before show time.

name: Paramount Theatre

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: For more information you can also go to Paramount Theatre website, www.paramountdenver.com/ .
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Box Office will open 90 minutes prior to the event start time.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Box Office no longer sells tickets. All sales must be done in advance online.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: WILL CALL is no longer accepted at the Box Office. All tickets are digital and must be managed that way.

parkingDetail: Take Glenarm to 17th. • Go East on 17th and turn south on Tremont. • Go 2 Blocks and turn right on 15th and into the Tremont Garage (400 15th Street Denver, CO 80202)
accessibleSeatingDetail: Paramount Theatre is committed to providing every Guest with a comfortable and enjoyable experience in the arena, including Guests with disabilities. Wheelchair and accessible seating tickets and companion seating is available for purchase in each of the wheelchair seating sections.

generalInfo.generalRule: For FAQs, please visit: https://www.paramountdenver.com/faqs/

name: SNHU Arena

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: For general venue information, email info5@snhuarena.com or call (603) 644-5000. For group sales inquiries, email info5@snhuarena.com with the event you are interested in and your message will be directed to the appropriate sales team.
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The box office is open day-of-event only for all ticketed events. The box office will open a minimum of 90 minutes prior to the posted event start time. Please check the venue website or social media pages for specific dates and times. The box office is not open for walk-up advance sales on non-event days.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: All major credit cards Visa, MasterCard, Discover and American Express – are accepted at the box office. SNHU Arena is a cashless venue – cash is not accepted as payment at the venue box office or concession stands. No checks of any kind are accepted.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will call tickets may be picked up day of show only. No advance pickup of tickets designated as will call delivery will be allowed. Customer must present the credit card used to purchase, a valid matching photo ID, and the Ticketmaster order number in order to claim the tickets.

parkingDetail: There is limited on-site parking available for sale. Passes may be purchased as an add-on either as part of your ticket purchase or through the add-on listings on our Ticketmaster venue page. There are many public and private off-site parking lots within walking distance of the arena. Metered parking is also available on the surrounding streets, please obey posted parking restrictions and time limits. Limited ADA parking is available on-site, accessed off Elm Street via Cedar Street in the southwest corner of the arena property. On-street ADA parking is also available on Chestnut Street at the rear of the arena. ADA spaces are designated for vehicles displaying a current state-issued disability placard or license plate.
accessibleSeatingDetail: This is an accessible venue, accessible seating is available for purchase via Ticketmaster. To view current available inventory, please visit the Ticketmaster.com purchase page for your desired event.

generalInfo.generalRule: This venue has a clear bag policy: clear totes not exceeding 12"x6"x12" are the only bags permitted. Wristlets are permitted if they do not exceed 4"x6"x1". Backpacks and purses are not permitted. Limited exceptions for medical or diaper bags will be allowed. Camera policy varies by show, please check the venue website or social media for more information. No weapons of any kind. No outside food or beverage. No smoking is allowed and no smoking area is provided.
generalInfo.childRule: Children are welcome. For most events, children under 2 are admitted free if they are seated on a parent or guardians lap. Any children who will be occupying their own seat, regardless of age, must have a ticket. Discounted child tickets may be available for select events, please check the purchase page of your desired event for more information.

name: JMA Wireless Dome

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Monday Through Friday 8:30AM-4:30PM
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, Mastercard, American Express and Discover
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Customers can pick-up tickets any time day of show! Customer must present the actual credit card used to place order and a photo i.d.

parkingDetail: Day of event parking at Syracuse University major events (Men’s basketball, football, concerts, etc.) is available at Manley and Skytop lots, with a shuttle service to and from the Dome included in the price. Dome West lots are available for smaller events. Call our Box Office for RV and Bus pricing, or other questions.

generalInfo.childRule: Children under 12 months old do not need a ticket and are expected to sit on an adult’s lap during the event.

ada.adaCustomCopy: For reserved seat accessible Wheelchair and Companion seats (maximum of three), please click the Filters Icon on the Buy screen for the game you are interested in, and click the Accessibility option on. Any available Accessible seating will then highlight. Note that for Women’s Basketball and Men’s Lacrosse, accessible seating is in the General Admission area, where Dome staff will direct you when you enter the game. You may also contact the Dome Box Office at 888-DOME-TIX during regular business hours (except when closed for holidays) for further assistance with your ticket purchase.
ada.adaHours: Monday Through Friday 8:30AM-4:30PM

name: Colonial Life Arena

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Colonial Life Arena: (803)576-9200 Gamecock Athletics Box Office: (803)777-4274
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Weekdays: Tuesdays Only*, 9 AM to 5 PM. (*Effective 1/3/2023*) On Day of Show/Game: Box Office opens when the doors open to the public. Door times vary by event and can be found on ColonialLifeArena.com. The Box Office is located inside the main entrance at the corner of Lincoln and Greene Streets.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Credit & Debit cards are preferred (Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express).Cash is usually accepted.Vendors inside the arena do not accept cash.*Payment types subject to change without notice.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets can be picked up at the Box Office which is located inside the building at the corner of Greene and Lincoln Streets. Hours can be found on ColonialLifeArena.com. Tickets will only be given out if the customer provides credit card used to purchase, Ticketmaster order confirmation number & photo ID that matches the account name. Tickets issued by performers, event organizers, etc. are left in Will Call at their discretion. Box Office is not responsible for tickets left in Will Call.

parkingDetail: There are many parking options in the arena area throughout USC, City of Columbia and The Vista areas. Here is a link to some of the City of Columbia/Vista options in the area: https://parking.columbiasc.gov/downtown-parking-map/. Prices and accepted payment methods are determined by lot owners/operators and can change without notice. We suggest you bring cash and credit/debit card to be best prepared to pay when you arrive. The Colonial Life Arena does not own/operate parking lots/garages. Accessible parking is available. Please look for signage or ask an attendant for availability. In order to park in the spaces reserved for disabled guests, the vehicle must have a state issued handicapped window pass, sticker, or license plate. Guests may drop off a disabled patron near the Colonial Life Arena and park their car in one of the nearby lots. We recommend you arrive early, as the venue is located on campus which is in the city and traffic can often be very heavy in the area.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available at various locations throughout the Colonial Life Arena. Handicap seating is available to the patron with the disability and all guests in the party, up to published ticket limits, if available. To purchase handicap accessible seating, please look for the handicapped icon at www.Tickemaster.com or visit the box office. We reserve the right to re-seat or remove any guests from the property that violate the Federal ADA laws. If you purchased seats in a designated ADA seat location in error, please advise Ticketmaster so they can try to relocate your seats. This is best to be completed before the show but it may also be handled at the box office on the day of the show when available.

generalInfo.generalRule: For Drop-Offs: There is often a drop off area at the corner of Lincoln and College streets. This may vary depending on traffic flow for each event but this is usually the case. Colonial Life Arena Policy: All persons and items entering Colonial Life Arena are subject to inspection. To enter the venue, bags must be one of the following: Clear plastic, vinyl or PVC that do not exceed 12" x 6" x 12" -- A logo no larger than 4.5" x 3.4" can be displayed on one side of a permissible clear bag // One-gallon clear plastic freezer bag (Ziploc bag or similar) // Small clutch bags no larger than 4.5" x 6.5" -- approximately the size of a hand, with or without a handle or strap. Please visit www.ColonialLifeArena.com to see a full list of prohibited items. Please note that these can vary by show and change without notice. There is no re-entry. Alcohol sales are available at most events and are subject to crowd management policies and regulations. Patrons are required to have a valid photo ID.
generalInfo.childRule: The age for requiring a ticket varies per show. Please visit the individual event page for more information that will be more accurate for each show. If a child is going to sit in a seat, they will need a ticket regardless of age. If the child is going to sit in the parents lap they must still adhere to the age policy for purchasing a ticket. For example: If the show requires a ticket for children 2 and older but a 3 year old is going to sit in the parents lap, the child will require a ticket.

name: DeVos Performance Hall

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: For information about events at the DeVos Performance Hall, please call: *DeVos Performance Hall: 616-742-6500 *Broadway Grand Rapids: 616-235-6285 *Grand Rapids Ballet: 616-454-4771 *Grand Rapids Symphony: 616-454-9451 *Opera Grand Rapids: 616-451-2741
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The outside box office window at DeVos Performance Hall is open Monday through Friday, 11 AM - 3 PM, for ticket sales for DeVos Performance Hall, Van Andel Arena and select DeVos Place events. Grand Rapids Griffins tickets can NOT be purchased at the box office. Additional hours may be available based on the event schedule. For box office hours, please visit https://www.devosperformancehall.com/p/events-and-tickets/ticketing-information.

parkingDetail: Parking is available within the surrounding area. Prices vary and are subject to change. For parking information please visit https://www.devosperformancehall.com/directions.aspx.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Customers needing special seating arrangements may purchase tickets online at Ticketmaster.com, or by visiting the DeVos Box Office prior to the event. Accessible Seating Terms: Wheelchair Accessible: seating location in which there are no stairs that allows for wheelchair or scooter usage. Companion Seat: seating for individuals that are attending an event with someone who requires wheelchair or semi-ambulatory seats. Semi-Ambulatory: seating reserved for those with limited mobility that may require walking a few incline/decline stairs.

generalInfo.generalRule: The DeVos Performance Hall is a non-smoking facility. DeVos Performance Hall has adopted a limited bag size policy and does not permit bags larger than 12" x 9" x 3", other than those required for medical or parenting needs. All bags will be screened by security personnel. Policy is subject to change based on event policy.

generalInfo.generalRule: No flash cameras allowed inside. No audio or video recording devices allowed inside. No smoking inside the building. generalInfo.childRule: Children under 2 are usually free, but must sit on a ticket holders lap. May vary with event.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Summer Hours (June - August) Monday - Friday, 10am - 4pm Saturday - Sunday Open on Event Days Only September through May Sunday - Monday, Open on Event Days Only Tuesday - Friday, 10am - 5pm Saturday, 12pm - 4pm The Box Office is located through Door 9 on the corner of Major Taylor Blvd and Foster St. The Box Office is open through the 1st half of the event on event days
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets may be picked up at the Box Office with a valid Photo Id starting 2 hours prior to event start time. Timing of pick up is subject to change by event.

parkingDetail: The DCU Center does NOT own or manage any parking garages for the venue. Public parking (86 Central St., Worcester, MA 01608) is located at the corner of Major Taylor Blvd. (formerly Worcester Center Blvd.) and East Central St. The garage may be reached at (508) 792-0314. Overnight parking is prohibited at the garage. Various garages and open air lots are close to venue. Prices range from $1.00 to $20.00.

generalInfo.generalRule: The following items are prohibited: Cameras Backpacks, knapsacks, coolers, suitcases, oversized handbags, and all other bags larger than 8" X 11" Recording Devices Laser pointers Food and Beverage Bottles and Cans Banners and Signs Umbrellas Weapons, Drugs, or other items considered contraband In accordance with state laws, the DCU Center has a No Smoking policy.
generalInfo.childRule: For most family shows, kids under 2 years are admitted free but must sit on an adult's lap. Some exceptions may apply.

ada.adaCustomCopy:
Accessible seating is reserved for the exclusive use of disabled patrons and their guests. The purchase or use of these seating locations by non-disabled individuals is strictly prohibited and may result in ejection and/or forfeiture of ticket price.  If the disabled individual cannot attend an event for which he/she has purchased tickets, call the DCU Center Box Office prior to the event taking place for further instructions.

DCU Center tickets for patrons with accessible needs, subject to availability, may be purchased in the following ways:

1) Order online at Ticketmaster.com

2) Call the DCU Center Box Office (508) 929-0164

3) Call Ticketmaster at (800) 745-3000

4) Visit the DCU Center Arena Box Office - 50 Foster St., Worcester, MA 01608

5) Visit Ticketmaster Outlets


For additional information regarding accessing DCU Center or questions, please call the DCU Center Box Office at (508) 929-0164.

Assistive Listening Devices (ALD) are available upon request, subject to availability.  To ensure availability, we do ask that all requests for listening devices be made at least one week prior to the event by calling the DCU Center Box Office or by sending an email to info@dcucenter.com.
ada.adaHours:

Closed Saturday-Sunday unless there is an event; then the box office will be open at noon or 2 hours prior to event start 

September-May Hours:
Tuesday - Friday, 10am - 5pm, Saturday 12pm (noon) - 4pm

Closed Sunday - Monday unless there is an event; then the box office will be open at noon or 2 hours prior to event start

name: M&T Bank Stadium

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: General Info: 410-261-RAVE(7283)
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Open Mon thru Fri:9AM to 5PM During the season open on Saturday of a home game from 10AM to 4PM Game Days: 2.5 hours prior to kickoff
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash...Visa...MC...AMX
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Available 3 hours prior to kickoff: Must have a Valid Photo-ID for pick-up, confirmation # and credit card used for purchase are recommended for pick-up of phone charge orders.

parkingDetail: Stadium lots are reserved for Season Ticket Holders. There are paylots and garages in the area, prices vary. • All accessible parking is sold ($45 per vehicle) on a first-come, first-served basis, and cannot be purchased in advance. Parking Lots open 4.5 hrs prior to kickoff. Guests with a parking pass for a non-accessible lot can show that pass to avoid an additional charge, if accessible spaces are available. • Access to accessible parking spaces is limited to vehicles with disabled license plates or valid accessible hangtags. A valid Ravens game ticket must also be presented. The person to whom the disabled tag was issued must be in the vehicle & may be asked to provide a state MVA disabled registration card.
accessibleSeatingDetail: • ADA seating may be available for purchase & exchanges & is subject to availability. Ravens games are typically sold out of all seating, including ADA seats. • Guests requiring ADA seats for all stadium events with assigned seating are strongly encouraged to contact the ticket office at 410-261-RAVE (7283) to ensure proper accommodations. • Wheelchairs, motorized wheelchairs & scooters are permitted inside M&T Bank Stadium. Guests may check their mobility device at any Guest Services Center (Sections 100, 127, 525, 553) or Club Concierge (204, 224, 229, 250) & pick up at the conclusion of the event. • M&T Bank Stadium has more than 100 accessible parking spaces, located in lots B, C, R. • The following gates are accessible for guests with disabilities: Gates A, B, C, D, F, A1, A2, Media Gate (South side of the stadium). Medical needs lines at all main gates (A, B, C, D) • There are 6 banks of elevators in M&T Bank Stadium; 3 on the north & 3 on the south side. North elevators are located near sections 102, 146, & 151. South elevators are located near sections 119, 124, & 129. Please note there are stairs to enter the elevator lobby at section 124. The elevators at sections 102, 119, 129, 146, & 151 have no stairs and are accessible for all guests.

generalInfo.childRule: Children 2 & under do not need a ticket but are required to sit on the lap of their guardian.

name: The St. Augustine Amphitheatre

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Mon-Fri – 10:00am – 6:00pm Sat - 9:00am – 5:00pm Sun – Closed Group Sales: Please call Box Office to inquire. **Closed on all St Johns County Holidays **Open until 1 hour after event time on event days.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, MasterCard, Discover, American Express
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Location: left two windows of the box office Opens: 2 hour prior to show time Customer must present the actual credit card used for the purchase, a photo ID and Ticketmaster account confirmation number in order to receive tickets.

parkingDetail: There are two options for parking: paid onsite parking at the Amphitheatre Main Lot or free satellite parking at RB Hunt Elementary School Soccer Field and Anastasia State Park, both of which are within one mile of the venue. Onsite parking is $20.00 per parking spot and can be purchased online via Ticketmaster or at the Box Office. The free satellite parking does not require a ticket. Free shuttle services between the satellite parking areas and the Amphitheatre run continuously throughout the evening, beginning 45 minutes before gates and for 45 minutes after the event.
accessibleSeatingDetail: This is an accessible venue. Ramps: All areas are accessible by ramps except for the Grandstand (300 Section).

generalInfo.generalRule: Items NOT allowed: - NO Illegal or Un-Prescribed Drugs - NO Video Cameras - NO Personal Property that is a potential hazard to others. (ex. Chains, Wallet Chains, or Spiked jewelry) - NO Electronic Equipment Including Laptops Computers, IPads, Audio Recorders, and Tripods. - NO Strollers - NO Weapons of Any Kind (ex. Guns, Knives, Sticks, Fireworks, Mace, and/or Pepper Spray) - NO Skateboards, Skates, or Rollerblades - NO Umbrellas - NO Chairs - NO Backpacks (Purse backpacks, Diaper bag backpacks and diaper bags are permitted) - No Animals (except service animals to aid guests with disabilities) - No Coolers of Any Kind (Including Small Soft pack Coolers) - NO Gifts for the Band - NO Musical Instruments - No Cameras with Built-In Lenses longer than a couple of inches and/or detachable lenses/flash. - NO Outside Alcoholic beverages * Camera Policy: IT IS AT THE SOLE DISCRETION OF THE ARTIST IF SMALL HANDHELD CAMERAS WITH NO DETACHABLE LENSES ARE ALLOWED INSIDE VENUE. PLEASE CONTACT VENUE FOR MORE INFORMATION. * SMOKING POLICY: Smoking is permitted in designated areas only. This event will take place RAIN or SHINE !!
generalInfo.childRule: A ticket is not required for children two and under if the child remains in the lap of the accompanying parent or guardian. If a seat is desired for the child a ticket must be purchased at regular price.

name: Byline Bank Aragon Ballroom

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Byline Bank Aragon Ballroom Box Office is open on show days only - the Box Office opens at 12:00 PM and closes approximately 30 minutes after the main act has taken the stage. The Box Office will only sell tickets on the night of the event if the event has not been sold out in advance.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Box Office accepts Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover and cash.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets purchased through Ticketmaster.com are available for pick-up at box office on the night of the show, starting when doors open. Please be sure to bring the order confirmation number when picking up tickets at the box office. Guests must present a photo ID which matches the Will Call name on the order to receive tickets. TICKETS MAY NOT BE DROPPED OFF OR LEFT FOR OTHER GUESTS.

parkingDetail: There are three parking lots located on Lawrence Ave. within a half block of the Byline Bank Aragon Ballroom. The parking lots cost $30 to park, unless otherwise noted as metered parking. Payment for these parking lots is cash only. They will be open two hours before the event. Street parking is very limited in the surrounding neighborhood.

generalInfo.generalRule: Byline Bank Aragon Ballroom is a NON-SMOKING venue. This Includes E-Cigarettes and Vape Pens. The following items are prohibited from entering the venue: -Bags larger than 12 x 6 x 12 -Signs larger than 8.5 X 11 -Weapons of any kind, including defense sprays -Outside food or drinks, including water bottles of any kind -Illegal substances (I.e. drugs and drug paraphernalia) -Coolers -Laser pointers -Fireworks -Umbrellas -Bandannas -Aerosol sprays -Spiked jewelry and clothing -Camelbacks - Medication that is not in a marked and properly labeled prescription container matching the name on the owners ID. This list is not exhaustive and changes can be made without notice. Guests are expected to behave respectfully and in accordance with venue policy and state laws. Any guest that is acting in a manner that venue management deems unsafe can be subject to ejection. If a guest violates a state or local law they will be subject to any tickets or punishment deemed necessary by local law enforcement.
generalInfo.childRule: For age-restricted shows, all minors must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Valid photo ID is required for age-restricted shows. Acceptable identification includes: state-issued driver's license or photo identification card, military ID card or valid passport.

name: Beaver Stadium

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: 1-800-NITTANY
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Athletics Ticket Office at the Bryce Jordan Center: Monday-Friday 8:00AM-5:00PM Beaver Stadium Ticket Office: Home Football Saturdays 8:00AM-End of Game
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Check, Credit Card (Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express)
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: WILL CALL windows are located in the game day ticket office near Gate E and open four (4) hours before the game. Identification is required before tickets will be released.

accessibleSeatingDetail: For questions concerning ADA services and accessibility, please contact the Athletic Customer Relations Center at 1-800-NITTANY (1-800-648-8269) or visit GoPSUsports.com. Patrons who qualify for disability parking should request disability parking when purchasing prepaid parking. ADA customer assistance is available at the ADA Gate located on the West side of the stadium between Gates B and C . Assisted access to and from seats is coordinated at this location. General and student gates have ADA accessible points of entry. The ramp at Gate B is ADA accessible. Two additional gates are offered for convenience: just North of Gate B is an ADA entrance gate that is adjacent to the ADA Customer Assistance area; just West of Gate A is a canopy entrance adjacent to the elevator access to the Main Concourse, the Club Level, and the South Upper Deck. ADA Gates open 2 hours before kickoff. ADA Accessible restrooms are available on field level in the South end zone and under the North, East and West stands. In addition, all restrooms on the concourse level, club level, and South upper deck are ADA accessible. Family restrooms are located at field level on the North, East, and West Sides, on the main concourse and South upper concourse. Specially constructed areas to accommodate wheelchair spectators with season and individual game tickets are located in the South end zone (lower, club level and upper deck level), East and West sides and at field level in the North end. Contact the Athletic Customer Relations Center at 1-800-NITTANY (1-800-648-8269) for details about and access to ADA seating.

generalInfo.generalRule: Bag Policy:Backpacks, bags, and purses are not permitted in Beaver Stadium. One clear one-gallon plastic bag per person will be permitted for items required for medical and/or child care needs. All items are subject to inspection. Please refer to the prohibited items list. Any items left unattended at the gates will be discarded and unrecoverable. Stadium Re-EntryL Re-entry is prohibited.
generalInfo.childRule: In accordance with Big Ten rules, all persons, including children of any age, must have a ticket for admission to Beaver Stadium.

generalInfo.generalRule: Restricted Items: (Keep in mind priority number 1 is to HAVE FUN! Just please do it without the items listed below) • No guns, knives, weapons, pepper spray, projectiles of any kind, or any other item that could be used to inflict harm. • Replicas of any type of weapon are NOT permitted. • No drugs or drug paraphernalia, illegal substances of any kind. • No outside food or drinks • No personal video cameras, Go-Pros, selfie sticks, drones, masks or laser pointers. • No professional audio, video, or audio recording equipment - (including detachable lenses, tripods, zooms or commercial use rigs) • No unsealed liquids or gels of any kind • No jewelry or clothing that could inflict harm • No large bags over (10" x 10"), backpacks, Camelbacks or Bota bags • No stuffed animals or toys of any kind • This list of prohibited items is subject to change at the discretion of venue management Zero Tolerance For Drug Use or Possession The use or possession of any illegal drugs will not be tolerated anywhere inside or outside the venue. Security personnel and narcotics officers will be working and enforcing all drug related laws. Do not bring any illegal substances to the event as violators will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law. If you are found impaired at the door, security will not allow you to enter the venue. Event staff reserves the right to refuse entry to anyone. Please come with a smile and be prepared to enjoy a fun filled night of music and dancing. Safety and Medical The Van Buren is dedicated to providing a safe environment. Public and private security will be present throughout the entire event. Our Security Staff will be available to assist your needs including any medical requests.

Each ticketed guest will be permitted to carry one large clear bag, either a Ziploc style bag or a 12x6x12 (or smaller) clear bag, plus a small wallet or clutch that must not exceed 5.5x8.5. parkingDetail: The Bon Secours Wellness Arena parking lot on Church Street is reserved for Bon Secours Wellness Arena Premium Seating and Suite Owners. Guests may enter the Premium Seat Parking Lot from North Church Street and drive toward the garage to access the spaces. ADA parking within this lot is limited and availability is based on a first-come first-serve basis. Additional accessible parking is located in the Church St. parking garage. All vehicles requiring accessible parking must have the proper decal displayed from the rear view mirror or have an applicable license plate.
accessibleSeatingDetail: This is an accessible venue. If you are purchasing tickets in one of our ADA designated seating areas . Please note, this location is reserved for ADA persons and up to 3 companions only. If you do not meet ADA requirements you will not be permitted to sit in this location. The Americans with Disabilities Act prohibits discrimination on the basis of disability in employment, State and local government, public accommodations, commercial facilities, transportation, and telecommunications. To be protected by the Federal ADA law, one must have a disability or have a relationship or association with an individual with a disability attending the event. We reserve the right to re-seat or remove any guests from the property that violate the Federal ADA laws. If you purchased seats in a designated ADA seat location in error, please advise Ticketmaster so they can try to reseat you, prior to the show. Thank you- Bon Secours Wellness Arena Management

generalInfo.generalRule: Beginning on October 4, 2021, the Bon Secours Wellness Arena began implementing a new clear bag policy. Complimentary clear bags will be available to guests attending events, and advance communications will be shared with guests attending BSWA events. Each ticketed guest will be permitted to carry one large clear bag, either a Ziploc style bag or a 12x6x12 (or smaller) clear bag, plus a small wallet or clutch that must not exceed 5.5x8.5. The small wallet or clutch must be carried into the venue outside the clear bag and is subject to search. The safety and security of our guests is of utmost importance at our events, says Beth Paul, General Manager of the Bon Secours Wellness Arena. Many of our patrons may already be familiar with this process, as it is used by many arenas + college and NFL stadiums. Clear bags provide another layer of security with less inconvenience to our guests as they are easier and faster to search. It also supports the Department of Homeland Security’s See Something, Say Something campaign. Approved bags include: • Bags that are clear, vinyl or PVC and do not exceed 12x6x12 • One-gallon clear plastic freezer bags (Ziploc bag or similar) • Small clutch bags, with or without a handle or strap, that do not exceed 5.5x8.5 An exception will be made for medically necessary items after proper inspection upon entry. Prohibited bags include, but are not limited to: • Purses larger than a clutch bag • Briefcases • Backpacks • Cinch bags • Fanny packs that are not clear and exceed size restriction Diapers and other baby supplies can be carried in a clear bag. Each member of a family, including children, is allowed to carry an approved clear bag and a clutch purse into the arena. Complimentary clear bags will be available to guests attending events as we transition through this new policy. NO Smoking or vaping inside the Arena NO Weapons NO Outside Food or Beverages NO Laser Pointers NO Audio Recorders NO Video Recorders or Professional Cameras Outside Smoking section available at section 105/106.

Some venues sell all or a portion of their accessible seating tickets only through their box office and not through Ticketmaster. For further information on purchasing accessible tickets, visit our FAQ.

name: The Fillmore Detroit

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Wednesday/Friday from 12pm - 6pm and on event days 2 hours prior to door time.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Box Office accepts cash and all major credit cards.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets can be picked up at the Fillmore Box Office 2 hours prior to door time. Customers must present a picture ID and the confirmation number.

parkingDetail: We have partnered with ParkWhiz to offer easy and reliable parking options! Visit https://www.parkwhiz.com/the-fillmore-detroit-parking/?utm_medium=LiveNation&utm_source=1269&utm_campaign=Web_LN_ParkingPage_VenueLink to book your Fillmore Detroit parking.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is offered on a first-come first-served basis at the door. Parties larger than two are not guaranteed to sit together in this section if availability is limited. To make a reservation in advance, call us at 313-961-5451

generalInfo.generalRule: For more information including door times, show times, support acts and other FAQs please visit www.thefillmoredetroit.com Live Nation and House of Blues Entertainment are committed to providing a safe and secure environment for our guests to enjoy their visit to our Theaters and Clubs. We encourage you to review our safety and security information below prior to arrival at the venue. • Please arrive early to the venue to allow enough time for you and your guests to move through the queue and enter the venue. • Prior to entering the venue, guests will be searched (wand or walk through metal detection and/or pat-downs) to ensure that none of the restricted items enters the building. • We suggest you leave valuable and unnecessary items at home. • You may be asked to empty your pockets of all items so that they can be examined. • All alcohol and narcotic laws will be strictly enforced. • All bags will be searched, no large bags or backpacks will be allowed. Restricted Items: (Keep in mind priority number 1 is to HAVE FUN! Just please do it without the items listed below) • No guns, knives, weapons, pepper spray, projectiles of any kind, or any other item that could be used to inflict harm. • Replicas of any type of weapon are NOT permitted • No drugs, drug paraphernalia or illegal substances of any kind • No outside food or drinks • No personal video cameras, Go-Pros, selfie sticks, drones, masks or laser pointers. • No professional audio, video, or audio recording equipment - (including detachable lenses, tripods, zooms or commercial use rigs) • No unsealed liquids or gels of any kind • No jewelry or clothing that could inflict harm • No large bags over (10 x 10), backpacks, Camelbacks or Bota bags • No stuffed animals or toys of any kind • This list of prohibited items is subject to change at the discretion of venue management Zero Tolerance for Drug Use or Possession • The use or possession of any illegal drugs will not be tolerated anywhere inside or outside the venue. Security personnel and narcotics officers will be working and enforcing all drug related laws. Do not bring any illegal substances to the event as violators will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law. If you are found impaired at the door, security will not allow you to enter the venue. Event staff reserves the right to refuse entry to anyone. Please come with a smile and be prepared to enjoy a fun filled night of music and dancing. Safety and Medical • Live Nation is dedicated to providing a safe environment. Public and private security will be present throughout the entire event. The Security Staff will be available to assist your needs including any medical requests.
generalInfo.childRule: Age restrictions depend on the event. Please contact the Box Office with questions.

ada.adaCustomCopy: Accessible seating is offered on a first-come first-served basis at the door. Parties larger than two are not guaranteed to sit together in this section if availability is limited. To make a reservation in advance, call us at (313) 961-5451.

name: Stanford Stadium

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Box Office will open at Noon on the day of event
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, Mastercard, American Express
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is available 4 hours before event time at the Stanford Stadium Box Office. Please bring Photo ID & the Credit Card used to order tickets

parkingDetail: Parking available in multiple lots surrounding Stanford Stadium. Parking is cash only.

generalInfo.generalRule: All Guests will be subject to search, which may include the use of Electronic devices, pat downs and inspections of bags. Only small purses and baby bags will be permitted in the stadium. Guests are discouraged from bringing unnecessary items to Avaya Stadium. * Shoes & shirts are required at all times within the building. * No audio or video recorders are allowed in the stadium for any event. * There is no smoking allowed anywhere inside the stadium. *visit gostanford.com for a complete list of prohibited items and general information.
generalInfo.childRule: All ages are welcome. No ticket is required for ages 0-35 months, as long as they do not require a seat of their own.

name: Huntington Center

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Mon & Fri: 10:00am-5:30pm Tues-Thurs: 10:00am-4:00pm Sat and Sun Closed (open only if there is an event)
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Huntington Center is a Cashless venue. This includes Box Office, Concessions, Bar & Vendors. We accept Tap pay, American Express, Discover, Mastercard & Visa.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets are available for pick up starting 2 hours prior to show time, with an ID.

parkingDetail: Two parking garages are attached to the Huntington Center; they are the Glass City Center Parking Garage and the Port Lawrence Garage. Glass City Center Garage is accessible from Monroe St. across from Hensville Park. Port Lawrence Garage is accessible from St. Clair at Jefferson. Additional parking is available in surrounding lots. Please visit: https://www.downtowntoledo.org/parking/ for more information on Downtown Parking.

generalInfo.generalRule: The Huntington Center has a new bag policy. We are allowing 12x6x12 CLEAR BAGS and 4.5 x 6.5 clutch purses. No large bags, bookbags or boxes are allowed in the building without prior authorization. Absolutely NO Re-Entry allowed! We are also a NO smoking or vaping venue.
generalInfo.childRule: Children who have celebrated their second birthday or children who will occupy a seat are required to have a ticket for admission. This policy may vary with each show. Childrens shows will require a child who has celebrated their first birthday to have a ticket for admission.

name: Hollywood Bowl

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: * LA Phil Summer Season - Info. & Access Seating: (323) 850-2000 * MARIACHI USA Festival Info. (323) 848-7717. The Accessible Services Department: (323) 850-2125
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: 2018 Box Office Hours: Noon to 6pm (closed Mondays) through September 29 For more information, please call Audience Services at 323.850.2000, available 10am-6pm daily. The Accessible Services Department Hours: Monday-Closed Tuesday-Sunday:12pm-6pm On show dates: Hours 12pm until approx. 8:30pm
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The box office accepts Cash, Visa, MC, AMX, DSC, Checks (Checks accepted up to 10 business days prior to the concert. Must Present California I.D. & Driver License.)
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: We suggest that customers arrive an hour and a half before show time to pick up tickets at Will Call, to avoid lines.

parkingDetail: Please note that parking at the Bowl is extremely limited. Park & Ride allows you to park in your neighborhood and ride directly to the Bowl. Following each performance, buses will speed you homeward - no parking headaches, no traffic jams. Buy your tickets in advance to ensure priority boarding. Only $7 roundtrip.

generalInfo.generalRule: The Bowl is a non-smoking venue! Smoking is not allowed before, during, or after the concert within the seating areas, aisles or promenades. Smoking will be permitted in the parking lots, picnic areas or select locations outside the amphitheatre. Picnic baskets can't measure greater than 15 inches wide x 15 high and 22 long. No alcohol, glass containers or cans allowed!
generalInfo.childRule: Everybody needs a ticket, no discounts for children. Regardless of age, each patron must have a ticket to enter the Amphitheatre, and must sit in the seat indicated on that ticket.

name: Martin Marietta Center for the Performing Arts

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: 919-996-8700 Box Office Information Line
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Hours of operation are Monday-Friday, 10:00AM - 2:00PM and on event days, one hour prior to show time. Our Box Office is located at 2 E South St. and is directly in front of Raleigh Memorial Auditorium. The box office is closed on most federal holidays.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, ApplePay, and G-pay.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets can be picked up at the box office or ticket counters one hour prior to the scheduled event. Picture ID required.

parkingDetail: Parking is available in both of the lots located directly across from South Street. There is also parking available in the deck located on the corner of Salisbury and South Streets. Accessible parking spaces are available on the first level of each garage and in the lots. The parking cost for these areas is $10.00 per car.
accessibleSeatingDetail: This is an accessible venue.

generalInfo.generalRule: Guests are required to enter through a security screening, including the use of a metal detector. All bags are also subject to search and must meet our new size requirements. A small clutch or wallet is recommended and no bags larger than 12" x 12" x 10" will be allowed, this includes backpacks, camera bags, and large purses. *For family shows diaper bags are allowed for guests with infants and toddlers (child must be present). Prohibited items include: outside food and beverage, camera bags, large purses (over 12"x12"x10"), backpacks, and weapons of any kind. No video cameras/recording devices allowed, this includes still cameras. Smoking is not permitted.
generalInfo.childRule: Age 2 and older typically require a ticket, however this may vary by event. This information will be listed on the Ticketmaster event purchase page.

name: Orpheum Theatre

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: One hour before show time.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash only. ATM is available in the outside lobby near the box office.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is located at the front of the theatre in on Broadway and opens one hour before show time.

parkingDetail: Parking is available in many lots surrounding the theatre at prices ranging from $5-$10. Parking operators are independent and set their own prices.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Available through Ticketmaster and the Box Office. Wheelchair accessible seating is available on the orchestra level and balcony level in designated areas. Please refer to the Orpheum Theatre Seating Chart. Orpheum Theatre ushers will direct you to this area once you enter the theatre the day of your event. The Orpheum has restrooms to accommodate accessible patrons at each level. Restrooms are accessible by means of an elevator located at the front entrance of the theater lobby. Accessible seating areas are solely for disabled persons and their companions. By purchasing an accessible seating ticket through Ticketmaster, you agree to the following: The ticket will be used only by a person with a disability and his/her companion. A ticket holder may be denied entry to, or removed from, the accessible seating area if he or she is not disabled or the legitimate companion. If this occurs, the venue shall have no obligation to provide alternate seating. If Ticketmaster or the event provider believes, in its sole discretion, that your order violates or may violate this policy, Ticketmaster may cancel your order without notice.

generalInfo.generalRule: Video and still photography not permitted. Outside food and drink cannot be brought into the theatre. Shirt, pants, and shoes are required. Dress code may be more restrictive for some events. Smoking is not permitted. Exit and re-entry is not permitted.
generalInfo.childRule: Attendance for children may be restricted for certain shows. For shows where children are admitted, children under age one (1) may be admitted without a ticket.

Must have handicap hangtag to enter
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible Seating Please call the Mirabito Box Office at 607-778-6628 for options Row F requires patron to climb 2 stairs into section. Wheelchair ramp is between section 24 and Section 25. Elevators available at each end of the building.

generalInfo.generalRule: For 10-15 Tickets Varies by Show Call Box Office at 607-778-6628 Prohibited Items: Weapons of any kind (including concealed carried permits) Outside food & beverage Backpacks or bags larger than 14x14x6 Noisemakers Professional cameras, audio/video recorders, and/or flash photography Smoking of any kind (cigarettes or e-cigarettes No re-entry after arrival
generalInfo.childRule: For most Events Children under 2 years of age are admitted free when sitting on the parents lap. Children 2 years and over need a ticket. Broadway in Binghamton shows all ages need a ticket. VARIES BY SHOW CALL BOX OFFICE 607 778-6628

generalInfo.generalRule: You and your belongings will be searched upon entry. If you elect not to consent to being searched, you will be denied entry into the stadium. Weapons, bags, backpacks, coolers, umbrellas, duffel bags, large purses, fanny packs, obstructive banners and signs are all strictly prohibited, as are food and beverages, video cameras and still photo cameras with lenses over 12 inches. PLEASE NOTE: PER NFL RULES Every fan may use the following specified bags to carry items into the stadium: * One bag that is clear plastic, vinyl or PVC and does not exceed 12" x 6" x 12" * OR A one-gallon clear plastic freezer bag (Ziploc bag or similar) * Logo can only be on one side of the bag. * Small, non-clear bags that do not exceed 4.5" x 6.5" (11.4 x 16.5 cm) in size, with or without a handle or strap can be taken into the stadium with an approved clear plastic bag. Please note: An exception will be made for medically necessary items after proper inspection.
generalInfo.childRule: All individuals, regardless of age (babies included) must have a ticket to enter the stadium.

name: Fillmore Auditorium (Denver)

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: (303)837-0360 main business #.
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Fillmore Auditorium Box Office Hours are: Fridays 12PM-6PM 3 Hours before doors open on event days though show time.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The box office accepts MasterCard, Visa, Amx, Discover. We have gone cashless at our box office window.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Available on the evening of the show only approximately 30 minutes prior to the doors opening.

parkingDetail: Street parking & paid lots. Arrive Early. Paid lots not affiliated with Fillmore.
accessibleSeatingDetail: This is an all general admission event unless otherwise noted on the map. We are offering accessible seating that you may purchase in advance for GA shows. Please be aware that stairs may restrict access to locations not marked as wheelchair accessible. ADA sections provide general admission entry to the purchased section, and seats in that section will be filled in order of arrival. A member of our team will be available to escort you to your seat once you arrive at the venue. If you do not see available accessible seats, please purchase a general admission ticket, and contact the venue so we may accommodate your request for accessible seating. We recommend that you arrive at the venue at the door time listed on the event page and talk to a member of our staff to receive accommodations.

generalInfo.generalRule: To enhance the guest experience and for your safety, the following items are prohibited from entry to the Fillmore: Cans, bottles, glass, outside food or drinks, large bags or backpacks, weapons of any kind, illegal drugs, laser pointers, video recorders, large or professional cameras, stickers, flyers, markers, glow sticks, projectiles. The Fillmore Auditorium is a no smoking facility, cigarettes and any other inhaling devices including vaporizers are prohibited inside the venue. Tobacco products may be consumed in our designated smoking area outside the South side of the venue. Marijuana products are prohibited. Per Colorado Amendment 64, public display and consumption of marijuana is prohibited by law. Crowd surfing and other behavior that may endanger the well-being of other patrons is prohibited. Small cameras and audio recording subject to artist approval. Other items may be prohibited at artist request or venue discretion. The Fillmore reserves the right to refuse entry or remove anyone for any reason. Most shows are ages 16 & over with valid ID only unless otherwise noted. Alcohol will be served to those who are 21+ with valid I.D. There are some shows that are listed as *All Ages* where there will be no age requirement for entrance. The Fillmore Auditorium is usually configured as General Admission mainly standing-room with limited seating areas available.

parkingDetail: There is plenty of onsite parking available. Event parking is $7.00 in the main Marquee Lot and $7.00 in the Fulton Lot near the theater.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available through Ticketmaster.

name: New Jersey Performing Arts Center

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: NJPAC Customer Service: 1-973-297-5843 Monday - Friday, 12pm to 6pm Groups of 9 or more: 1-888-696-5722 Monday - Friday, 9am - 5pm
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Box Office is open 12pm to 6pm Tuesday through Friday, 12pm to 4pm Saturday, and closed Sunday and Monday. Box Office remains open after posted closing times on performance evenings until the end of the first intermission or thirty minutes after the start of performances when there are no intermissions. Box Office opens three hours before curtain time on Monday & Sunday when performances are scheduled on those days of the week, and closes at end of first intermission or thirty minutes after the start of performances when there are no intermissions.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, MasterCard, Discover, American Express
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will call is located at the box office. Will call is open whenever the box office is open. (When VIP package tickets are offered, these may available at will call only on the day of the performance.)

parkingDetail: Parking is available in two secure surface lots and the Military Park garage, all located across the street from or adjacent to NJPAC. The cost varies by performance, from $15 to $28 day of the performance. Discounted parking -- $1 off day of the performance rate -- may be purchased up to the day before the performance when ordering tickets or by visiting the parking page at njpac.org/parking
accessibleSeatingDetail: 1-973-297-5843 Monday through Friday, 12pm to 6pm. Please leave a voice message should no one answer immediately. NJPAC is accessible to persons with disabilities. Persons with disabilities are advised to contact NJPAC Ticket Services at the number above before making their ticket purchase online at njpac.org. Ticket Services staff are prepared with assisting them with seating. Persons with hearing disabilities should call NJ Telephone Relay Services at 711 for assistance with connecting with our ticket services staff. - Registered service animals assisting persons with disabilities are permitted in the theater. - Sennheiser listening (FM and infra-red) devices are available in the lobby of the theater. An usher can assist patrons who require these devices. Patrons will be asked to leave a driver's license or credit card as collateral.

generalInfo.generalRule: Cameras and audio recording devices are not permitted in the theater. The taking of video and pictures, especially flash photos, is disruptive and inconsiderate to both the artist and other members of the audience. Just as importantly, the visual and audio performances of the artist are protected under both US and international copyright laws. NJPAC has the right to confiscate all recording devices. All bags are subject to search. Backpacks, suitcases, bags and purses larger than 12 x 12 x 8 may not be taken into the theaters. Patrons carrying larger bags will be asked to bring them to the coat check at no charge and will be given a plastic bag for carrying select items, such as wallets and cell phones, into the theater. An exception will be made for medically necessary items after proper inspection. NJPAC reserves the right to inspect and search persons entering NJPAC property and hand-carried items. Violators of this policy may be subject to ejection from NJPAC property and/or civil or criminal penalties.
generalInfo.childRule: NJPAC recommends that children younger than 5 years of age not attend adult performances. Both NJPAC and the NJ Symphony have programs specifically designed for young children. Please call each organization for information. All persons entering the theater, including babes in arms, must have a ticket. Any child under the age of 14 must be accompanied by an adult.

name: Hackensack Meridian Health Theatre at the Count Basie Center

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: For current Basie Center box office hours, visit www.thebasie.org
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Check, Visa, Mastercard, American Expresss
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets can be picked-up at the will call window starting 60 minutes prior to the show. Customer must have actual credit card and picture ID.

parkingDetail: Please visit website for parking information www.thebasie.org
accessibleSeatingDetail: The Count Basie Center strives to provide all patrons with an enjoyable experience in clean, safe and accommodating surroundings. The Theatre offers accessible seating in all sections of the orchestra level, automatic doors at the main entrance and ADA restroom, and ADA appropriate-height counters at all concessions locations. Large print programs and assisted listening devices are available upon request for most shows. Our website posts the services available to make for a positive experience. We require ample notification in the event seats need to be removed to accommodate patrons. Service animals are welcome and sign language interpreters are available upon request. If you need assistance with any tenets of this policy, please call 732-842-9000 and our trained box office staff will make any accommodations or answer any questions you may have.

name: Hampton Coliseum

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: B.O. 757-838-4203, Press 0 for attendant FAX 757-838-1814 www.hamptoncoliseum.org
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: 10:00am - 5:00pm Mon-Fri 10:00am - 4:00pm Sat (on show days) 1:00pm - 4:00pm Sun & Holiday shows **closed Saturday, Sunday, and holidays unless events are scheduled. Call B.O. for updated hours of operation.**
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa and MC.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call orders are available for pick up at the box office 24 hours after purchase or anytime day of event. Customers must present the actual credit card used to place the order, a photo I.D., and the order number. Only persons whose name is on the account can pick up tickets (the person who purchased the tickets). An alternate pick up name may be placed on the account by contacting Ticketmaster at 1-800-653-8000. Tickets will only be issued to the person in whose name the tickets were purchased or the alternate pick-up name. Tickets remaining at will call after the event starts, will not be resold. Refunds will not be given for tickets not picked up. Will Call available when Box Office opens on day of event.

parkingDetail: On site, patrolled, and well-lit parking is available. Accessible parking is available with appropriate placards. Parking is free for most events.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available through Ticketmaster or in person at Hampton Coliseum Box Office. Sign language interpreters are available for most shows. Requests must be made to the box office a minimum of three weeks before the show.

generalInfo.generalRule: Audio and Video Recorders are not allowed. Smoking is not permitted in the building. Laser lights are not allowed. No weapons allowed. No outside food, beverages, coolers, or bottles permitted inside the building. Still photography is sometimes permitted. Contact the box office for the camera policy pertaining to a specific event. Alcohol is sold at appropriate events only. Only those persons 21 years of age and older, with proper I.D. will be served. Please drink responsibly. All patrons are subject to search.
generalInfo.childRule: Children 2 and up must have a ticket for most events. Children under 2 may sit on a parents lap without a ticket. (subject to change) most children's shows require those that have reached their second birthday to purchase a ticket.

name: The Pageant

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Pageant & Delmar Hall Box Offices open 2 hours prior to the scheduled event door time. The Pageant Box Office is also open on Tuesdays and Fridays from 10am to 4pm. Please note that phone sales are not available. Additional information available here: www.thepageant.com.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. Please note: all tickets carry fees. Tickets purchased with cash at the box office are discounted to face value.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: For those who purchase tickets in advance and choose will call delivery, tickets can be picked up on the day of the show at the box office starting two hours prior to the scheduled door time. The purchaser must present their valid photo ID along with the credit debit card used for the transaction in order to pick up the tickets. The Pageant can only release the tickets to the purchaser with proof of ID, and cannot release tickets to third parties, no exceptions. If the will call order name must be changed, the purchaser can call Ticketmaster at 1.800.653.8000 to request a will call name change or log-in to their Ticketmaster account and click transfer tickets. Any name changes done via Ticketmasters phone system must be completed at least 24 hours prior to the show.

parkingDetail: Free parking as well as street parking is available throughout the surrounding area. Please note that not all private lots allow public parking and St. Louis City parking laws do apply.
accessibleSeatingDetail: If elevator access is needed while on-premise, please see a staff member for assistance. For individualize accommodations, please contact the venue directly. Additional information available here: www.thepageant.com.

generalInfo.generalRule: A full list of venue policies, procedures, and protocol are available here: www.thepageant.com.
generalInfo.childRule: Age restrictions are determined on a show-by-show basis. Specific show information available here: www.thepageant.com.

ada.adaCustomCopy: Please contact the venue directly for any questions regarding accessible seating, call at 314.726.6161 or email at pageantinfo@thepageant.com.
ada.adaHours: The Pageant & Delmar Hall Box Offices, along with Suite 100, open 2 hours prior to the scheduled event door time. Please note that phone sales are not available. Additional information available here: www.thepageant.com.

name: Neyland Stadium

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The University of Tennessee Athletic Ticket Office is open Monday-Friday / 8:30 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. ET and located at 1600 Phillip Fulmer Way in Thompson-Boling Arena. The Neyland Stadium Box Office at Gate 21 opens four (4) hours prior to kick off and remains open until half-time.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The University of Tennessee Athletic Ticket Office accepts all major payment methods, as well as cash.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call (pre-purchased tickets) that have not been picked up prior to game day will be available at the venue. Ticket Purchaser must present a valid photo ID when picking up pre-purchased tickets. To make arrangements for someone other than the ticket purchaser to pick up tickets, please contact the Athletic Ticket Office in advance at (865) 656-1200. Football Will Call is located at Gate 21 of Neyland Stadium, and opens 4 hours prior to kickoff until halftime on gamedays.

accessibleSeatingDetail: Wheelchair Seating and Easy Access Seats are available on a first come, first served basis. To obtain Accessible seating, please contact the Athletic Ticket Office at (865) 656-1200.

generalInfo.generalRule: Fans are encouraged to visit UTSports.com/Gameday for full details. REGULATIONS - Everyone regardless of age must have a ticket. - University policies and state & federal laws will be in effect. - Fans are asked to review & adhere to the UT & SEC Fan Code of Conduct. - All articles, including purses, are subject to search. - Gates open 2 hours prior to kickoff. - No passouts are permitted - Smoking is prohibited on the University of Tennessee, Knoxville Campus - Tickets not obtained directly from the UT Ticket Office or its authorized agents may not be honored. - No refund or exchange of tickets allowed. PROHIBITED ITEMS - Large, non-clear bags or parcels, including backpacks and large purses -Weapons of any kind, including pocket knives -Outside food and beverage, cans, bottles, coolers -Laser pointers, artificial noisemakers, strobe lights -Video cameras, professional cameras (large lenses) - Umbrellas -Radios or other audio devices without headsets -Stadium seats with arms - Signs larger than 8 1/2" x 11" - Strollers
generalInfo.childRule: Everyone regardless of age must have a ticket.

name: Toyota Oakdale Theatre

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Box Office and event info - 203-265-1501 Administrative offices - 203-269-8721 Group discounts are available for many of our shows. Minimum requirements, discounts and payment policies vary from event to event. Please contact Group Sales for event specific information at 203-269-8721
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Due to the ongoing global pandemic, and to protect the health and safety of our guests and venue staff members, the box office at Oakdale Theatre will be open on-day-of-show only. If you’d like to purchase tickets, please visit us at www.livenation.com. If you’re looking to obtain a refund for a show that was either canceled, postponed or rescheduled, please visit us at www.livenation.com/refund for more information. We look forward to seeing you at our next show at Oakdale Theatre
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, MasterCard, Visa, American Express and Discover cards. Credit cards will only be accepted from the account holder and picture ID is required. NO CHECKS OR SECOND PARTY CREDIT CARDS ARE ACCEPTED.Concessions stands accept cash only..
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is open during regular business hours and on event nights. Any unclaimed Will Call will be brought to the Administrative Offices for latecomers. Picture ID is required for all Will Call. The box office will not accept tickets to be left at Will Call. Please plan accordingly.

parkingDetail: All parking is on site. General parking is included in the price of your ticket. Premier parking is located in the lot closest to the main entrance of the facility for an additional charge and may be purchased in advance at all points of sale. Premier parking may also be purchased just prior to show time at the entrance to the lot. Sales are cash only and are subject to availability. Parking for the disabled is located in the spaces directly in front of the theater for no additional charge and is available to patrons who possess a handicapped parking sticker, hang tag or license plate.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Theater and all facilities are fully ADA accessible. Elevator access to all levels of the facility. Special seating is available for patrons with mobility impairments, visual impairments and hearing impairments. Infra-red hearing devices are available for all shows free of charge (ID required) at the Administrative offices.

generalInfo.generalRule: There is no dress code however shirts and shoes are required. This is a non-smoking facility. A smoking area is located outside of the lobby for attendees. Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. No laser pointers, weapons, large bags. No outside food or beverages are permitted into the facility. Concessions : The theater offers a variety of concessions items. Traditional fare is available at our concessions stands. A full bar is offered as well as beer and wine for adults 21 years and older. Picture ID is required for the purchase of alcoholic beverages. Concessions items are cash only.
generalInfo.childRule: Oakdale Theatre offers a wide variety of programming. Parents and guardians are urged to contact the box office for information on a specific show. For most events, children who have reached their second birthday must have a ticket and occupy their own seat. The availability of discounts for children is also event specific. Please ask at the time of purchase since we are not able to refund all or part of your purchase price. Please visit Oakdale Theatre at www.livenation.com for more information on a specific event.

name: Au-Rene Theater at the Broward Center

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: (954) 462-0222 option 1 for Ticketing Services
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Tuesday through Friday, 12:00 PM to 5:00 PM or 2 hours prior to event.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, MasterCard, Discover, American Express
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Pleae bring your valid photo ID and credit card to pickup pre-purchased tickets.

parkingDetail: Parking and Valet Services Arts & Entertainment District parking Garage. This secure, lighted 950-space parking garage is located directly across the street from the Broward Center at 101 SW 5th Avenue, on the corner of SW 5th Avenue and SW 2nd Street. Please note, this is a public garage and is not exclusive to Broward Center patrons. Parking is a $15 Flat rate per performance and must be paid upon arrival which is valid for 6 hours. Pay-by-meter available on the first and second floors of the A&E District Parking Garage. BrowardCenter.org/visit for more information.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available on-line, by phone or in person and can be limited. We encourage you to order early and to specifically request seating for wheelchair access, sign-interpreted or open-captioned performances when placing your order. General admission events offer no specific location you will be accommodated at the door. Our facilities feature ADA-approved signage, handrails and automatic door openers. The Wayne and Marti Huizenga Family Skywalk connects the Arts & Entertainment Parking Garage with the Horvitz Lobby in The Au-Rene Theater. The skywalk entrance provides protection from the elements and easy access for patrons with disabilities. A second entry is located at the bottom of the driveway entrance, immediately across from the Arts & Entertainment Parking Garage. Patrons with limited mobility may be dropped off in front of the Au-Rene and Amaturo Theaters via the front driveway. Hearing Devices: Our Assistive Listening Devices are available for all performances at the Guest Services Center, located in the Pacers Lobby Main Entrance. There is no charge for the device, but a valid major credit card is required. Restrooms: Wheelchair-accessible restrooms are located on the upper and lower orchestra levels, the lower mezzanine and the lower balcony in the Au-Rene Theater, as well as the upper lobby level of the Amaturo Theater. Companion restrooms are available on the upper and lower orchestra levels of the Au-Rene Theater. Diaper changing facilities are located in the first and second floor lobby restrooms.

generalInfo.generalRule: No professional (detachable lens) cameras, flash photography, audio or recording devices. Company Management or Artist camera policy varies by show. Smoking is not permitted.
generalInfo.childRule: Varies by event. Please call the AutoNation Box Office for more information. All patrons, regardless of age, must have a ticket. Lap seat tickets are available for select performances.

generalInfo.generalRule: ARRIVE EARLY: Please arrive one-hour prior to showtime. All packages, including briefcases and pocketbooks, will be inspected prior to entry. Packages, briefcases, knapsacks, cameras and video equipment will not be allowed in the theater. All patrons will continue to go through a screening process upon entry. As delays are expected, Madison Square Garden requests that for all events, ticket holders arrive as early as possible. No Smoking Allowed Anywhere in the Arena No Recording Devices No Outside Food or Drink
generalInfo.childRule: Children Rules: For most events, all children who have reached their second birthday require a ticket to gain admittance to Madison Square Garden. Any child who has yet to reach their second birthday does not require a ticket, however, they may not occupy their own seat and must sit on a parent's or guardian's lap. Please note, that for certain children's events (such as the Wiggles and Sesame Street Live!), all children who have reached their first birthday require a ticket. Please check the Madison Square Garden website (www.thegarden.com) for more information on a specific event prior to your purchase of tickets.
