name: Great American Ball Park

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: BOX OFFICE: (513) 765-7400 GROUPS: (20 or more) (513) 765-7600 ADA Assistance: (513)-765 -7500 and press prompt 3.
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: MAIN TICKET OFFICE: GAMEDAY: Monday-Sunday: 9 a.m. until the end of the seventh inning NON-GAME DAY: Monday-Friday: 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturday: 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. (Once single game tickets go on sale.) NORTH TICKET OFFICE (North side of Great American Ball Park): GAMEDAY: Opens one and a half hours before game time; closes at the end of the third inning NON-GAME DAY: Closed
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, Mastercard, Discover & American Express
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: All Reds tickets purchased through Ticketmaster (reds.com) internet and phone may be picked up anytime at the Great American Ball Park Ticketing Kiosks. Ticketing Kiosks are located at Crosley Terrace (2nd & Joe Nuxhall Way) and Gapper's Alley (north side of the ballpark). The original credit card must be used to obtain your tickets. Reds tickets purchased through other channels and drop-offs may be picked-up at the "paid" will call windows located at the Main Ticket Office at Crosley Terrace. These will call windows open one and half hours prior to scheduled game time. Photo ID is required to pick-up all tickets at will call.

parkingDetail: Parking for the Great American Ball Park is located on both the East and West sides of the ballpark. Single game passes are available to accessible patrons in the ballpark garage and the East garage or Central Riverfront Garage for $17 and $14 respectively. These passes may be purchased in person in advance of game day at the Central Riverfront Garage. For information on accessible or season parking passes, please call (513) 946-8100. On-Site Parking - There are 3,500 spaces on-site at Great American Ball Park. Day of game parking is available in Lots B or D for $12 or in the Central Riverfront Garage for $17 and the East Garage for $14.00. The Great American Ball Park parking lots open 3 hours before game time. MAIN PARKING OPTIONS: Lot D Location: West of Great American Ball Park outside of Gate 3. Lot D is located on Mehring Way between Elm Street and Joe Nuxhall Way. Access: Lot D can be accessed from Mehring Way from both the west via Freeman Ave., Central Ave. or Elm St. or the east via Pete Rose Way or Broadway. Cost: The price per game for Lot D is $12. Lot B Location: West of Great American Ball Park adjacent to the Central Riverfront Garage on Pete Rose Way. Access: Lot B can be accessed via Pete Rose Way at Central Ave. or Mehring Way from the west. Cost: The price per game for Lot B is $12. Central Riverfront Garage Location: Underneath and west of Great American Ball Park. Access: The Central Riverfront Garage can be accessed via Pete Rose Way at Broadway, or Mehring Way from the east or west, or Main Street. Cost: The price per game for the Central Riverfront Garage is $17. The parking pass color for this garage is Pink. East Garage Location: East of Great American Ball Park and adjacent to US Bank Arena with entrances on Pete Rose Way and on Mehring Way. Access: The East Garage can be accessed via Pete Rose Way from the east or via Second Street then east on Pete Rose Way. Access can also be via Mehring Way from the east or west. Cost: The price per game for the East Garage is $14 per game. The parking pass color for this garage is Blue.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible Access - The Reds are committed to providing every Guest with a comfortable and enjoyable experience at the ballpark. Great American Ball Park is a fully accessible ballpark for all Guests. Accessible parking is available in the Great American Ball Park Parking Garage for $17 and in the East Parking Garage for $14. While the number of accessible parking spaces is more than adequate, Guests are still encouraged to arrive at the time gates open to improve their chances of obtaining a accessible parking space. The accessible pickup/drop-off zone is located on Joe Nuxhall Way, from Second Street to Mehring Way, along the west side of Great American Ball Park. Cars, vans and small buses displaying a valid accessible placard or valid accessible license plate will be permitted to enter the pickup/drop-off zone beginning one half (1/2) hour before gates open to approximately one (1) hour after the conclusion of the game. Large school buses and large charter/tour buses are prohibited from entering this zone. Guests traveling to the ballpark in a large school bus or large charter/tour bus should contact the Group Sales department at (513) 765-7600 for information on bus pickup and drop-off locations. Great American Ball Park has accessible seating available in most seating areas. Accessible seating areas are equipped with electrical outlets for recharging purposes at no cost to the Guest. HEARING IMPAIRED: Assisted Listening Devices (ALD) - Guests can request the use of Assisted Listening Devices (ALD) at any Fan Accommodation Station in Great American Ball Park. ELEVATOR ACCESS: Elevators/Escalators - For the convenience of our Guests requiring special assistance, seven public elevators and three escalators are located throughout Great American Ball Park. There is an escalator inside Great American Ball Park located near Gapper's Alley. This escalator transports Guests from the Terrace Level to the View Level. However, this escalator does not access the Suite or Club Level. There is another escalator located on the west side of Great American Ball Park near the Reds Hall of Fame. This escalator transports Guests from the Terrace Level to the Club Level. Upon reaching the Club Level, Guests can use an adjacent escalator to reach the View Level.

generalInfo.generalRule: Rain Check Policies - In the event a regulation home game is not played, your rain check may be exchanged, subject to availability, at the main ticket office for a ticket to any subsequent regular-season home game during the current season. Any such exchange must be made through the main ticket office. Note that all paid Season Suite and Season Diamond, and Cincinnati Bell Technology Pavilion Seat Holders should follow the rain check instructions located on the back of their ticket. A rain check of a complimentary ticket (face value of $0.00) is not a valid rain check. CAMERAS: Cameras & Video Equipment - Guests are welcome to bring cameras and video recorders into the ballpark for personal use provided game action is not recorded, as required by Major League Baseball. Cameras and video recorders are welcomed provided their dimensions do not exceed the 16" x 16" x 8" Major League Baseball size requirement. Guests are requested to avoid standing in the aisles while using this equipment. Guests should not obstruct the views of others while taking pictures and refrain from using tripods, monopods and other camera support pods. The Reds reserve the right to remove any Guests who do not cooperate with this policy. CARRY-IN ITEMS - To ensure the safety of all Guests, players and employees, carry-in items will be inspected prior to entrance into the ballpark or at any time while inside the ballpark. Bags, backpacks, purses, etc. larger than 16" x 16" x 8" will not be permitted into the ballpark in accordance with the Major League Baseball size requirement. CONCEALED WEAPONS LAW - Great American Ball Park is a county facility and it is illegal to carry a firearm, deadly weapon, or dangerous ordinance in Great American Ball Park. Unless otherwise authorized by law, no person shall knowingly possess, have under the person's control, convey, or attempt to convey a deadly weapon or dangerous ordnance into the ballpark. A permit to carry a concealed weapon issued by this or any other state does not authorize the holder to carry weapons inside the ballpark. Off duty law enforcement officers are authorized, under law, to have a concealed weapon on premises. Off duty law enforcement officers who carry a concealed weapon to the ballpark are requested to notify a police supervisor upon entering the ballpark so their identification and seat location can be verified and noted. COOLERS - Guests are welcome Coolers - Guests are welcome to bring SOFT-SIDED coolers into Great American Ball Park provided the coolers' dimensions do not exceed the 16" x 16" x 8" inch Major League Baseball size requirement. HARD-SIDED coolers of any size are PROHIBITED from entering the ballpark. Coolers and all carry-in items are always subject to inspection by Reds personnel prior to entrance to the ballpark or at any time while inside the ballpark. The Reds are not responsible for HARD-SIDED coolers that are left outside of the ballpark gates. Guests are strongly encouraged to return their HARD-SIDED coolers to their vehicles.to bring SOFT-SIDED coolers into Great American Ball Park provided the coolers' dimensions do not exceed the 16" x 16" x 8" inch Major League Baseball size requirement. HARD-SIDED coolers of any size are PROHIBITED from entering the ballpark. Coolers and all carry-in items are always subject to inspection by Reds personnel prior to entrance to the ballpark or at any time while inside the ballpark. The Reds are not responsible for HARD-SIDED coolers that are left outside of the ballpark gates. Guests are strongly encouraged to return their HARD-SIDED coolers to their vehicles. NOISEMAKERS - Noisemakers such as cowbells, thundersticks, air horns, whistles, clappers and other such items that incur an audible nuisance upon Guests are not permitted in the ballpark. SMOKING POLICY - Ohio voters passed issue Number 5, on Nov. 7, 2006, which calls for a smoking ban in public facilities and places of employment under Ohio Revised Code Chapter 3794. Thus, Great American Ball Park has been designated as a completely non-smoking facility. Guests are not permitted to smoke inside of Great American Ball Park and are not permitted to exit and re-enter for the purpose of smoking. Violators may be subject to ejection and potential fines. Electronic cigarettes (e-cigarettes) are also prohibited.
generalInfo.childRule: Great American Ball Park offers complimentary admission to children 3 years of age and under. However, we do request that these children sit on their parents' or guardians' laps and not occupy additional seats. Promotional giveaway items are only available for ticketed guests. Tickets for children four years and older are priced the same as adult tickets.

generalInfo.generalRule: John Paul Jones Arena Entry Procedures and Bag Policy Screening procedures are used at all entry gates to John Paul Jones Arena. Walk-through and hand wand metal detectors are the primary means of screening. For guests who are unable to utilize a walk-through metal detector, hand-held metal detectors will be used. • Bags must be clear plastic, vinyl or PVC and cannot exceed 12" x 6" x 12" or clear one-gallon plastic freezer bags (Ziploc bag or similar) are also permitted. • Small clutch bags, approximately the size of a hand and no larger than 4.5" x 6.5" (with or without a handle or strap) can be taken into the stadium or arena and will be subject to search. • An exception will be made for items necessary for medical reasons after proper inspections at a gate designated for this purpose. • Items needed for small children must be in a clear bag that meet the stated dimensions. List of Prohibited Items:(Subject to change) • Bags or Backpacks larger than 12” x 12” x 6” – smaller bags must be clear/see through, with the exception of bags smaller than 4.5” x 6.5” (about the size of a hand) • Weapons, Fireworks or Confetti of any kind • Professional Cameras, Tablets or Computers • Aerosol containers • Umbrellas • Noisemakers or other distracting devices • Balls, Balloons, Frisbees, Sticks and similar items • Audio or Video Recording Devices • Outside Food and Beverage • Strollers • Containers, specifically including glass or plastic bottles, cans, coolers or flasks • Laser Pens/Pointers • Illegal Substances • Animals, except trained service animals • Signs, Flags and Banners of any kind

parkingDetail: Early Parking Lot Entry: You may park several hours before the posted parking lot time for an additional fee. Look for our Premier Parking signs or ask a parking attendant when you arrive at the venue. We'll be more than happy to point you in the right direction! Limo/Bus/RV/Oversized Vehicle Parking: Taking a limo, bus, or RV to the show? We've got room for you too! Oversized Vehicle Parking (including all types of Busses and RV's, Campers) is available for an additional charge. Accessible parking is located in the Alpine Valley Resort lot. All Parking Passes can be purchased in advance online and on the day of the show in our parking lots (subject to availability). Pricing for all upgrades may vary.

generalInfo.generalRule: SUBJECT TO CHANGE BASED ON EVENTS. To reduce staff contact with guest belongings, we have implemented the following bag policy: we will allow clear plastic, vinyl or PVC tote bags no larger than 12" x 6" x 12" and/or small clutch bags (6"x 9"). No other bags of any type will be allowed. Items PERMITTED in this venue include: -Cameras - nonprofessional only, no detachable lenses -Food - in a clear, 1-gallon ziploc bag -Water - Guests are permitted to bring in one (1) factory sealed bottle of water up to one gallon in size. This policy is subject to change based on artist requests or safety considerations. Aluminum bottles, refillable plastic water bottles are permitted. Camelbacks are not permitted -Signs - up to 8.5 x 11 inches (this is the size of a standard piece of paper). All signs must be appropriate in nature. Items NOT PERMITTED in this venue include: -Bags that do not meet our bag policy (must be CLEAR plastic, vinyl or PVC tote bags no larger than 12" x 6" x 12" and/or small clutch bags no larger than 6"x 9") -Weapons of any kind -Chairs of ANY kind -Strollers -Umbrellas -Alcohol -Illegal drugs/substances -Glass containers -Cans -Hard sided/large coolers -Laser pointers -Animals (except service animals) -Fireworks

Accessible seating locations can vary by event due to event layouts. Accessible seating is available for purchase via Ticketmaster.com, using the accessible filter. For assistance, please contact the Box Office at 972-912-1057.

generalInfo.generalRule: Information and restrictions vary by event and may change at any time. Such restrictions are at the direction of the event producers or artist and not Credit Union of Texas Event Center management. Please review all information on the event detail page for the event you are attending. Full venue policies are listed on CUTXEventCenter.com. Clear bags no larger than 14 x 14 x 6 are permitted. Clutch purses up to 8.5 x 5.5 are also permitted. Parenting bags are permitted when accompanying a child 2 years of age or younger. Strollers are NOT permitted inside Credit Union of Texas Event Center. Professional camera equipment and all audio and video recording equipment is strictly prohibited without prior approval. Guests are not permitted to bring in outside food or drinks into the venue.
generalInfo.childRule: Most events allow guests of all ages. Please check the event detail page for the event you are attending for any specific restrictions. Children sitting in a parent’s or guardian’s lap do not need a ticket if they are under two years of age for most concerts; or under three years of age for sporting events. All guests occupying a seat, regardless of age, must have a ticket for that seat.

name: La Crosse Center

address.line2: (Located On 2nd Street Across From Holiday Inn&Suites)

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Event information line, pre-recorded event information: 1-608-789-7410. Box office: 1-608-789-7415 La Crosse Center main office: 1-608-789-7400. Website: www.lacrossecenter.com Email: office@lacrossecenter.com
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Box office located inside main arena lobby doors. The Box Office is open Monday-Friday from 11am to 4pm. Open nights and weekends by event. Box office accepts cash, Visa, & MasterCard.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, Disc and MasterCard.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is available beginning one hour prior to the event. A will call table is typically in the main lobby to the right of the box office windows. Tickets can be picked up at the box office windows after the show begins.

parkingDetail: 4 downtown parking ramps are available. The two closest ramps are located at the 2nd and Jay St intersection, near the La Crosse Center. The Main Street ramp is located on 3rd Street which is approx. 3 blocks north of the La Crosse Center. The Market Square ramp is located approx. 3 blocks east of the La Crosse Center on Jay Street. The La Crosse Center, Main St. & Market Square parking ramps have the following hourly fees: Weekdays 6am to 6pm = $1/hour with the first 3 hours free Weekdays 6pm to 6am = free parking Maximum daily rate = $8 Weekends = free parking SPECIAL EVENTS PARKING FEES MAY APPLY. Motorcycles, scooters & bicycles receive free parking at all times but in designated ramp areas only.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Elevators, seating sections accessible for wheelchair patrons, TDD phone, and ALD's are available upon request. Guests are advised to contact the box office at 1-608-789-7415 for these accommodations as soon as possible.

generalInfo.generalRule: Prohibited items at the La Crosse Center include: outside food or beverages, animals,guns,drugs, alcohol, and coolers. The camera policy at the La Crosse Center varies on the event. For most events a standard flash camera is allowed but no Videocameras,digital cameras or tri-pods are allowed.
generalInfo.childRule: Varies by event. Sesame Street Live and Disney Live! - any child 1 and over needs a ticket. For most shows children 2 and under do not need a ticket if they sit on an adult's lap.

ada.adaCustomCopy:
Ticketmaster, on behalf of its clients, strives to make it as easy as possible to purchase accessible seating tickets for venues across the country. Most venues offer accessible seating areas to accommodate their guests. Availability and type of accessible seating tickets will vary based on each venue's policies and/or the type of event taking place. Note: Venues are solely responsible for establishing their own accessible seating ticket policies. Some venues sell all or a portion of their accessible seating tickets only through their box office and not through Ticketmaster.
Fan Support Hours

The Box Office is open Monday to Friday from 11am to 4pm.  Open nights and weekends by event.
ada.adaHours: The Box Office is open Monday-Friday 11am to 4pm. Open nights and weekends by event. Box office accepts Cash, Visa,  & Mastercard.

name: GLC Live at 20 Monroe

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Monday 12pm-6pm and Friday 12pm-6pm. On the day of an event, the Box Office opens 2 hours before doors and closes once the headliner takes the stage.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, VISA, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. We do not accept checks.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call orders can be picked up at the Box Office window on the day of the event only. The Box Office opens 2 hours before doors. The original purchaser must bring a valid form of identification to pick up tickets.

parkingDetail: GLC Live at 20 Monroe does not have dedicated parking, but there are many city garages, lots, and meters nearby. Find more information on the Downtown Visitor Mobility and Parking Guide: https://www.grandrapidsmi.gov/Government/Departments/Mobile-GR/Downtown-Mobility-and-Parking-Guide GLC Live at 20 Monroe has partnered with ParkWhiz to offer easy and reliable parking options. Visit ParkWhiz to book parking here: https://www.parkwhiz.com/20-monroe-live-parking/
accessibleSeatingDetail: Both levels of the venue are accessible to guests using wheelchairs or other mobility aids, except for the theatre-style seating sections in the Mezzanine level. The best way to secure accessible seating is by purchasing an ADA seat online. Look for the ADA icon in the filters on the ticket purchase screen. Up to one companion seat is allowed. If there are no ADA tickets available, or if you have already purchased tickets that will not meet your needs, please contact the venue ahead of time to request accommodations. We will always do our best to relocate you to a location that meets your needs, based upon available space. You can request accommodations by calling (616) 482 2027 or by emailing 20MonroeLiveInfo@LiveNation.com.

generalInfo.generalRule: For more information including door times, show times, support acts and other FAQs please visit www.GLCLiveat20Monroe.com. Prior to entering the venue, guests will be searched (wand or walk through metal detection and/or pat-downs) to ensure that no restricted items enter the building. You may be asked to empty your pockets of all items so that they can be examined. Bags up to 12 inches x 6 inches x 12 inches are allowed in the venue. Large bags and backpacks are not allowed. All bags will be searched prior to entry. Bags that are not clear will be subject to additional search. If you are found impaired at the door, security will not allow you to enter the venue. Event staff reserves the right to refuse entry to anyone. Please come with a smile and be prepared to enjoy a fun filled night of music and dancing. Live Nation is dedicated to providing a safe environment. Public and private security will be present throughout the entire event. The Security Staff will be available to assist your needs including any medical requests.
generalInfo.childRule: All guests must have a ticket regardless of age. Some shows may be restricted to certain ages. Please check the event ticketing page for age restrictions.

name: Bojangles Coliseum

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Phone: 704.335.3100 (Tickets cannot be ordered over the phone. Call 800.745.3000 to purchase tickets)
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The main box office is located on the south side of Bojangles Coliseum. Regular hours are Wednesday and Friday 10am to 5pm. Show days we open 2 hours prior to the event start time at Bojangles Coliseum Box Office.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, MasterCard, American Express and Discover. All credit card purchases require a photo ID.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will call orders can be picked up at the box office during normal business hours or right before the event. (Note: Certain events may not allow will call pick-up until the day of the performance.) Please bring a picture id, the credit card used to make the purchase and the order number. Tickets will only be released to the person whose name is on the account.

parkingDetail: Facility parking lots are located immediately to the left after turning onto Briar Creek. Auxiliary parking lots (if needed) are located immediately to the right. ADA parking is available. For most events, parking is included in your ticket price. There are some events that is not included in your ticket. Parking fees range from $6.00 - $10.00 per vehicle.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available for patrons with disabilities. Tickets can be purchased through all sales channels. Those wishing to purchase accessible seats are allowed to have up to three companions sitting with them (based on availability). Bojangles Coliseum strongly encourages those needing to purchase tickets in accessible seating areas to do so as far in advance as possible. All accessible seating will be allocated on a first-come, first-served basis. Every effort will be made on the day of an event to accommodate those needing accessible seats but are holding a ticket for a conventional seat but all such exchanges are based on availability. Accessible seats are located in Sections 106, 108, 110, 121, 123 and 125.

generalInfo.generalRule: Video cameras, flash cameras, laser pointers, outside food or beverage and weapons are prohibited at Bojangles Coliseum. Any non-clear bag larger than 4.5" x 6.5" and clear bags larger than 12" x 6" x 12" are not allowed. These include but are not limited to: backpacks, briefcases, camera bags, cinch bags, computer bags, fanny packs, coolers of any kind and luggage of any kind. All patrons are subject to search. No re-entry. Bojangles Coliseum is a tobacco-free facility. No tobacco products or e-cigarettes may be used on the premises, either inside or outside. Prices listed include all applicable taxes.
generalInfo.childRule: Children 2 and under do not need a ticket for entry provided they sit on adults lap. Certain events may have different rules regarding the age which children need a ticket.

Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. Please note there are NO refunds or exchanges unless an event is cancelled or postponed. Smoking is NOT permitted inside the building. PLEASE NOTE: The below items are prohibited. (Keep in mind priority number 1 is to HAVE FUN! Just please do so without the items listed below) • No Outside Food or Drink Allowed • No guns, knives, weapons, pepper spray, projectiles of any kind, or any other item that could be used to inflict harm. • Replicas of any type of weapon are NOT permitted • No drugs, drug paraphernalia or illegal substances of any kind • No personal video cameras, Go-Pros, selfie sticks, drones, masks or laser pointers. • No professional audio, video, or audio recording equipment - (including detachable lenses, tripods, zooms or commercial use rigs) • No unsealed liquids or gels of any kind • No jewelry or clothing that could inflict harm • No large bags over (10" x 10"), backpacks, Camelbacks or Bota bags • No stuffed animals or toys of any kind
generalInfo.childRule: All patrons must have a ticket regardless of age. Some events may have age restrictions in place so please check our website or call the venue directly at (801) 456-2800 for specific show information.

generalInfo.generalRule: * ITEMS -NOT- ALLOWED IN FACILITY : no backpacks no large bags no large purses no stroller no alcohol no food no beverages no coolers no pets no cameras no recording equipment no laser pointers no weapons no drugs no chains/spikes no umbrellas no selfie sticks no e-cigarettes *NOTE: Grills or Fireworks may NOT be brought into the parking lots. For safety of all guests, concert goers may be subject to search. Please arrive early to avoid lines. * ITEMS ALLOWED : small bags and purses * SMOKING POLICY : Smoking is NOT allowed in the venue. Refund Policy for Cancelled Shows: Tickets for all canceled shows will be refunded at point of purchase. If the tickets were purchased online through Ticketmaster, this will be done automatically by Ticketmaster and no action is required. If the tickets were purchased at the Hard Rock Event Center Box Office, you can receive your refund by visiting the Box Office or Rock Shop during normal business hours. You must have your ticket and original credit card used to purchase your ticket when requesting a refund. Refund Policy for Postponed Shows: For events that have been postponed, the original tickets will automatically be valid for the new date. Once announced, if you cannot attend the new date, the ticket purchaser has 30 days to request a refund. The sale will be considered final 30 days after the announcement. The same refund process for canceled shows noted above should be followed within the refund window. Ticketmaster will not automatically process a refund for a postponed show. You must contact Ticketmaster directly within the 30 day window after announcement. Please note: Questions regarding tickets purchased anywhere other than Ticketmaster, the Box Office or Rock Shop should be directed to the company/marketplace where you purchased the tickets. Seminole Hard Rock Tampa is not responsible for tickets purchased through unauthorized resellers.

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: (808) 768-5252 (event information recording)

Monday to Friday, 10:00 AM 2 (two) hours prior to the start of the event. Saturday, Sunday & Holidays, 9:00 AM 2 (two) hours prior to the start of the event
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, MC, AMX, DSC & Cash. No Checks. ATM located nearby.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will call may be picked up at any window at any time that the box office is open. Customers do not need to wait until the night of the show.

parkingDetail: Cost: Event Parking: Before 5PM: $6.00 After 5PM: $7.00 In/Out Pass: $8.00 (In/Out Good Only For Day of Purchase @ Parking Booth) Non-Event Parking (Daily): $6.00 VIP Parking available for select events - $23.00 Elite VIP Parking: VIP Parking is open for ticket holders only, subject to availability Select Blaisdell Arena events – enter off of Ward Ave., South (Makai) of Box Office Select Concert Hall and Exhibition events – enter off of Ward Ave. between Exhibition Hall and Concert Hall Note: No left turn permitted on Ward Ave. into driveways Hours of Operation – 1 hour prior to event until end of event time VIP Parking Customer Service: For Elite VIP Parking purchased through Ticketmaster call customer service at 1-877-750-4400 Box Office Parking: Box Office Parking is open for ticket buyers only. Parking for the patrons of the Box Office is free. If Box Office Parking is full, ticket buyers may enter through the King Street Gate. The ticket buyers will be re-funded the parking fee after they validate their ticket at the Box Office. King Street Entrance: This is the main entrance to the Blaisdell Parking Lot. The gate opens at 5:30 a.m., Monday through Saturday. The gate closes at 6:00 p.m. on all evenings with no event scheduled. The gate closes 45 minutes after the last event is completed. On Sundays and Holidays, gate operation is determined by events. Kapiolani Entrance: This entrance is closed when there are no events scheduled. Only cardholders can access this gate when it is unattended. Signs are posted to direct non-card holders to the King Street entrance. This gate will also be open two hours prior to the opening of all major events scheduled in the central areas and will remain open until the completion of the last event. Hours of Operation: Non-Event Days (Mon-Fri) 5:30am - 5:00pm Event Days (Mon-Fri) 5:30am - end of night (event night) Event Days (Weekends & Holidays) 2 Hours prior to start of event - end of night Parking Booths close 45 minutes prior to end of last event.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available in the lower level of Blaisdell Arena. No elevators for upper level or loge seating.

name: Center Theatre at North Shore Center for the Performing Arts

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Tue-Sat: 11am-5pm or until showtime on all performance days; Sunday open two hours prior to showtime
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express, Cash, and checks made payable to North Shore Center
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Patrons with tickets held at Will Call may pick up during regular box office hours or on the day of the event. Patrons must present the credit card used in transaction and a valid photo ID.

parkingDetail: Parking is plentiful and FREE at the North Shore Center. There may be traffic control officers at the facility entrances to direct you to parking areas. We appreciate your cooperation as they assist you in getting parked and into the theatre in a timely manner. There is also paid valet parking available for select performances. The back parking lot directly east of the North Shore Center is available for patrons. Additional garage parking is available after 6pm on weeknights and all day on the weekends east of the Centers parking lot. A second entrance to the garage is accessible off of Gross Point Road. The parking lot in front of the North Shore Center belongs to the DoubleTree Hotel and is intended for guests of the hotel and restaurant.
accessibleSeatingDetail: The North Shore Center for the Performing Arts in Skokie is fully compliant with the Americans with Disabilities Act. Both theatres feature wheelchair accessible seating locations, for patrons who wish to remain in the wheelchair, or transfer out of the wheelchair into a theatre seat. These seats are also available to be used by companions of patrons who are using wheelchairs. If you require accessible seating due to limited mobility, please contact the box office by phone and ask your ticket agent for availability. For patrons with hearing impairment: The North Shore Center features a ListenTech RF assistive listening system available for all shows on a first come, first served basis. We ask that patrons using these devices please leave a drivers license, state identification card or credit card with the House Manager until the device is returned at the end of the performance. Both facilities are also equipped with telecoil loop systems which are a special type of sound system for people who use hearing aids. The loop system provides a magnetic wireless signal that is picked up by a hearing aid when it is set to the T setting (telecoil).

generalInfo.generalRule: All ticket sales are final. There are no refunds or exchanges. Patrons who have misplaced or forgotten their tickets may have their tickets replaced at no charge. Please inquire in person at the box office when you arrive for your performance. Patrons arriving for a performance after the stated start time may be seated at a time and seat location based upon the House Managers discretion. For some performances, there may be no late seating. Cameras and audio or video recording equipment are not permitted in the theatres and may be stored with the House Manager or Security Personnel.
generalInfo.childRule: All patrons entering the theatre must be ticketed, regardless of age. This includes children who are likely to share a seat with their adult guardians. Strollers are not permitted in the theatres and may be stored with the House Manager or Security Personnel.

generalInfo.generalRule: No cameras, audio or video recording devices are allowed in the Pearl. Any such devices may be subject to confiscation. At 5pm, day of show, tickets will no longer be sold online. Please contact or visit the Box Office to purchase tickets. There are no refunds or exchanges for tickets purchased. if an event is cancelled or rescheduled, tickets may be refunded at the original point of purchase. If tickets are lost or stolen, you should immediately contact the original point of purchase to inform them of the loss. Lost tickets are similar to lost cash, and tickets will be not be reissued unless ownership of a seat location can be verified. Reissue of a lost ticket is not guaranteed. If the ticket purchase can be confirmed, the box office will reissue the ticket to the original purchase for which we will charge a service fee of $5.00 per order.

generalInfo.generalRule: No cameras or recording devices. Upon Rochester Police Department recommendation, the Mayo Civic Center will begin implementing the following safety and security measures for all public events effective Sat Oct 27, 2001: * Patrons should enter the Mayo Civic Center via skyway or the Circle Drive Main Doors. In most cases, all other entrances will be locked. * All purses, bags and briefcases are subject to search. * Items such as sharp objects, weapons, pocket-knives, chains, aerosol spray cans and noisemakers such as cow bells, whistles and fog horns will be confiscated. * Backpacks, coolers, containers of any kind including water bottles, and outside food and beverages cannot be brought into the Center and will be confiscated. * Vehicles will not be allowed to park in fire lanes, loading zones, docks or service areas. Unattended vehicles will be ticketed and towed. * Any vehicles parked near entrances, on patios, sidewalks or grassy areas or in Mayo Park will be ticketed and towed. * All service doors, including Door 12, will be locked and unavailable for public access. The public's patience and cooperation is greatly appreciated.

parkingDetail: From Route 93 (North or South): Medford Square is easily accessed from Route 93. Take Exit 32 for Rt. 60 West. At the rotary, follow the parking attendant who will direct you to the suggested parking behind Medford City Hall. From Route 2 (East or West): From Route 2 take Exit 59 and follow the signs for Route 60 East. Stay on Route 60 East through Arlington, and into Medford. Route 60 goes right into Medford Square. When you get to the main intersection in the middle of the square take Riverside Drive to City Hall Mall where you will find the suggested parking behind Medford City Hall. There is also plenty of on street paring (Free after 6pm) and municipal parking lots within a few blocks of the theatre.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating policy: The Chevalier Theatre places high priority on the comfort and safety of its patrons. The Chevalier Theatre also recognizes the needs of people with disabilities, as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) of 1990. Every effort has been made to comply with both ADA and Commonwealth accessibility guidelines to accommodate patrons with disabilities. Accessible seating can be purchased directly via www.ticketmaster.com. Accessible seats will be marked with an ADA icon. For assistance purchasing ADA seats online, please contact Ticketmaster customer service at 800-653-8000. PLEASE NOTE: When a show is over 85% sold any unsold accessible seating will be opened to the general public.

If you are interested in purchasing tickets, you must do so online or at the box office, as we do not provide sales over the phone. Phone Numbers : General Info Number....212.614.6932

accessibleSeatingDetail: Yes. Meeting the needs of all of our guests is a top priority. For general admission shows, please purchase a general admission ticket and speak to a staff member upon arrival. We suggest you get to the venue early. If the show is reserved seating, please purchase accessible tickets online via Ticketmaster. Feel free to call us with any questions.

generalInfo.generalRule: Age restrictions vary by show but are mostly all ages. All bags will be searched, which can increase wait time to get through security. Safety is of utmost importance to us. Please try to travel lightly. We do not allow outside food or beverages (our bar is the best!). Leave your weapons at home. For more information visit: https://www.thegramercytheatre.com/plan-your-visit.
generalInfo.childRule: Age restrictions vary by show but are mostly all ages unless otherwise noted. Please see event info for details.

ada.adaPhones: You can reach the venue directly by calling 212-614-6932 or emailing gramercytheatre@livenation.com.
ada.adaCustomCopy: While our venue is standing room only, we do have an ADA section for qualified patrons. We also have ADA ramp access into the building and ADA restrooms. We suggest you get to the venue early for best viewing options in the ADA area.  Please note that each ADA guest is allowed up to three companions. Please purchase ADA accessible tickets or general admission tickets and speak to staff upon arrival. Please reach out to the venue with any questions: call 212-614-6932 or email gramercytheatre@livenation.com.
ada.adaHours: Our Box Office is open only on show days, starting at the advertised door time. We also invite you to call or email the venue if you have any questions or concerns, and well respond to your message as soon as possible

name: The Magnolia

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Due to the ongoing global pandemic, and to protect the health and safety of our guests and venue staff members, the box office at The Magnolia will be open on-day-of-show only. If you’d like to purchase tickets, please visit us at www.livenation.com. If you’re looking to obtain a refund for a show that was either canceled, postponed or rescheduled, please visit us at www.livenation.com/refund for more information. We look forward to seeing you at our next show at The Magnolia.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, VISA, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. We do not accept personal checks and gift cards.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will call orders can be picked up directly at the Box Office. The original purchaser must bring their credit card and a valid form of identification in order to pick up any tickets. Will call tickets are only available for pick-up the day of the scheduled event, 2 hours before doors.

parkingDetail: There are two lots available for event parking. Parking is free in all City lots in the area. The North Lot is accessible off of Magnolia Ave and Park Ave (approx. 120 spaces). No overnight parking, 2am. - 6 a.m. There is a parking structure on the east side of the venue, accessible off of W.D. Hall and Main St. (approx 400 spaces). Public parking after 4 p.m. M-F. Rideshare info: Easy drop-off or pick-up for ridesharing guests is available at the corner of Rea Ave and Sulzfeld Way.

generalInfo.generalRule: For more information including door times, show times, support acts and other FAQs please visit www.TheMagnoliaSanDiego.Com Live Nation and House of Blues Entertainment are committed to providing a safe and secure environment for our guests to enjoy their visit to our Theaters and Clubs. We encourage you to review our safety and security information below prior to arrival at the venue. • Please arrive early to the venue to allow enough time for you and your guests to move through the queue and enter the venue. • Prior to entering the venue, guests will be searched (wand or walk through metal detection and/or pat-downs) to ensure that none of the restricted items enters the building. • We suggest you leave valuable and unnecessary items at home. • You may be asked to empty your pockets of all items so that they can be examined. • All alcohol and narcotic laws will be strictly enforced. • All bags will be searched, no large bags or backpacks will be allowed. Restricted Items: (Keep in mind priority number 1 is to HAVE FUN! Just please do it without the items listed below) • No guns, knives, weapons, pepper spray, projectiles of any kind, or any other item that could be used to inflict harm. • Replicas of any type of weapon are NOT permitted • No drugs, drug paraphernalia or illegal substances of any kind • No outside food or drinks • No personal video cameras, Go-Pros, selfie sticks, drones, masks or laser pointers. • No professional audio, video, or audio recording equipment - (including detachable lenses, tripods, zooms or commercial use rigs) • No unsealed liquids or gels of any kind • No jewelry or clothing that could inflict harm • No large bags over (10” x 10”), backpacks, Camelbacks or Bota bags • No stuffed animals or toys of any kind • This list of prohibited items is subject to change at the discretion of venue management Zero Tolerance for Drug Use or Possession • The use or possession of any illegal drugs will not be tolerated anywhere inside or outside the venue. Security personnel and narcotics officers will be working and enforcing all drug related laws. Do not bring any illegal substances to the event as violators will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law. If you are found impaired at the door, security will not allow you to enter the venue. Event staff reserves the right to refuse entry to anyone. Please come with a smile and be prepared to enjoy a fun filled night of music and dancing. Safety and Medical • Live Nation is dedicated to providing a safe environment. Public and private security will be present throughout the entire event. The Security Staff will be available to assist your needs including any medical requests. For more information please call: (619) 494-5620
generalInfo.childRule: All patrons must have a ticket regardless of age. Some shows may be restricted to certain ages. Please check the venue website for updated information.

generalInfo.generalRule: General Rules: Most shows are 21+ with Valid ID to enter the venue. Age restrictions General Rules: Please check the age restrictions before purchasing your ticket to a show. Age restrictions change depending on show. 21+ shows require a Valid ID to enter the venue. 18+ shows require a Valid ID to enter the venue. Accepted forms of ID are current and non-expired: State Issued ID or Driver’s License, Military & Passport ID. Guests are not permitted to bring bottles, cans, weapons, back packs, posters, outside food and beverage items, stickers, cameras with detachable lenses, audio/video recording devices, tripods/monopods, alcohol, drugs and illegal substances, large bags or backpacks inside the venue. There are no "in's and out's" permitted. All sales are final. We don't offer refunds or exchanges unless a show is canceled. Please keep in mind that support acts and set times are subject to change at any time and this does not warrant a refund.

name: Gorge Amphitheatre

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: ADDRESS: 754 Silica Road NW George, Washington 98848 Phone (206) 607-3440 Email: gorgeinfo@livenation.com
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: For the safety of our employees and guests, the box office will be closed until further notice. Please keep checking back here for updates as to when we re-open. We appreciate your understanding.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: U.S. Cash, MasterCard, Visa, American Express and Discover.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets held at will call can be picked up on the day of the performance during the Box Office hours of operation. (Subject to change). The customer must present a valid form of identification, the actual credit card used, and the confirmation number to pick up their tickets.

parkingDetail: Lot opening times vary by show, but usually open 4 hours before posted event start time. PLEASE CALL THE VENUE AT 509-785-6262 FOR FURTHER INFORMATION The Gorge Amphitheatre has two parking options; Regular or STAR Parking. Designated parking area for physically challenged patrons is available at the front gate. Please follow the signs or parking staff direction upon entering the main lot. The parking lot gate, normally opens at 12:00pm, Although times may vary depending on the event. Sorry, no overnight parking. (See Gorge Camping) STAR PARKING: Upgrade to STAR Parking for convenient parking. Benefit from the easy access and exit to and from this reserved parking lot. You will be guaranteed a spot within easy reach of the main gates.. For overnight stays please see the camping section. Please note: By order of the Grant County Sheriff's Department, there is no parking or camping on county roads or private property leading to or adjacent to the venue. The county ordinances strictly prohibit the consumption of alcoholic beverages in the parking lot, and these laws will be strictly enforced.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible Seating, please inform your Ticketmaster representative (if you are calling) or requesting on-line, if you need reserved seating or general admission seating. With each accessible seat purchased, up to 3 companion tickets may be purchased. Anyone who is disabled and not in a wheelchair can request to use a folding chair for use in this space. Please contact a staff member for assistance. Please note there is NOT an accessible seating purchase option in general admission. Should you need accessible assistance in the general admission section, please visit a Guest Services kiosk after entering the venue for relocation to the accessible section of the lawn. For those needing assistance, a special services vehicle can transport physically challenged patrons near to their seating section, for more information: https://www.livenation.com/venues/14067/gorge-amphitheatre Only trained service animals are allowed into the Amphitheatre

generalInfo.generalRule: For the safety of all Gorge patrons, please follow these simple rules: * No alcoholic beverages can be brought into the venue. There are alcohol beverage stands and lounges where you may purchase throughout the venue. Please bring a valid WA State approved ID. Acceptable forms of ID: A Driver License, ID Card, or Instruction Permit issued by any U.S. State or Canadian Province. A Washington Temporary Driver License (paper license). A U.S. Military ID. An Official Passport. A Merchant Marine ID. A Washington State Tribal Enrollment Card. ALL RULES SUBJECT TO CHANGE WITHOUT NOTICE. Beer and wine can be purchased and can be taken to your seat in General Admission or Reserved areas. • No lounge and elevated chairs. Beach style are OK and rental chairs are available. • No laser pointers • Empty plastic drinking water containers will be allowed in. One factory sealed water bottles of 20 oz. size will be allowed in. Sorry, no factory sealed soda bottles please. • Food in clear plastic gallon sized bag (one per patron) will also be allowed in. No large, hard-shelled coolers or ice chests. • School-size or small backpacks are normally allowed in, but may be subject to change at the artists request. All bags are subject to visual search. NO Large Backpacks. • Emergency medical personnel and ambulance transport is on site. Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. Subject to change at the artists request.
generalInfo.childRule: Children under the age of 2 are free in General Admission Lawn seating. Every one including Children will require a reserved ticket to access the reserved seating area. All ages are allowed inside the amphitheatre.

If you are looking to obtain a refund for a show that was either canceled, postponed or rescheduled, please visit us at www.livenation.com/refund for more information. We look forward to seeing you at our next show at the RMA.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, MC, AMEX, and Discover cards. No checks or Live Nation/Ticketmaster gift cards.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is available at the box office 1-2 hours prior to door time. Valid photo ID of account holder is required to pick up tickets. For additional inquiries, contact the box office at 951-779-9800.

parkingDetail: Parking is available in a number of nearby City of Riverside lots and garages, as well as metered street parking. For additional parking inquiries, please visit https://riversideca.gov/parking/downtown-parking.
accessibleSeatingDetail: For reserved seated events, accessible seating is available online and at the box office. For general admission events, please purchase a General Admission ticket and notify a Guest Services representative of accommodations needed upon entry. Accommodations are subject to availability. The balcony section is only accessible by stairs. For additional information, please call 951-779-9800.

generalInfo.generalRule: Smoking only allowed in designated smoking areas. Restricted Items: (Keep in mind priority number 1 is to HAVE FUN! Just please do it without the items listed below) No guns, knives, weapons, pepper spray, projectiles of any kind, or any other item that could be used to inflict harm. Replicas of any type of weapon are NOT permitted. No drugs, drug paraphernalia or illegal substances of any kind. No outside food or drinks. No personal video cameras, Go-Pros, selfie sticks, drones, masks or laser pointers. No professional audio, video, or audio recording equipment - (including detachable lenses, tripods, zooms or commercial use rigs). No unsealed liquids or gels of any kind. No jewelry or clothing that could inflict harm. No large bags over (10 x 10), backpacks, Camelbacks or Bota bags. No stuffed animals or toys of any kind. This list of prohibited items is subject to change at the discretion of venue management.

name: Arena Theatre

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Box Office - 713-772-5900
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Monday - Friday: 10am - 6pm (Central Time) Saturday & Sunday - Open at 12 noon ONLY if an event is scheduled. Please call ahead! 713-772-5900
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, MasterCard, American Express and Discover
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Arena Theatre Lobby • A confirmation number, picture ID, and the credit card used to purchase the tickets are required to pick up tickets at the box office. • Will-Call tickets purchased through official Arena Theatre points of purchase, by phone or over the Internet are available for pick up 2 hours prior to the event start time and can be picked up at the designated will-call window. • Tickets or passes left by touring personnel usually arrive in the box office approximately one hour before the event start time. Unfortunately, the Arena Theatre box office personnel have no way of knowing who is to receive tour personnel tickets until they are delivered to the box office by the tour company. • Box office will not accept will call tickets left by patrons

parkingDetail: Self serve parking garage onsite -- $10 per vehicle.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available at Arena Theatre. For additional information regarding the availability of accessible seating please call the box office at (713)772-5900, or send an email to ticketing@arenahouston.com

generalInfo.generalRule: No Cameras, No Video Cameras or Recording Devices, No iPads No Weapons No Outside Food or Beverages No Refunds, No Exchanges, No Reprints
generalInfo.childRule: Everyone including children and infants must have a ticket for admission. Discounted ticket prices for kids are SOMETIMES available for various shows. Age restrictions and the amount of the discount vary by event and are at the discretion of the touring act. Arena Theatre must rely on parents, guardians and those responsible for supervising children under 13 to decide which events are appropriate for such children to attend. Additionally, Arena Theatre cannot prohibit minors from visiting this site and advises you that parental control protections (such as computer hardware, software, or filtering services) are commercially available that may assist you in limiting access to material that may be deemed harmful to minors.

name: Stifel Theatre

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Effective July 1, 2024, the Stifel Theatre Box Office is open on event days only beginning at noon through approximately one hour after the start of the event. On days when there is an event at both Stifel Theatre and Enterprise Center, the Stifel Theatre Box Office will open at 2 p.m. For guests wanting to purchase tickets in-person for Stifel Theatre events, they may also do so at the Ticketmaster Box Office at Enterprise Center during current operating hours. Ticketmaster Box Office at Enterprise Center is open on event/game days only, beginning at Noon through approximately one hour after the start of event/game. The Box Office will be closed on non-event days. On non-event days, guests may purchase their tickets online at ticketmaster.com. You can contact the Box Office by phone by calling 314-622-2551. Limited, 15-minute street parking is available for ticket buyers directly in front of the steps of Stifel Theatre on Market Street, or in the garage attached to Enterprise Center. Enter the garage from Clark Avenue or 16th Street. Credit cards are the only method of payment accepted at Kiel Garage. DOORS: 1 hour prior to ticketed event time. GROUP SALES : Call (314) 499-7676 PAYMENT ACCEPTED AT BOX OFFICE : AMEX, VISA, MC, DSC. Stifel Theatre is a cashless venue.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Box Office Accepts MasterCard, Visa, Discover and American Express.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Customer must present actual credit card used to place the order, the confirmation number and a photo ID. Tickets held at Will Call may be picked up beginning 2 hours prior to show time.

accessibleSeatingDetail: In addition to the Box Office & Ticketmaster.com, tickets for guests with disabilities may also purchase through the Accessibility Hotline at 314-622-5420. To arrange seating for a group with special needs, please call Stifel Theatre Group Sales at (314) 499-7676. Tickets to Stifel Theatre events are sold to persons with disabilities on a first-come, first-serve basis. When purchasing tickets, please inform your ticket seller about any needs that may require accommodation, including companion seating or use of a service animal.

From the West: Take I-20 to Exit 194 (GA-383 N/Dyess Pkwy) toward Belair Rd. Turn left onto GA-383N/Dyess Pkwy. Travel approximately 4.3 miles. Continue straight across Washington Road. generalInfo.childRule: Please note that all guests require a ticket, regardless of age unless otherwise noted on a per event basis. Children must be able to sit quietly in their own seat without disturbing other guests. Some shows make further age appropriate recommendations, and CCPAC will provide those on its website; however, parental discretion is always advised, and judgment of the content for each show should be made on an individual basis prior to purchase.

name: The Rady Shell at Jacobs Park
Shoreline Amphitheatre

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Our box office is open 10am-2pm each Wednesday and Saturday, and otherwise from 2pm on show days (staying open from 10am on Wednesdays and Saturdays with shows).
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Shoreline Box Office accepts VISA, MASTERCARD, DISCOVER and AMERICAN EXPRESS; cash and checks are NOT accepted.

parkingDetail: General Parking is included in the ticket price for most events at Shoreline Amphitheatre. When it is not included, there will be a fee per car. Premier Parking is available for purchase. Pricing varies by event. Your Premier space at the head of the parking lot is held until show time. Your space will be close to the front gate regardless of what time you arrive to the venue prior to show time. DIRECTIONS TO THE PREMIER PARKING LOT: From HWY 101, take Amphitheatre Pkwy (from the South) or Rengstorff Blvd (from the North) Exit. Follow the signs along Amphitheatre Pkwy to the Premier Parking Lot.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Shoreline Amphitheatre and all on-site amenities are 100% wheelchair accessible. Accessible parking spaces are available in the front lots.

generalInfo.generalRule: Shoreline Amphitheatre is a cashless venue. All shows go on RAIN OR SHINE. By city ordinance, the following are restricted at Shoreline Amphitheatre: - Smoking is not permitted. - Alcoholic beverages, barbeques, and tailgating are not permitted in the parking lots. This is strictly enforced by Shoreline Amphitheatre and the Mountain View Police Department. GENERAL POLICIES: The general policies listed below are subject to change on an event-by-event basis. It is STRONGLY suggested that you call the Shoreline Business Office at 650-967-3000 on the day of the show you are attending to get the specific rules for that event. Permitted Items include: - Clear plastic, vinyl or PVC tote bags no larger than 12in x 6in x 12in and/or small clutch bags (4.5inx 6.5in). - Factory sealed water bottles up to one gallon in size - Small blankets - Sealed water bottles. For a more detailed list of permitted and non-permitted items, please visit: https://www.livenation.com/venuesecurity/ CHAIR POLICY: Please Note: Outside lawn chairs are NOT allowed into the venue. BLANKET POLICY- the following are permitted for most shows: - Blankets/towels no larger than 4ft x 4ft FOOD & BEVERAGE POLICY- the following are permitted for most shows: - Food provided it fits in a clear plastic bag, no larger than 1 gallon in size. One bag per guest. - One factory sealed plastic bottle, 20 oz or smaller, containing a non-alcoholic beverage (not frozen) per guest. CAMERA/VIDEO POLICY: In general, small digital and disposable cameras are allowed in the venue for most shows. Video recorders, flash photography, removable lens cameras, and iPads/Kindles/E-Readers/GoPros are NOT permitted. The venue has the right to restrict ALL CAMERAS, at any time, without prior warning. The following items are NOT permitted: - Glass containers, cans, alcoholic beverages - Coolers, backpacks or oversized bags/purses - Audio or video recording equipment - Professional cameras, including iPads/Kindles/E-Readers/GoPros - Large lawn chairs - Umbrellas, Pets, Stickers, Skateboards, Aerosol Cans, Tables, Barbecues - Laser pointers, wallet chains, knives or weapons **ALL POLICIES ABOVE ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE ON AN EVENT-BY-EVENT BASIS** The venue has the right to restrict any items at any time without prior warning. It is STRONGLY suggested that you call the Shoreline Business Office at 650-967-3000 on the day of the show you are attending to get the specific policies for that event.
generalInfo.childRule: Children 2 and under do not require a ticket, but must sit on a parent's lap if in reserved seating.

name: Indianapolis Motor Speedway

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Regular Hours: 9am - 5pm, Monday through Friday Event Hours: Office hours extended during events
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Indianapolis Motor Speedway Ticket Office accepts checks, money orders, cash and credit cards (Visa, MasterCard, Discover and American Express). Checks or money orders are only accepted up to 14 business days from the purchased event.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Call the IMS Ticket Office at 317-492-6700, Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET, and our representative will update the delivery status to hold for Will Call. Your ticket packet will be available at the IMS Ticket Office for pick-up upon your arrival. Once your order has been processed, notification for pickup will be sent to your email address. A valid photo ID is required to pick up your packet. We recommend that you also bring a copy of your notification email as well. The IMS Ticket Office is located in the Administration Building at 4790 West 16th Street, Indianapolis, IN, 46222. This is east of the roundabout at Crawfordsville Road and 16th Street, outside Turn 1 at the track. The parking lot entrance is across the street from the Speedway Gas Station on 16th Street. For your convenience, the IMS Ticket Office is open extended hours during event times as noted on the IMS Ticket Office website page.

accessibleSeatingDetail: Arrangements can be made through the Indianapolis Motor Speedway Ticket Office to accommodate guests who require accessible seating and parking. Accessible seats and spaces for wheelchairs and companion seats are available. To purchase ADA Tickets and Parking or for questions regarding ADA, please contact the IMS Ticket Office at (800) 822-INDY (4639), or locally at (317) 492-6700 or ada@brickyard.com.

generalInfo.generalRule: Payment must be made in full at the time of the order. All ticket sales are final. NO REFUNDS. The Indianapolis Motor Speedway reminds fans that purchasing tickets from secondary, unauthorized vendors may result in fraudulent purchases. Fans are encouraged to purchase tickets directly from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway Ticket Office. Remember that event tickets/products should be treated like cash. If your tickets/products are stolen, please call the Indianapolis Motor Speedway Ticket Office at (800) 822-INDY (4639) or (317) 492-6700 for assistance.
generalInfo.childRule: Any person, regardless of age, must have a reserved seat ticket for admittance to seating areas. Children 15 and under will receive free General Admission to select IMS events when accompanied by an adult General Admission ticket holder. All children, regardless of age, MUST hold a reserved seat ticket to access the grandstands on Race Day, where applicable.

boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is located at the Box Office. For events that occur on a weekday, the office will open at 10:00am. parkingDetail: ExtraMile Arena encourages patrons to allow at least 45 minutes to park and access ExtraMile Arena. Parking is sold in advance for the Arena and Stadium lots, as well as Lincoln Garage. For patrons who did not pre-purchase parking, a parking fee will be collected by an attendant as you enter the parking lots. Depending on the event, parking costs typically range from $5.00 to $15.00. For parking prices for a particular event or to purchase parking, please contact the Box Office at (208) 426-1766. On the day of an event, parking can no longer be purchased prior to arrival. Patrons will need to purchase parking in cash when they arrive on-site for the event. Parking lots open 1 hour before doors.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible Seating is shown on the Interactive Seat Map and can be purchased online. Accessible Seating can also be purchased at the Box Office. The number of accessible seats is limited. Please be respectful of those in need of these seats. Companion seating is limited to 3 per person and will be located as close as possible to the accessible seating, based on availability. For more information and assistance please call (208) 426-1766.

generalInfo.generalRule: All guests entering the Arena may be subject to metal-detector screening, visual inspection, and bag inspection conducted by ExtraMile Arena security personnel. Prohibited items include anything that can be deemed a threat to public safety by ExtraMile Arena and include, but are not limited to, the following: video recording or streaming devices, iPads, selfie sticks, outside food or drink, large bags or backpacks, weapons of any kind including chains, spikes, collars, some jewelry or any implement that could be used as a weapon, fireworks/pyrotechnics of any kind, laser pointers, glow sticks or flashbulbs. Smoking and vaping are not permitted inside the venue.
generalInfo.childRule: All persons entering the venue require a ticket. Children’s events may have a unique policy for infants/toddlers; contact the Box Office for ticketing policies for a specific event. Please ask an Usher about our SAFE program which provides wristbands for reuniting individuals that may become separated from their party.

parkingDetail: o General Public Parking:From Anderson, SC: Take Hwy 76 towards Clemson and turn left onto Perimeter Rd. The C-1 parking lot is located off Perimeter Rd on the right after you pass the SC Botanical Gardens. The upper portion of this lot is a $30/vehicle general public lot. There is a pregame shuttle from the lot to the east side of Cooper Library. o From Greenville, SC: Take Hwy 123 to the Hwy 93 exit. Then take the next exit for Hwy 76 towards Anderson. The South Carolina Highway Patrol will direct you to Perimeter Rd off Hwy 76 to access general public lots (C1, Kite Hill or the Walker Golf course driving range). Kite Hill and Walker course driving range are free but do not offer pre or post-game shuttle service. C1 is a pay to park lot but does provide a pregame shuttle to the east side of Cooper Library. o Handicap Parking: Handicap Parking is available at the parking lot at Sikes/Long Hall and Parkway Dr located on campus off Hwy 93 near Tillman Hall and Bowman Field. With your state issued handicap parking placard or license tag you can park in this parking lot for free. Upon entry into the lot a uniformed officer will verify your handicap parking placard and give you two wristbands (one for the person the pass is assigned to and one for an assistant). The wristbands will serve as your ticket to use the handicap accessible shuttles to and from Gate 1 of Memorial Stadium. Shuttle service begins 3 hours prior to all home games.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Please contact the Clemson Athletics Ticket Office at 864-656-2118 for any accessible seating needs.

name: Everwise Amphitheater at White River State Park

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Administration: 317-776-8161
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The box office at Everwise Amphitheater will be open on-day-of-show only. It is located on the east side of the Visitor's Center at White River State Park. If you would like to purchase tickets, please visit us as www.EverwiseAmphitheaterAtWhiteRiverStatePark.com. We look forward to seeing you at our next show at Everwise Amphitheater.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: American Express, Mastercard, Visa, and Discover
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: All 2024 events will be Mobile Entry. That means your mobile device will be used to gain access to the event. Tickets will not be emailed or available for print (for previously scheduled shows where you selected print at home or mail, your tickets will be honored accordingly). You have two options to access your tickets: 1. Add tickets to your mobile wallet by downloading the Ticketmaster App. - Click My Tickets and select your upcoming show. - Add the ticket(s) to your phone's wallet and you're done! - Present your mobile ticket(s) at entry 2. Add tickets to your mobile wallet by visiting Ticketmaster on your mobile browser. - On your mobile phone, visit ticketmaster.com in your web browser and select My Tickets. - Sign in and select your desired order. - Add the ticket(s) to your phone's wallet and you're done! - Present your mobile ticket(s) at entry. Phone troubles? Visit the box office on event day for assistance. Be prepared to show your ID. Additional Tips: Purchase tickets for a group? Arriving separately? Transfer tickets directly to friends and family using the Ticketmaster App. To expedite entry, we recommend doing this prior to arriving at the event. - Using the Ticketmaster App or your phone's web browser, sign in to your account. - Select the desired order and tap Transfer Tickets (event eligibility may vary). - Select the ticket you'd like to transfer. Add the recipient's information and send. The recipient will receive an email with the ticket. Due to large crowds and high traffic, be sure to leave early and give yourself plenty of time at the venue. Increase your phone screen brightness to assist with scanning. Lastly, make sure you have a fully charged battery!

parkingDetail: PREMIER GARAGE PARKING: 650 W. Washington Street Indianapolis, IN 46204 Premier Garage Parking guarantees 1 parking space in the White River State Park underground parking garage. Limited number of parking spaces available in advance. VIP PARKING: 801 W. Washington Street Indianapolis, IN 46204 VIP Parking guarantees one parking space in the White River State Park surface parking lot located steps away from the main ticket gates. Additionally, expedited exit from the lot is included. INDIANAPOLIS ZOO PRE-PAID PARKING: 1200 W. Washington Street, Indianapolis, IN 46222 Indianapolis Zoo Pre-Paid Parking guarantees 1 parking space in the Indianapolis Zoo Main Parking Lot after 4:30pm. Limited number of parking spaces available in advance. Conveniently located less than a mile from Everwise Amphitheater at White River State Park. When attending a concert at Everwise Amphitheater or any other event at White River State Park, including cheering on the Indianapolis Indians at Victory Field, additional parking is available in a garage located at the corner of Maryland and West Streets. When the Indians are not in town, parking may be available in the Victory Field lot for special events. Parking fees may be charged.

accessibleSeatingDetail: Customer can purchase up to 4 accessible seats (1 wheelchair, 3 companion). Orders of 4 can be sold together from accessible seating but if there are 5 or more in the party, then please contact the venue for their approval to sell adjacent accessible seats to the customer. The Lerner Theatre has partnered with KultureCity® to enhance our ability to assist and accommodate guests with sensory needs. Our goal is to provide an inclusive experience for all guests during all events. We strive to raise awareness of the needs and challenges faced by individuals with sensory processing needs by supplying our staff with annual training and by offering the resources and accommodations below to our guests. KultureCity® Sensory bags containing special KCVIP badges, feeling thermometer, fidget tools, and noise-canceling headphones are available for checkout (at no cost by leaving an ID) at our Coat Check counter located in the Main Lobby. Sensory bags can be used for all abilities of all ages.

generalInfo.generalRule: Doors open 1 hour before event. Patron bags exceeding 14 inches by 14 inches by 6 inches (14" x 14" x 6") are not permitted inside The Lerner. The term "bags" includes, without limitation, backpacks, briefcases, luggage, duffle bags, musical instrument cases, purses, boxes, packages and carry alls. All bags are subject to search at the discretion of management and/or security personnel. Exceptions are made for bags used to carry medical equipment and diaper bags for customers with small children. Guests with prohibited items will be turned away from the entrances to return items to their vehicles or to dispose of them. No storage or "check in area" will be provided for prohibited items. Lerner management reserves the right to deny any item it deems to be a safety hazard. No outside food or beverages permitted.
generalInfo.childRule: All children 3 years of age and under are considered a lap child and do not need a ticket; however, if they require a seat, then a ticket purchase is needed.

PLEASE NOTE: CHURCHILL DOWNS DOES NOT ALLOW DROP OFF WILL CALL. generalInfo.generalRule: Weather Policy: Festival and concerts take place Rain or Shine. The following items may not be brought onto the premises: weapons (including concealed weapons), umbrellas are prohibited on Oaks, Derby and Breeders’ Cup days, missiles (or any item which may be used as such), thermoses, backpacks, luggage, duffel bags, wagons, balloons, grills, charcoal, glass, tents, alcohol or any substance which is prohibited by Kentucky or Federal Law. Attempts to bring them onto the premises will result in confiscation or refusal of access to the premises. This list is illustrative only. Other items may be prohibited as a condition of admission. Use of cellular telephones or similar communication equipment, or public telephones at Churchill Downs by patrons is allowed for personal and/or business purposes only. Use of such equipment to engage in illegal wagering or transmission of odds, race results, or related gambling information is strictly prohibited by Churchill Downs. Chairs may be brought into the infield for the Kentucky Oaks & Derby through the Infield Gate (4th Street) only. No chairs are permitted in the Grandstand, or Clubhouse. For a complete list of items that are permitted and prohibited on Kentucky Derby & Oaks Days, visit kentuckyderby.com.

generalInfo.generalRule: All patrons are subject to a security search. The following items are not permitted in the Arena: cameras, recording devices (audio or video), weapons, bottles, cans, fireworks, outside food, beverages, or alcohol, lasers, spiked jewelry, chains (including those on wallets), backpacks, large purses or bags, glow sticks, & other items deemed unsafe to others. No re-entry. No smoking in arena. Smoking in designated areas only. What is the Policy for Bags? Each ticket holder, including children, may carry one approved clear bag, such as a one-gallon storage bag, plus a small purse. The following bags will be permitted inside the CAJUNDOME & Convention Center and are subject to search. • Clear plastic bag that does not exceed 12” by 6” by 12”. • Clutch or small purse, with or without a strap, that does not exceed 6.5” by 4.5”. • Equipment bag for necessary medical items. • Diaper bag for age-appropriate children accompanied by an adult. • Prohibited bags include, but are not limited to: large purses, duffle bags, coolers, briefcases, backpacks, fanny packs, mesh bags, or any bag larger than the permissible size 12" x 12" x 6". Tinted or printed-pattern plastic bags are not clear, so they will not be permitted

generalInfo.generalRule: Patrons will be subject to bag checks and wanding when entering the venue. Security will perform an ID check at the time of ticket scanning and give wristbands to those patrons of drinking age. Premium ticketholders will receive a wristband at the same time (2 total if drinking age). Those under drinking age will not receive a wristband and will have an X marked on their hand.

boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: For those who purchase tickets in advance and choose will call delivery, tickets can be picked up on the day of the show at the box office starting two hours prior to the scheduled door time. The purchaser must present their valid photo ID along with the credit or debit card used for the transaction in order to pick up the tickets. Delmar Hall can only release the tickets to the purchaser, with proof of ID, and cannot release tickets to third parties, no exceptions. If the will call order name must be changed, the purchaser can call Ticketmaster at 1.800.653.8000 to request a will call name change or log-in to their Ticketmaster account and click transfer tickets. Any name changes done via Ticketmasters phone system must be completed at least 24 hours prior to the show.

generalInfo.generalRule: The following Findlay Toyota Center bag policy and security protocols are in effect for every event. Management reserves the right to amend the list below without notice depending on individual event restrictions. Please visit www.FindlayToyotaCenter.com for event specific information. • Each fan may carry in a small bag or purse (subject to search) • Firearms and weapons are strictly prohibited • No outside food or beverage, alcohol, or bottled water is permitted • All guests are subject to security screening PROHIBITED ITEMS Guests are reminded that the following items will not be permitted inside Findlay Toyota Center. There are no provisions to store items not allowed inside and items cannot be held by security staff members. Management reserves the right to restrict any article not specifically listed on the prohibited list. - Aerosol Cans - Alcohol - Animals (except for service animals) - Banners or signs larger than 3' x 2' - Beverages of any kind (including bottled water) - Beverage containers - Bottles, cans and thermos bottles - Brooms - Cameras with professional photo lenses (larger than 8 inches) - Chewing tobacco and E-cigarettes - Clothing deemed obscene or indecent - Coolers of any kind - Fireworks - Folding chairs - Food (except for children under the age of two) - Basketballs, footballs and beach balls (inflated or deflated) - Illegal drugs - Laptop computers - Laser Pointers - Mono/tripods - Noise Makers (whistles, horns, bells, etc.) - Poles or Sticks of any kind, including "Selfie-Sticks" - Umbrellas larger than 12 inches in length - Video Cameras - Weapons - including, but not limited to, firearms & knives - Any item deemed inappropriate or hazardous by stadium security
generalInfo.childRule: For most events, any child who has not reached their 2nd birthday does not need a ticket, but they must sit on the lap of the ticket holder. All children 2 years and older require a ticket to enter. This policy may vary by event. Please check the event details page on our website www.findlaytoyotacenter.com.
