These items cannot be checked-in at Guest Services. - No alcohol - No drugs - No glass bottles or cans - No skateboards or in-line skates - No fireworks - No baby strollers - No professional cameras (those with a detachable lens), video and audio recording devices (including GoPros or tablets) - No selfie sticks - No hula hoops - No glow sticks - No smoking other than in designated smoking areas - No coolers - No sunscreen or bug spray (both will be available at Guest Services) - No moshing or crowd surfing Permitted Items: - One factory-sealed bottle of water per guest (maximum size of one liter) - Small blankets - Clear plastic, vinyl, or PVC tote bags (no larger than 12"x6"x12") and/or small clutch bags (no larger than 4.5"x6.5") - Portable cell phone charger stick

parkingDetail: There are 9 lots adjacent to amphitheatre. **Accessible parking with a government issued placard/hangtag/plate does not require the customer to also purchase the premier parking upgrade.** Parking lots generally will open 1 hours prior to show time. Please call our administrative office for exact time. Tailgating / Alcohol in the Parking Lot -There is a City of Raleigh open container ordinance that is in effect in all parking lots. -This City ordinance specifically prohibits open containers of beer or wine. -The State of North Carolina laws also restrict open consumption of liquor of any kind. -Officers from the Raleigh Police Department, Wake County and State of North Carolina Alcohol Beverage Commissions regularly patrol parking lots. -Coastal Credit Union Music Park at Walnut Creek welcomes fans who want to picnic before shows; however, cars must occupy only one parking space. Grills are not permitted on sidewalks, in roadways, near buildings or in any area where guests or property may be damaged. -Glass bottles are also discouraged. -Beer, wine, and mixed drinks are served inside venue with proper I.D. -Please always drink responsibly and appoint a designated driver.
accessibleSeatingDetail: This venue is accessible. Accessible parking with a government issued placard/hangtag/plate is available and does not require the customer to also purchase the premier parking upgrade.

generalInfo.generalRule: We want you to bring everything you need to make your visit to Coastal Credit Union Music Park at Walnut Creek the best. The items below may vary from show to show, but this listing can be useful as a general guide. If a certain item (listed or unlisted) is essential to your concert enjoyment, please call our administrative offices at 919-831-6400 on the show day for specific information on the show you plan to attend. Our list of items to bring or not bring are designed to be fair to everyone and meet a combination of safety goals including providing smooth access into the venue when we have large crowds. Our goal as your host is to provide an atmosphere that allows for the maximum enjoyment of the entire audience and we apologize in advance if some restrictions may cause you any inconvenience. WHAT TO BRING: -clear plastic, vinyl or PVC tote bags no larger then 12in x 6in x 12in and/or small clutch bags (6in x 9in) -Blankets -Binoculars -Stadium Seat Cushions (with no metal parts) -Ponchos or Rain Jackets -Water: One sealed bottle of water allowed per patron or empty bottle (metal or plastic) up to 1-gallon in size -Food in a clear 1-gallon sized Ziploc type plastic bag Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. WHAT NOT TO BRING: -Non-clear bags larger then 4.5in x 6.5 in and clear bags larger than 12in x 6in x 12in -Alcohol -Bottles -Cameras -Coolers -Illegal Drugs. -Laser Pointers -Ipads -Umbrellas (small tote size only please) -Aerosol bug spray cans -Chairs with leg or roof attachments -Pets (except service animals) -Recorders (audio or video) -Weapons -Strollers. Please note that strollers are welcome through the gates and on the lawn but cannot be taken into the reserved seating area. Fans may check them at our Guest Service Booths. -Small camping or lawn chairs with no leg or roof attachments Arrive at the gates with NO BAGS of any kind and head into the show quickly via our "No Bags Express Lanes" located at the Main Gate! The No Bag Express Lane is located to the LEFT of the Main gates.
generalInfo.childRule: Kids Under 2: -Children under the age of 2 years will be admitted free to all events as long as they sit in the Adult patrons lap and do not utilize an additional seat. -This policy applies to both the lawn seating area and the reserved seating areas.

accessibleSeatingDetail: Yes, Briar Street Theatre strives to provide all patrons with a full and equal experience. Please call the box office at 1-800-BLUEMAN for special seating accommodations. A limited number of removable seats are available on the main floor for each performance to accommodate patrons with wheelchairs. Please note: Balcony seating is not wheelchair accessible.

generalInfo.generalRule: No smoking, cameras, video or recording devices. Strobe lights will be used during the performance. There is no dress code, casual dress in encouraged. Poncho Area: Parts of the show require that customers wear a poncho to protect clothing. Ponchos are provided by the venue. Merchandise is available for purchase at the theatre and there is a lobby bar with limited drink selections before the show.
generalInfo.childRule: Recommended for children 3 years and up. All children must have a ticket. Blue Man Group has moments when it reaches noise levels of a rock concert. It is strongly encouraged children wear ear plugs. Ear plugs can be provided to you at the theatre by our Front of House staff. Out of respect for other patrons, unruly children may be asked to leave the theatre and will only be admitted back into the theatre at the House Managers discretion.

parkingDetail: Fans without season parking permits are encouraged to take advantage of the following free single-game parking options: Parking Structure #2 - Accessible from University Drive near the W.T. Young Library Parking Structure #3 - Kentucky Clinic parking off Virginia Avenue Parking Structure #6 - On the corner of Virginia Avenue and Press Avenue All parking lots open at 8 a.m. ET on game day. For more information about single-game parking, visit UKathletics.com/GameDay.
accessibleSeatingDetail: A variety of ADA seating options are available. Patrons requiring accessible seating should call the UK Ticket Office at (800) 928-2287 if online seating is sold out.

generalInfo.generalRule: A clear bag policy is in effect at Kroger Field. Visit UKathletics.com/ClearBag to learn more. Additionally, the following items are not permitted inside Kroger Field: • Outside food & drinks, including alcoholic beverages • Firearms • Portable heaters & combustibles • Glass, aluminum containers, hard-shell koozies & ice chests • Artificial noisemakers, irritants & laser pointers • All illegal substances, tobacco products & electronic cigarettes • Poles, extensions or selfie sticks
generalInfo.childRule: Due to the unique nature of events at Kroger Field, everyone must have a ticket, regardless of age. Fans wishing to bring infants (12 months and under) to a Kentucky football game at Kroger Field may purchase a lap ticket at a discounted rate of $10. This ticket will allow the infant to enter the venue, but that infant must sit on their parent/guardian's lap. If a seat must be occupied by the infant and/or carrier, a regular ticket must be purchased. Lap tickets are only available on game day and may be purchased at the Kroger Field ticket office (between Gates 9 & 10) for $10, when accompanied by an adult with a ticket. This lap ticket policy only applies to regular-season home football contests. For more information on infant & youth tickets, please call the UK Ticket Office at (800) 928-2287.

accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available through Ticketmaster and the Box Office. When ordering tickets, it is important to indicate that you require accessible seating so we can properly seat you. To secure ADA seating do any one of the following: * On-Line at www.ticketmaster.com - select your event, and then click on the "Accessible Seating" icon to purchase. * Call Ticketmaster at (800) 877 7575 * Visit one of Ticketmaster's outlets. Accessible parking is available in several locations; behind the box office (very limited availability), as well as Lots B, C and G. Parking lot entrances are off Vermont Avenue. All lots include spaces for rear-loading and side-loading vans and have accessible paths of travel to seating areas. Greek Theatre parking is very limited, including accessible parking which frequently sells out in advance. Accessible parking is also available in the off-site shuttle parking lot located at Crystal Springs Drive/Los Feliz Blvd. All Shuttles are ADA accessible.

name: Oracle Park
accessibleSeatingDetail: WHEELCHAIR ESCORTS Giants Guest Services staff provide wheelchair escorts. Simply ask a Giants employee at any gate and an attendant will meet you with a wheelchair to take you to your seating location. Reservations are not accepted. Please note that due to inventory, we are not able to loan wheelchairs to guests for the duration of the game. If wheelchair assistance is needed during the game, we encourage fans to bring their own. For a return wheelchair escort, please notify the nearest aisle attendant at least 15 minutes prior to your departure.

generalInfo.generalRule: BAG POLICY Paper and plastic grocery bags, purses, fanny packs, backpacks, lunch bags, diaper bags (backpack-style), soft-sided containers, handbags and briefcases are allowed into the ballpark as long as they do not exceed 16" x 16" x 8" in size. All bags will be thoroughly inspected before they are permitted into the ballpark. ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE POLICY No alcohol (including non-alcoholic beer and wine) or illegal drugs may be brought into AT&T Park. Once inside the park, alcoholic beverages can be purchased throughout the ballpark. SMOKING POLICY In accordance with San Francisco City Ordinance, AT&T Park is a SMOKE-FREE facility with no smoking areas. Smoking is not permitted anywhere in the ballpark. Electronic cigarettes and vaporizers are included in this prohibition. The ballpark smoking policy is subject to change at the discretion of Giants management. WHEELCHAIR ESCORTS Giants Guest Services staff provide wheelchair escorts. Simply ask a Giants employee at any gate and an attendant will meet you with a wheelchair to take you to your seating location. Reservations are not accepted. Please note that due to inventory, we are not able to loan wheelchairs to guests for the duration of the game. If wheelchair assistance is needed during the game, we encourage fans to bring their own. For a return wheelchair escort, please notify the nearest aisle attendant at least 15 minutes prior to your departure.

generalInfo.generalRule: As the sun sets over the skyline, enjoy one of Philadelphia's tastiest summer traditions with a pre-concert dinner at the Mann! Whether you prefer a beautiful buffet dinner with seasonal fare; a picnic on the Great Lawn; or delicious freshly-prepared casual food and drink on your way to your seat, the Mann offers a variety of dining and drink options. Most importantly, every option comes complete with a spectacular view of the Philadelphia skyline…not to mention…the sun, the moon and the stars! http://manncenter.org/dining Food & Beverage / Picnics Picnics are welcome on the lawn for all Philadelphia Orchestra performances. If you're planning on picnicking on the lawn pre-concert and moving to your reserved seat undercover when the performance begins, please be sure that your cooler is small enough to be stowed under your seat. No glass containers are allowed undercover. Kegs and mini kegs are not permitted into the theater. No outside food or beverage will be permitted into concerts with popular artists. Restrictions are indicated at the bottom of all event pages. One 20oz bottle of water per person is permitted for all shows. Chairs & Blankets Low-backed lawn chairs (no more than 28 inches high) are permitted on the lawn for Main Stage performances only. Lawn chairs of any kind are not permitted for Skyline Stage performances. Small blankets are permitted for all shows, but we do ask that you be mindful of your neighbors on the lawn or in front of the Skyline Stage. Cameras Small personal cameras and camera phones are allowed in the Mann unless prohibited by the performing artist. Advance notice of camera policy change will be posted prior to patron entering the gate and included in pre-concert emails (when possible). Flash photography, professional camera or recording equipment (including cameras with detachable lenses, any form of camera stand or audio/video recording devices) and iPads/tablets for the purpose of photography are prohibited. Photography of any kind is prohibited during orchestra performances. Patrons found possessing professional equipment not expressly authorized will be asked to check their cameras at Visitors' Services or be else will be escorted from the venue. Dogs Service animals are welcome, but no pets, please. Strollers Strollers are strongly discouraged at all events. The Mann does not have designated parking areas for strollers.

generalInfo.generalRule: Venue only permits clear bags (up to 12" x 6" x 12") or small clutch bags (up to 6.5" x 4.5"). All bags and patrons are subject to search and metal detectors for entry. The following items are prohibited: audio/video recording devices; bags as governed by clear bag policy; balls or frisbees; cameras with lenses greater than 6" or detachable lenses; canes (non-medical use) chains or sticks of any length; car seats or strollers; coolers/ice chests; drones; firearms (including with a permit) or knives or other weapons; fireworks or explosives; folding chairs; illegal drugs; laser pointers or noisemakers; laptop computers; large golf or non-telescopic umbrellas; outside food & drink; pets (except service animals); signs, banners, flags or other view-obstructing items. Any object determined to be hazardous or potentially diminishing the enjoyment of the event by other guests at the sole discretion of venue or Wake Forest staff, Wake Forest University Police Department or Winston-Salem Police Department may be prohibited. If a prohibited item is discovered after entry, the item shall be confiscated and disposed of and the guest may be ejected from the facility, denied re-entry and ticket price will not be refunded.

However, guests can bring in a bag up to 12 X 6 X 12 in size. These bags DO NOT need to be clear, although clear bags are appreciated. For faster entry, we suggest arriving with either no bag or the smallest lightly packed bag that can accommodate your needs. This will help our team expedite your entry into our venue. Lost & Found: For lost and found, please visit: https://uptowntheater.app.pixithq.com/public/#!/lost-found to claim your item.

generalInfo.generalRule: CAMERAS: Cameras and recording devices are strictly prohibited PROHIBITED ITEMS: The following items are prohibited: Backpacks, collars, thermoses, cans, bottles, flasks, alcohol, laser pointers, duffel bags, guns, knives, strollers, banners, video and movie cameras, professional cameras, weapons, and any other items which may pose a security risk CLEAR BAG POLICY: We're committed to ensuring all of our guests have a positive experience, and the safety of our arena is essential to maintaining this experience. Because of our commitment to your safety, we are implementing a new policy on bags brought into the Peterson Events Center effective 11/1/2021. The policy affects the type and size of bags that are permitted into the arena. Each fan may carry in their pockets items such as keys, makeup, combs, phones, wallets, and credit cards. Fans will continue to be able to carry in jackets. -Bags that are clear plastic, vinyl, or PVC and do not exceed 12 inches x 6 inches x 12 inches -One gallon clear plastic freezer bag (Ziploc bag or similar) -Logo on bag cannot exceed 4.5 inches tall by 3.4 inches wide -Small clutch purses, approximately the size of a hand, or 4.5 inches x 6.5 inches with or without a handle or strap, may be carried into the arena along with one of the clear bag options -An exception will be made for medically necessary items after proper inspection at entry -Diaper bags are permitted, but will be searched and tagged by security personnel -Each member of a family, including children, will be able to carry an approved clear bag and a clutch purse.

parkingDetail: Discounted Parking Available! LAZ Parking Services Garage at 111 E. Wacker Drive (Illinois Center). Receive a discount for up to 4 hours of parking. If you park longer than 4 hours, discount is no longer valid. IMPORTANT: You must have your parking ticket stamped at our ticket window to receive the discounted rate. Note: LAX Parking Services at 111 E. Wacker is not owned or affiliated with Chicago’s First Lady Cruises. The parking information posted here is merely for the convenience of our guests and is not to be construed as a recommendation or endorsement.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Guests with limited mobility please visit www.cruisechicago.com/accessibility for drop-off location and directions. Please present yourself to our staff if you prefer early boarding. Chicago's Leading Lady and Chicago's Classic Lady are wheelchair-accessible and offer a wheelchair-accessible family restroom. Tickets for tours on these vessels can be purchased by selecting the 9am, 10am, 11am, 12pm, 1pm, 2pm, 3pm or 4pm departure times. Please also note that all Chicago Architecture Center downtown walking tours are wheelchair accessible.

generalInfo.generalRule: This 90 minute cruise of the Chicago River is complete with educational commentary provided by trained Chicago Architecture Center certified docent guides aboard Chicago's First Lady Cruises fleet. The tour covers the following routes on the Chicago River: 1. Michigan Ave. & E. Wacker Dr. (starting point) 2. Main branch of river (Canal St. to Navy Pier) 3. South branch of river (to Roosevelt Rd.) 4. North branch of river (to Chicago Ave.) ● Capture Chicago Photography Cruise summer Saturdays and Sundays only at 9am. Move freely around the boat and have access to all angles while a highly-trained docent points out architectural highlights along the way. The tour will pause three times giving you the prime opportunity to capture the city's architecture. ● Our evening cruises run summer weeknights at 5:30p & 7:30p GENERAL ADMISSION SEATING - OUTDOOR SEATING IS GUARANTEED CLIMATE CONTROLLED INTERIOR SALON with air conditioning available on first come, first served basis. CRUISE TAKES PLACE RAIN OR SHINE THERE ARE NO REFUNDS OR TIME EXCHANGES (Tickets are date and time specific) EVERYONE MUST HAVE A TICKET (Infants and children included)
generalInfo.childRule: - All children and infants need a ticket to board the boats. Infant priced tickets are available. - There are no reduced rates for seniors or children over 3 years old. - Please note: This is an adult oriented event. - Strollers must be folded and stored in the dining salon - Due to Coast Guard regulations everyone who boards the boat MUST have a ticket, even infants and children.

ada.adaCustomCopy: Guests with limited mobility please visit www.cruisechicago.com/accessibility for drop-off location and directions. boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Louisville Palace Box Office also serves as the primary box office for the Mercury Ballroom. The Box Office is located to the immediate right of the Louisville Palace Theatre entrance and is open for sales on Mondays & Tuesdays from 12PM to 5PM and Fridays from 12PM to 5:30PM. On show days, the box office will be available at the Mercury Ballroom. It will open 2 hours prior to the show start and close when the headliner takes the stage.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Box Office accepts MasterCard, Visa, American Express, Discover and cash.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets can be picked up at the Will Call Window one hour prior to scheduled show time. Customers must have a picture ID, the actual credit card and the confirmation number.

parkingDetail: There is The Clay Commons Garage and the Fifth St. garage and after hours parking on the streets. Additionally, Mercury Ballroom has partnered with ParkWhiz to offer other easy & reliable options. To book parking: https://www.parkwhiz.com/the-mercury-ballroom-parking/?utm_medium=LiveNation&utm_source=1269&utm_campaign=Web_LN_ParkingPage_VenueLink
accessibleSeatingDetail: For Handicapped Accessible seating, please call (502) 583-4555 #1 from the menu

generalInfo.generalRule: The Mercury Ballroom is a standing room only general admission house. No cameras/flash photography, audio or video recording is permitted without venue approval. Cell phones can be used for pictures, at the artist discretion. There is no re-entry into the venue and there is no smoking allowed inside.
generalInfo.childRule: All children regardless of age must have a ticket unless otherwise specified by the shows promoter.

name: Spotlight 29 Casino

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: 760-775-2506 During Box Office hours 760-775-5566 Main line when Box Office is closed
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Box Office is available on show days from 4p to 9p. Tickets can also be purchased at Cage 24/7 inside Spotlight 29 Casino
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, MasterCard, Discover, American Express & cash
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call can be picked up 2 hours prior to showtime at the Box Office outside of the Spotlight showroom. The Box Office closes 1/2 hour after start of event.

parkingDetail: Free Valet parking is available. Over 1,000 parking spaces on property.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available for all shows. The Spotlight Showroom has 2 ramps on the left and right side of the showroom.

generalInfo.generalRule: The Spotlight Showroom is a non-smoking venue. Shirts & shoes are required. No cameras or recording devices. No bottles, cans, food, weapons or fireworks!
generalInfo.childRule: Must be 21 or older, or 16+ must be accompanied by 21+

name: Mayo Clinic Health System Event Center

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Monday - Friday: 10:00AM - 5:00PM Saturday - Sunday: Four hours prior to event
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Check, Visa, Mastercard
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Located in the main lobby on Hickory Street. Tickets ordered through Ticketmaster that are held for "Will Call" may be picked up beginning four hours prior to the event. All Ticketmaster ordered tickets held at "Will Call" to be picked up must be in your name. You must also have the credit card used to place the order, your confirmation number and a valid picture ID to pick up the tickets. This is to ensure that tickets are given to the appropriate person. If a patron wishes to pick up will call tickets that are not in their name, they MUST have the ticket holder on record fax a signed letter to (507) 345-1627 authorizing this person to claim their tickets. No tickets will be given to persons other than the name provided through Ticketmaster or "Will Call" without this prior authorization.

parkingDetail: Parking is available in downtown parking ramps on Hickory Street and Walnut Street. Handicapped parking is available in designated areas.

generalInfo.childRule: For all Maverick Hockey games, concerts and all family shows except Sesame Street Live: All children 23 months and under do not need a ticket, but they must sit on the lap of the ticket holder. All children 24 months and older require a ticket to enter. Sesame Street Live: All children 11 months and under do not need a ticket, but they must sit on the lap of the ticket holder. All children 12 months and older require a ticket to enter.

name: Kiva Auditorium at the Albuquerque Convention Center

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Kiva Auditorium onsite box office is open Monday thru Friday 9:00am-4:00pm
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash only
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will call is available at the Kiva Auditorium box office. Picture ID that matches the pick-up name is required.

parkingDetail: Primary parking is available at the Convention Center Parking Garage (Martin Luther King Blvd & Broadway); with overflow parking available at the Civic Plaza garage (Marquette & 3rd St.). Additionally, there are numerous other public parking garages and parking lots available throughout downtown close to the Center. Parking fees vary. Please refer to the posted parking fees at each garage or lot. Street parking is limited.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available at every price level.

generalInfo.generalRule: No outside food or beverages will be allowed inside the Convention Center/Kiva Auditorium. Beverages purchased on-site will be allowed in the Kiva Auditorium. No backpacks or large purses allowed. Small purses, fanny packs and handbags will be subject to search. Every individual entering the Kiva Auditorium is subject to search. No smoking in the Convention Center or Kiva Auditorium. No cameras allowed. No laser pointers allowed. No video recorders/cameras allowed. No audio recorders allowed. Weapons are strictly prohibited.
generalInfo.childRule: EVERYONE must have a ticket, regardless of age.

parkingDetail: There are 42 parking lots in a 7 block area surrounding the Pennsylvania Convention Center.

generalInfo.childRule: Children under the age of 2 are admitted free for most events.

name: Amaturo Theater at Broward Center

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: (954) 462-0222 option 1 for Ticketing Services
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Tuesday through Friday, 12:00 PM to 5:00 PM or 2 hours prior to event
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, MC, AMX and Discover.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets held for Will Call can be picked up 90 minutes prior to curtain at the AutoNation Box Office at the Broward Center. The customer must present the actual credit card used and a photo ID.

parkingDetail: Parking and Valet Services Arts & Entertainment District parking Garage. This secure, lighted 950-space parking garage is located directly across the street from the Broward Center at 101 SW 5th Avenue, on the corner of SW 5th Avenue and SW 2nd Street. Please note, this is a public garage and is not exclusive to Broward Center patrons. Parking is a $15 Flat rate per performance and must be paid upon arrival which is valid for 6 hours. Pay-by-meter available on the first and second floors of the A&E District Parking Garage. BrowardCenter.org/visit for more information.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available on-line, by phone or in person and can be limited. We encourage you to order early and to specifically request seating for wheelchair access, sign-interpreted or open-captioned performances when placing your order. General admission events offer no specific location you will be accommodated at the door. Our facilities feature ADA-approved signage, handrails and automatic door openers. The Wayne and Marti Huizenga Family Skywalk connects the Arts & Entertainment Parking Garage with the Horvitz Lobby in The Au-Rene Theater. The skywalk entrance provides protection from the elements and easy access for patrons with disabilities. A second entry is located at the bottom of the driveway entrance, immediately across from the Arts & Entertainment Parking Garage. Patrons with limited mobility may be dropped off in front of the Au-Rene and Amaturo Theaters via the front driveway. Hearing Devices: Our Assistive Listening Devices are available for all performances at the Guest Services Center, located in the Pacers Lobby Main Entrance. There is no charge for the device, but a valid major credit card is required. Restrooms: Wheelchair-accessible restrooms are located on the upper and lower orchestra levels, the lower mezzanine and the lower balcony in the Au-Rene Theater, as well as the upper lobby level of the Amaturo Theater. Companion restrooms are available on the upper and lower orchestra levels of the Au-Rene Theater. Diaper changing facilities are located in the first and second floor lobby restrooms.

generalInfo.generalRule: No professional (detachable lens) cameras, flash photography, audio or recording devices. Company Management or Artist camera policy varies by show. NO alcohol, cans or bottles. NO smoking. Emergency information To contact an audience member during a performance, please call security at 954.468.3323. We will do our best to reach your party. Please provide a seat number, section and row if possible. If you need further assistance, please call 954.468.3338.
generalInfo.childRule: Varies by event. Please call the Box Office for more information. All patrons, regardless of age, must have a ticket. Lap seat tickets are available for select performances.

ada.adaCustomCopy: Please contact Ticketmaster for accessible seating. Accessible seating is available online, in person or by calling 954-462-0222 press 4.

name: Scranton Cultural Center

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Scranton Cultural Center (570) 344-1111 Broadway Theatre League Subscriptions (570) 342-7784 NEPA Philharmonic Subscriptions (570) 270-4444
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Labor Day through Memorial Day Monday - Friday 10am - 5pm Saturday 10am - 2pm Sunday Closed Memorial Day through Labor Day (summer) Monday - Friday 10am - 2pm Saturday & Sunday Closed OPENS : The box office opens One hour prior to published evening and weekend performance times and one half hour prior to published film and morning events.

parkingDetail: Two parking facilities are located within one block of the Center. Adams Avenue Parking: Private lot - is located in the 400 block of Adams Avenue directly behind the Scranton Cultural Center. Rates vary. Scranton Parking Authority Parking:Public Lot located in the 300 block of North Washington Avenue one block past the Scranton Cultural Center. Rates vary
accessibleSeatingDetail: This is an accessible venue. Customers should contact box office at (570) 344-1111 to purchase tickets. Note that there is no elevator to the Mezzanine or Balcony Level. Accessible Seating is located in the Orchestra Level Only. There is only stair access to the Mezzanine or Balcony, patrons who cannot/wish not to climb stairs should purchase tickets in the orchestra level or call the box office for accessible seating.

generalInfo.generalRule: The following items are PROHIBITED in the Center: Coolers, backpacks, oversized bags, bottles, cans and glass containers, outside food or beverages, horns, whistles, banners, noisemakers, laser pens, cameras, video cameras, or audio recording devices, recording devices, illegal substances, weapons or any other threatening objects. Bags may be checked for every event. Other security measures vary per event. The Center is a SMOKE FREE facility. No smoking materials, cigarettes, cigars, pipes, lighters, matches or other flammable items may be brought into the Cultural Center. There is no Re-Entry upon Exit for events. Prohibition of Cameras and recording devices may vary from event to event but are generally prohibited. Patrons may be subject to search.
generalInfo.childRule: Everyone regardless of age, must have a ticket to enter an event. No children allowed to be carried in the arms of adults. Some events may not be suitable for younger children or minors. Questions call (570) 344-1111

boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: We accept VISA, Mastercard, Discover and Cash. No checks for individual events will be accepted.

parkingDetail: There are three (3) main parking garages downtown Bloomington. * Lincoln Lot - On corner of US BUS 51 North/East Street and Front Street - 906 Available spaces * Market Lot - On corner of Center Street and Market Street - 550 Available spaces * Grossinger Motors Arena Lot - On corner of Olive and Lee Streets - 275 Available spaces
accessibleSeatingDetail: All ADA seating requests handled through the Box Office at 309-434-2777.

generalInfo.generalRule: Bag Policy Each guest will be allowed to carry in one (1) clear plastic, vinyl, or PVC bag that does not exceed 12 in x 6 in x 12 in or one (1), one-gallon clear plastic bag. In addition to a clear plastic bag each guest will be allowed to carry in one (1) small clutch that does not exceed 4.5 in x 6.5 in. Diaper bags (with a child 3 and under) and bags carrying medically necessary items will be allowed after a visual inspection inside the bag is completed by security. Guests who have bags larger than this size will be asked to return them to their vehicle or discard them. All bags, purses or personal items of any size will be subject to search.

name: Huntington Bank Pavilion at Northerly Island

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Box Office: (312) 288-3190 Season Tickets: (312) 540-2179
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The box office, located next to Gate 1, is open on show days only, beginning at 12 PM until 15-30 minutes after the headliner takes the stage.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Box Office accepts Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. We are a cashless venue.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets purchased through Ticketmaster.com and LiveNation.com are available for pick-up during regular box office hours on the day of the show. BAND TICKETS / FAN CLUB TICKETS: These tickets are available for pick-up during regular box office hours on the day of the show! Please bring your credit card, and order confirmation number when picking up your tickets at the box office. You must present a photo ID that matches the Will Call name on your order to receive your tickets. TICKETS MAY NOT BE DROPPED OFF OR LEFT FOR OTHER GUESTS.

parkingDetail: Pay to park: is available at Soldier Fields North Parking Garage at the average lot opening time (approximately 1 hour before venue gates open). Please visit www.soldierfieldparking.com to pre pay for parking and see all options, pricing, and times available for each event. VIP Parking: is also available as an upgrade at www.livenation.com (separate from your ticket) and is located within the Adler Planetarium Lot (between our main gate and the Adler Planetarium). VIP Parking offers you parking just outside the venue gates! Message boards will direct you to where VIP Parking is still available when you enter the Museum Campus. If you have a VIP Parking pass, please show these to the Traffic Management Authorities, and they will direct you as needed. Additional fees may be associated with an early entry into the pay to park locations. Please check the specific event page, as these times are subject to change. Oversized vehicles: including buses, campers, RVs, and limousines can drop off and pick up on the westbound lanes (north) side of Solidarity for standard shows. Please note the drop off and pick up locations are subject to change without prior notice directed by the Traffic Management Authority. Parking is available for buses, campers, RVs, and limousines in the Adler Planetarium Lot. There is a limited amount of bus and RV parking at the Planetarium. Please reserve your spot ahead of time by pre purchasing online at www.soldierfieldparking.com. Parking for bus and RV will not be available on site without a pre paid voucher. There is no overnight parking permitted. Please note the drop off and pick up locations are subject to change without prior notice directed by the Traffic Management Authority*.* Standard Show parking fees: $40 Adler Planetarium Lot, East Parking Lot, and $35 North Garage, Waldron Deck, and South Lot (subject to availability) ** *Please note SP+ operates the parking lots, and prices are subject to change without notice. Please visit www.soldierfieldparking.com to pre pay for parking and see all options, pricing, and times available for each event.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Ticketing- ADA tickets can be purchased online via www.livenation.com. You do not need to call the box office to place an order as all of our accessible tickets are available through www.livenation.com. Look for the handicap logo on the Find Tickets page to view all available accessible seats. We do have accessible seating in every price range, but be advised it does occasionally sell out. We have very limited seating available for guests on the day of the event so please make sure you purchase accessible seating when you order tickets. Day of Show Parking- Accessible Parking is at Soldier Fields North Garage. There are also a limited number of spaces in the VIP lot (Adler Parking Lot off Linn White Drive). All Accessible Parking is subject to the parking fees posted by the parking lot operators. Accessible Stations- If you have questions or need assistance we have a location staffed with customer service employees to help answer questions related to seating or other accommodations. This station is located at the Info Booth next to the VIP Club. Unexpected Needs- If you have had an injury or illness that prevents you from using the original seat you purchased, we strongly recommend going through www.livenation.com to exchange all tickets for accessible seating. We will have a very limited number of seats available on the day of the show for such issues, but we cannot guarantee we will be able to seat you. Please remember that accessible seating permits for the guest with the accessible need and one companion. Interpreter Requests- If you will need an interpreter for an event, please give us at least 2 weeks notice to secure. Guests that request an interpreter will need to pick up their tickets at will call. When the tickets are picked up we will introduce you to your interpreter for the evening and take you to your seats. There is no charge for interpreter services. Please call 312-288-3190 to arrange for an interpreter for your visit. Hearing Assistance- Guests who require assisted listening devices can contact our venue office to arrange for a device before the event. Please give us at least 2 days notice. Accommodations- The venue has designated ADA restrooms on-site. They are located on the north and south ends of the beachside run of bathrooms and the grandstands west side (Linn White Dr. side). There is also a private ADA restroom within the main trailer of the VIP patio. All concession stands and merchandise locations are accessible as well.

generalInfo.generalRule: SUBJECT TO CHANGE BASED ON EVENTS. To reduce crew contact with fan belongings, we have implemented the following bag policy: we will allow clear plastic, vinyl or PVC tote bags no larger than 12" x 6" x 12" and/or small clutch bags (6"x 9"). NO OTHER BAGS OF ANY TYPE WILL BE ALLOWED. Items PERMITTED in this venue include - Snack food in clear plastic gallon-size bag - Factory sealed water up to a gallon in size or empty bottle - Cameras (nonprofessional only, no detachable lenses). Items NOT PERMITTED in this venue include: - Weapons - Alcohol - Drugs - Camping chairs or bag chairs - Bags that are not clear or are larger than 12" x 6" x 12" (non-clear bags up to 6" x 9" are allowed) - Umbrellas - Laser pointers - Skates - Wallet chains - Ice chests - Banners - Flyers - Beach balls - Frisbees - Fireworks - Outside food or beverage (except as noted above) - Video and audio recording devices (unless otherwise noted) Camera Policy: - Personal cameras ARE allowed in the venue. - Flash photography, video, and removable lens cameras ARE NOT permitted without venue approval. PLEASE NOTE: These guidelines are subject to change and are at the discretion of management.
generalInfo.childRule: There are no age restrictions. Children under the age 2 years old are admitted free but must sit on a parent lap. Parents are encouraged to use reasonable discretion as some concerts may not be suitable for children.

parkingDetail: IMPORTANT PARKING INFORMATION for the US Open: TRAFFIC ALERT! PLEASE USE MASS TRANSIT! The USTA strongly recommends using public transportation throughout the US Open Event. Limited Public Parking is available at Citi Field and the South Field Lot for a fee with the exception of the dates when the Mets are playing at home. generalInfo.generalRule: Arthur Ashe Stadium day and evening session tickets entitle customer to a reserved seat in Arthur Ashe Stadium for that session (day or evening) only. It also allows general admission access to all court and stadium matches for that session on a first-come, first-served basis. Evening session tickets allow access beginning at 6:00PM. Reserved tickets for Louis Armstrong Stadium are sold only for the first eight (8) day sessions and the first six (6) evening sessions. A reserved ticket entitles you to a reserved seat in Louis Armstrong Stadium and allows admission to Grandstand and field courts based on availability. A reserved Louis Armstrong ticket does not allow entrance into Arthur Ashe Stadium. Reserved tickets for Grandstand are sold only for the first six (6) day sessions. A reserved Grandstand ticket does not allow entrance into Arthur Ashe Stadium. Grounds admission tickets (sold by date) allow access to the National Tennis Center grounds including all court and stadium matches, EXCEPT Arthur Ashe Stadium. Grounds admission tickets allow access beginning at 9:30AM. We would like to take this opportunity to assure you that the safety of our patrons is our highest priority. In conjunction with federal, state and local authorities, we will have several important security measures in place at the US Open. All patrons will go through a screening process at the entry gates. There will be a limit of one bag per person admitted on to the grounds. All bags are subject to search and cannot be larger than 12"W x 12"H x 16"L. There will be no bag storage on the grounds. For a nominal charge, there is a bag storage facility outside the grounds. We recommend that ticketed fans allow extra time to enter the grounds. The existing policy of prohibiting knapsacks/backpacks, glass bottles or cans, coolers, video cameras/recording devices or any items deemed by management to be dangerous or inappropriate remains in effect. Most of the security measures being deployed will not be visible to fans. Rest assured, the US Open will be a safe, secure environment. For further information, visit: usopen.org
generalInfo.childRule: Everyone ages 2 and up needs a ticket. Children under 2 are free and do not need a ticket.

generalInfo.generalRule: General Rules: Please check the age restrictions before purchasing your ticket to a show. Age restrictions change depending on show. 21+ shows require a Valid ID to enter the venue. 18+ shows require a Valid ID to enter the venue. Accepted forms of ID are current and non-expired: State Issued ID or Driver’s License, Military & Passport ID. Guests are not permitted to bring bottles, cans, weapons, back packs, posters, outside food and beverage items, stickers, cameras with detachable lenses, audio/video recording devices, tripods/monopods, alcohol, drugs and illegal substances, large bags or backpacks inside the venue. There are no "in's and out's" permitted. All sales are final. We don't offer refunds or exchanges unless a show is canceled. Please keep in mind that support acts and set times are subject to change at any time and this does not warrant a refund.
generalInfo.childRule: Child Rules: No children will be permitted unless it is an All-Ages show. Everyone must have a ticket.

generalInfo.generalRule: Food and water ARE permitted on most show days. Food must be in a clear plastic bag, up to one gallon in size. Water containers must be clear, sealed, or empty, and can be no larger than 1 liter. All items are subject to inspection. Lawn chairs with seat bottoms no taller than 9 inches off the ground, such as beach chairs or sand chairs, are permitted at selected shows. Please call on the day of the show you are attending to confirm our policy. Camera Policy: The camera policy for events tends to vary artist to artist. For most events, personal cameras and small digital cameras are permitted and professional cameras (any camera with a detachable lens or a zoom lens longer than 2" long) are not permitted. For specific questions, feel free to call 317-776-8181 the day of the show for more information.
generalInfo.childRule: Children under 2 are admitted free on a parents lap or on lawn, unless otherwise stated. 2 and over require a ticket.

parkingDetail: There is ample parking surrounding the complex, including accessible parking. accessibleSeatingDetail: This is an accessible venue.

generalInfo.generalRule: VENUE HAS A CLEAR BAG POLICY. name: The Venue at Horseshoe Casino

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: For questions regarding a show, please call (219) 473-7000
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Venue at Horseshoe Casino's Box Office Hours of Operation: We will open at 5pm on show days and close 1 hour after the event starts. The Box Office is located on the second floor of the casino.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express, Cash
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets can be picked up after 5pm on the day of show at the Box Office. Customers must present the actual credit card, a picture ID and the confirmation number.

parkingDetail: Free self park. Valet and preferred parking available on site.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Our facilities are 100% ADA compliant. The Venue has accessible seating in the last row of the Floor Section, first row of the Orchestra and the last rows of the Mezzanine. It is important to indicate when buying tickets if you require wheelchair accessible seating. For more information about accessible seating, please email UHABoxOffice@caesars.com. Service Animals are allowed but they must have their working papers with them. Please call 219.473.7000 ext.6165 to set this up in advance. Elevators: The Venue elevator has access to all three levels. Parking: Horseshoe Casino Marina garage has accessible parking. Entrance: The entrances are ADA compliant. Hearing Devices: The Venue has hearing devices available at no charge. Please ask the box office for a device when you arrive. You must leave a Photo ID as a deposit for the device being returned at the end of the show.

generalInfo.generalRule: The Venue at Horseshoe Casino is a 21 years old and older facility and is located on the second floor of the Horseshoe Casino only 20 minutes from downtown Chicago. Photo ID's are required to enter the facilities. Cameras and recording devices are never allowed at concerts unless otherwise notified. Outside food or beverages of any kind are not permitted inside the building. Guests wearing obscene or indecent clothing are not allowed in The Venue. Guests using foul or abusive language or gestures will be escorted from the venue. Laser pens and pointers are not permitted. Policies subject to change depending on the nature of the event.
generalInfo.childRule: No children, The Venue at Horseshoe Casino is strictly a 21 and over facility, ID required.

parkingDetail: Fourteen (14) (9 paved and 5 gravel) lighted parking lots can accommodate 3,600 vehicles. All lots are adjacent to the Ford Wyoming Center. Unless otherwise stated, the parking fee is already included in the event ticket fee.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Oak View Group strives to provide guests with disabilities the same opportunities to access the Ford Wyoming Center as others while allowing them to benefit from the same services. The Ford Wyoming Center is fully compliant with all ADA guidelines. Elevators and seating for people with mobility concerns are available. The Ford Wyoming Center offers wheelchair assistance to and from guest seats. Wheelchairs are not issued for the duration of an event. You may request wheelchair assistance from our drop off at the circle on West Boulevard, please call the SinclairTix Box Office at (307) 577-3030 in advance of your arrival. Assistive listening receivers, headphones and other devices are available to guests upon request at our First Aid station near the Box Office. A drivers license or state-issued ID is required.

Once a child has reached their second birthday they do need to have a valid event ticket. Please refer to the event information page for Age limits, as some productions have different children age policy requirements.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: For the safety of our employees and guests, the box office will be closed until further notice. Please keep checking back here for updates as to when we re-open. We appreciate your understanding.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, Mastercard, Discover, Cash
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Once within 10 days of the event, tickets may be placed in "will-call," which means you can pick them up anytime between the time of purchase and the time of the show. You must have a photo ID to show that you are the person that the tickets were purchased for and the credit card used to purchase the tickets must be present.

parkingDetail: We provide ample parking for the events right on the property. A parking pass is required of every vehicle looking to enter the property for the events. There are several different kinds of parking passes including overnight tent site parking passes. Please see the different parking options below. Our parking areas typically open 3 to 4 hours before the show starts. Please review the times on our website as they can change and the time on your tickets and/or passes may no longer be accurate. $65 Ultimate Bath VIP Parking (East) $55 Ultimate Bath VIP Parking (West) $40 Kubota Prime Tailgate Parking $30 MB Tractor Premium Parking $15 Orange Standard Parking $75 Limo/RV Parking $65 Kittery Trading Post Overnight Tent Sites
accessibleSeatingDetail: ADA tickets can be purchased online via www.livenation.com. You do not need to call the box office to place an order as all of our accessible tickets are available through www.livenation.com. Look for the logo on the Find Tickets page to view all available accessible seats. We do have accessible seating in every price range, but be advised it does occasionally sell out. We have very limited seating available for guests on the day of the event so please make sure you purchase accessible seating when you order tickets.

generalInfo.generalRule: What is Allowed in the Gates? The following is a list of items and whether they are typically allowed into the venue or not. Sometimes a specific tour may require a different policy on certain items. All items that are allowed in are subject to a thorough search from our security team. »Bags or Purses? No, except for a small clutch purse or a clear tote with a maximum size of 12" Wide x 12" High x 6" Deep. »Lawn Chairs? Chair rentals are available for $5! Pick them up when you arrive and then leave them where they are when you leave. Fast, simple and hassle-free! (If you wish to bring your own lawn chair, please be aware that they MUST adhere to the size limitation policy and you will have a thorough search at a specific location that will make entry in the venue slower.) »Blankets? If you have a lawn seating ticket, yes. »Food & Drink? No, except for one factory-sealed bottle of water, 20 oz. or less, per person »Refillable Water Bottles? Yes, but only completely empty. There are fill stations inside. »Coolers? No. »Weapons? No. »Cameras? Yes but only non-professional without a detachable lens. »IPads? No. »Video Camera? No. »Selfie Sticks? No. »Drugs? No. »Medications? Yes, but only in the original prescription container with matching ID. »Pets? No. »Poster Tubes? Yes. »Umbrellas? Yes, but may not be open during the performance. We recommend quality rain gear. »Signs? Yes, but please be courteous to others. Lawn Seating The lawn seating is a general admission area behind the reserved pavilion seats. It is not covered and therefore, is exposed to the elements. In the event of inclement weather, we recommend quality rain gear. Umbrellas are allowed but may not be open during the performances. Smoking is prohibited except in one section to the far right of the lawn. If you have trouble walking up inclined surfaces, lawn seating may not be the best option for you. If lawn seating is your only option, please see our staff for assistance. Traffic Please plan ahead and allow for plenty of extra time in the event of heavy traffic so that you do not miss any of the earlier performances. We open the parking lots hours early to accommodate all those that want to arrive early. Drop-Offs & Pick-Ups Please arrive before the rush on both ends of a pick-up and drop-off and do so at the Main Entrance off of Route 11B in Gilford -- 72 Meadowbrook Ln. Tailgating We have several parking areas and we condone and even, promote, responsible tailgating. Tailgating can be a very big part of making the event fun and memorable for you. That being said, the possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages, in our parking areas, actually violates a local Gilford ordinance. Underage drinking and/or intoxication, will most certainly cause you to miss the show and may lead to being arrested. Weather All performances will go on rain or shine. In the event of a weather emergency, like a hurricane, events will most likely be rescheduled. In the event of inclement weather, please use quality rain gear. Umbrellas are allowed but may not be open during performances. Umbrellas Umbrellas are allowed inside the venue and we allow all types of chairs and blankets in the lawn area. We ask that you are courteous and keep your umbrella closed during the performance to not obstruct anyone's view. We recommend wearing ponchos or other rain gear. The show will go on rain or shine. Weapons There are absolutely no weapons of any kind permitted into the venue including small pocket knives. There will be bag searches and pat downs. Any weapons discovered on an individual attempting to enter the venue will be confiscated and we will not be able to return that item to you at any time. Pets There are no pets allowed anywhere on the property. Please contact the box office in advance to coordinate the use of any kind of service animal. No Re-entry Once you enter the pavilion, you will not be permitted to leave the venue and re-enter again so please be sure to bring everything you need with you the first time. Be sure to have your photo ID with you as everyone is carded for alcohol service. Doors The doors or gates to our midway typically open between 90 and 120 minutes prior to the main stage performances starting. We usually have a lot going on include excellent regional acts playing on the Magic Hat Stage so please come in early, enjoy everything we have to offer and assure your party not missing any of the show all at the same time. Resale Tickets When the artist approves to do so, we offer our customers the ability to buy and sell tickets directly from each other for their convenience, comfort and security. For more information on our resell program, go here. Ticket Information There are no refunds or exchanges on any tickets for any event. GROUP SALES Contact Aubrey at AubreyBrooks@LiveNation.com

accessibleSeatingDetail: The American Family Insurance Amphitheater is wheelchair accessible and provides accessible seating at all price levels. Limit one companion ticket for each accessible seat purchased. To purchase accessible seating, you can do so on Ticketmaster.com or, please call the Box Office at 414-273-2600, Monday to Friday from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm during the concert season or visit the Summerfest Box Office in person during regular hours of operation. For more information about accessible seating, please visit http://www.summerfest.com/accessibility

accessibleSeatingDetail: Seating Location for Barrier Free and Limited Mobility The Kalamazoo State Theatre is a historical building with no elevator to the upstairs mezzanine and balcony. Seating for barrier free patrons and companions is located on the main level in orchestra center in rows AA, M, and N. Accessible seating is available for wheelchairs, patrons with limited mobility and companions. There is a 4 ticket limit for all accessible seating, unless otherwise posted. Wheelchair patrons should purchase 1 wheelchair seat and up to 3 companion seats. Wheelchair companions should also purchase wheelchair seats as their seat. The venue requests that all patrons requiring accessible seating arrive at the venue 15 mintues before doors open. The box office manager can be reached by phone at 269-345-6500 during regular business hours. Box office hours are Friday & Saturday 10 am - 6 pm. Approaching the building a barrier free drop off area closest to the main entrance is located at the corner of E. Lovell St. and S. Burdick St. There are also various locations just south of the main entrance. A select number of accessible parking spaces are located north of Lovell along the Kalamazoo Mall.

accessibleSeatingDetail: Disabled and Accessible Seating is available on our concourse level based on availability, as well as companion seats. When purchasing your tickets, please make sure to mention any concerns you may have. The Florence Center will attempt to reasonably accommodate any concern regarding guests with disabilities.

generalInfo.generalRule: No video cameras No outside food or beverages No weapons No smoking No recording devices
generalInfo.childRule: The majority of our events require all children who have reached their 2nd birthday to have a ticket. However, some shows will require for all children who have reached their 1st birthday. If a child is going to sit in a seat, they will need a ticket regardless of age. If the child is going to sit in the parent's lap, they must still adhere to the age policy for purchasing a ticket. For example: If the show requires a ticket for children 2 and older but a 3 year old is going to sit in the parent's lap, the child will require a ticket. Please reach out if you have any questions or concerns.

name: Detroit Opera House

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: For information on events with the Michigan Opera Theatre call (313) 237-SING.
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: During non-show weeks, the box office is typically open Monday through Friday from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. During the summer months (June through August), the box office will be open Monday through Thursday from 9:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and Friday from 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. When there is a show the Box Office is open 2 hours prior to showtime.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, MasterCard, Discover, American Express, and Cash.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets can be picked up one hour prior to curtain. Customers must have their Confirmation Number and Photo Identification.

parkingDetail: The Detroit Opera House Parking Center. An all new state of the art structure. Steps from the Detroit Opera House and close to Ford Field, Comerica Park, Music Hall, Foxtown, Greektown and Harmonie Park. Easy entrances on John R Street and Grand River Avenue. Well lighted, 24 hour security. High speed elevators Close to People Movers (Broadway Stop) First-come, first-serve parking is available for all events at the Opera House Parking Center. Monthly and daily parking is also available at the Herman Frankel | Opera House Parking Center located at 1426 Broadway. The parking center has convenient entrances located on both John R. and Grand River. The Parking Center has 24 hour access. For more information about the Parking Center please call (313) 965-4052.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Handicapped seating is available through the Box Office only. Please call the Opera House Box Office at (313) 237-SING.

generalInfo.generalRule: Smoking, video and audio recording is not allowed.

ada.adaPhones:
Telephone Numbers:
Please contact the Detroit Opera House Box Office at (313) 237-SING for all events.
ada.adaCustomCopy:
To better accommodate your needs, Detroit Opera House has requested that all accessible seating ticket accommodations be solicited only through their representatives. Please contact a Detroit Opera House representative for further help with your ticket purchase.*   Advance ticket purchase may be required. 
 
* Box office information is subject to change.
ada.adaHours:
During non-show weeks, the box office is typically open Monday through Friday from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. During the summer months (June through August), the box office will be open Monday through Thursday from 9:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and Friday from 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.
When there is a show the Box Office opens 2 hours prior to showtime.

name: Indiana University Memorial Stadium

address.line2: The Northeast Corner of 17th Street and North Dunn Street

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: 1-866-IUSPORTS
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: TICKET OFFICE – The Memorial Stadium Ticket Offices will open 2 1/2 hours prior to game time
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, Mastercard, Discover, Cash
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: • Customer must present photo ID. • EAST SIDE: Public, IU Players, Recruits, and High School Coaches • WEST SIDE (between Gate W2 &W3): Public and Media • WEST BOOTH W4: Visiting Team

parkingDetail: • Parking in the Grass Lots south of 17th Street is restricted to cars, vans, motorcycles, pickup trucks, and sport utility vehicles only. Large trucks, RVs, buses, and other oversized vehicles will not be admitted to the Grass Lots and will be assigned to alternate lots. • The instructions of parking lot attendants are to be followed. Only one space per car is permitted. • Erecting canopies directly in front of or behind vehicles will be permitted, as long as traffic is not impeded or additional parking spaces are not taken. Tents and large tarps are not permitted. • Trailer grills or other vehicle attachments are not permitted unless they are approved by an Indiana University caterer. • Couches, large indoor or outdoor furniture, and large sound systems are not permitted. • Kegs are not permitted unless approved by an official Indiana University caterer. Underage consumption of alcoholic beverages is not permitted under Indiana state law. • For safety reasons, consumption of all beverages should be from plastic cups/plastic bottles. Glass bottles are prohibited. • These parking lots are reserved for those attending football games, and patrons who enter these lots are expected to have game tickets. Any tailgate activities are expected to conclude within 10 minutes after kickoff. Police and security personnel will monitor these policies.
accessibleSeatingDetail: WHEELCHAIRS - Patrons in wheelchairs must purchase tickets for the wheelchair area and enter the stadium through Gate E9 in the East Stands for access to the wheelchair seating area. Wheelchair accessible restrooms are located near the seating area. ACCESSIBLE CARTS - Carts will be made available in the designated parking lots of the stadium to transport limited mobility patrons. The carts also will be available following the game to return patrons to their parking lot.

generalInfo.generalRule: • ALCOHOL – Alcoholic beverages are prohibited in Memorial Stadium. • CAMERAS – Video cameras are not allowed, still cameras with no flash are permitted, and pictures are to be taken from your assigned seat. • CONTAINERS – No containers or coolers, including water bottles, are permitted in Memorial Stadium. • PETS/ANIMALS– Only service dogs, either certified or in training, will be admitted. • SMOKING– Smoking is prohibited in all areas of Memorial Stadium including the restrooms and concourse areas. • UMBRELLAS– Umbrellas may not be carried into or used in Memorial Stadium. Check-in facilities are not available. • FIRST AID – First Aid Stations are located behind Entry 9 in the West Stands and behind Entry 26 in the East Stands. Contact the nearest usher or uniformed police officer if medical assistance is needed in the stands. • LOST AND FOUND – Any found items may be turned in to Event Staff. Patrons may claim lost items by calling the Andy Frain office at 812-856-0651. • LOST PATRONS – Lost patrons and persons looking for lost patrons should contact a uniformed police officer or call 812-855-4111.
generalInfo.childRule: THE KIDS ZONE – The Kids Zone is located on the west side of Assembly Hall near the banner denoting The Walk. The Kids Zone features interactive games, face tattoos and pre-game music. The Kids Zone opens immediately follwing The Walk, which begins 2 hours and 15 minutes priod to each home game. Admission is free with a ticket to the game. Children 10 years of age and younger must be accompanied by an adult.

name: Broadview Stage at SPAC

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Mon Fri 12pm 5pm Saturday 10am 2pm Sunday Closed, unless there is a performance in the amphitheater, then opening at 2pm. On event days, hours are extended through the start of the performance.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Check (with ID), American Express, Discover, Visa & Mastercard
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is located at the Main Box Office off the Route 50 parking lot ONLY. We suggest you arrive at Will Call 1-2 hours prior to the show to avoid long lines. Please bring a valid photo ID, credit card and your confirmation number.

parkingDetail: The main parking lot is located off of Route 50 and opens 2 hours before show time. Gates typically open 1 hour before show time (varies by show/subject to change). Parking in all lots are subject to a $10 fee per car. Parking in the Route 50 lot entrances can be paid via credit card or cash. Additional parking available in the Saratoga Spa State Park for $10 per vehicle. If still available, Premier Parking can be purchased in the Route 50 parking lot upon entering. Premier Parking can also be purchased online.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available for purchase at all Ticketmaster outlets, Ticketmaster Charge By Phone, LiveNation.com and at the SPAC Box Office. If someone has a medical condition that requires syringes or special medical attention, you should alert the SPAC staff on arrival who will notify SPAC Medical to discuss your needs. Due to crowd size, accessible carts are not available during Live Nation events.

generalInfo.generalRule: The following items are allowed into the facility Sealed bottled water, food, blankets, strollers, cameras with non detachable lenses, binoculars, and lawn chairs (when the height of the chair is 43 or under when collapsed. ONLY small clutches, wristlets, or fanny packs no bigger than 6x 9 OR clear plastic bags NO BIGGER than 12x6x12 will be allowed inside. These items are subject to artist restriction. The following items are prohibited Glass, coolers, laser pens, illegal substances, pets, roller blades, skateboards, bikes, grills, hibachis, video and unauthorized audio equipment. Camera Policy Personal cameras are allowed in the venue for some performances. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. For more information contact the venue on the date of the event.
generalInfo.childRule: Children ages 2 or younger are admitted free on the lawn. For our guests with reserved seating, one child under 2 will be free if they sit on your lap (one child per adult).

name: Columbus Athenaeum
parkingDetail: There are plenty of parking lots and garages located around the venue, most within walking distance. Prices for parking vary.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Any ticket may be purchased for wheelchair accessible seating.

generalInfo.generalRule: Cameras & recording devices are not permitted.
generalInfo.childRule: Varies by show. See individual event for more information.

ada.adaCustomCopy: This is an "All general admission event." Patrons requesting accessible seating may purchase and use regular general admission seating. Please click "back" to previous page and continue with standard purchase.  Enjoy the show!
ada.adaHours: N/A

name: The Lyric Theatre

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Lyric Theatre does not have a full-time box office. The on-site box office opens 1 hour before showtime for most events. Advance tickets may be purchased at Ticketmaster.com.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is only available beginning 1 hour before that show. Will Call tickets may not be picked up at another event or when the box office is not open.

accessibleSeatingDetail: The Floor level (1st level) is accessible and does not require any stairs for access. Wheelchair spaces are marked on the Floor level. Seating in the Loge, Opera Boxes, and Balcony requires stairs for access. There is not an elevator in the Lyric Theatre. By purchasing seats in these sections you agree that you will take stairs to that area. The Lyric Theatre cannot guarantee that you can be seated in another section if you are unable to use stairs.

generalInfo.generalRule: Tickets sold as General Admission do not have assigned seats and are first come, first served. Your ticket may say General Admission, GENADM, or GA to signify General Admission. A number on a General Admission Ticket is not a seat number. Wheelchair accessible seating is not assigned for General Admission vents and is first come, first served. No weapons of any kind are allowed in the Lyric Theatre. All guests will be scanned with a metal detector wand and bags will be checked before entry to the building. No outside food or drink is allowed.
generalInfo.childRule: Children ages 2 and under do not need a ticket for most shows. This policy may vary for events designed for children. Please check the event listing for more specific information.

name: Blue Ocean Music Hall

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Non-Event Days: Tuesday - Sunday 11:30AM - 7:00PM Event Days: 11:30AM - 7:00PM
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express and Blue Ocean Music Hall Gift Cards
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call opens 2 hours prior to event time.

parkingDetail: Event parking is available for a fee in the lot adjacent to the venue as well as the Salisbury Beach Municipal Parking lot within walking distance.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Available through Box Office (978) 462-5888

generalInfo.generalRule: Cameras are allowed, however flash photography and videotaping is not permitted. Outside food and beverage, backpacks, knives or weapons are also not permitted. Patrons are subject to bag and pat down search. Blue Ocean Music Hall is a non-smoking facility. Smoking is allowed before and after performances in the secured outside smoking area.
generalInfo.childRule: 18 and older unless accompanied by an Adult.

boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Before 5:30pm on day of event, Will Call is located in the Cage inside the Casino. After 5:30pm on day of event, Will Call will be located in the Box Office.

parkingDetail: No Charge for Parking.

generalInfo.generalRule: Items NOT Allowed: Video cameras, professional cameras, outside food/beverages Non-professional cameras are allowed inside the Event Center only and must be put away when present in the Casino. Smoking is NOT permitted.
generalInfo.childRule: Age 3 and under are Free.

name: Springfield Symphony Hall

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Box Office located inside Lobby of Symphony Hall. Box Office is open two (2) hours prior to the event.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash and credit may be used at the Box Office located inside Symphony Hall.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Bring Photo ID, Credit Card, and Ticketmaster confirmation number. Note: The credit card holder must be present for ticket pick up. Will Call will be available to pick up at the event once doors open. To avoid long lines please arrive early if you are picking up Will Call Tickets OR use the free eTicket (Print-At -Home) option.

parkingDetail: For detailed information about parking at MGM Springfield, please visit https://www.mgmspringfield.com/en/amenities/parking-and-transportation.html
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible Seating is available for one (1) accessible seat and one (1) companion seat only. Any other arrangements must be made through the Box Office. Accessible entrance located on East Columbus Ave. side of Symphony Hall.

generalInfo.generalRule: Smoking in designated areas only, this includes vaping and e-cigarettes, no audio recorders, no flash photography, and no outside food.
generalInfo.childRule: Children ages 3 and older require a full-price ticket for entry. Any child younger than the age of 3 may enter without a ticket, but must remain on the lap of the ticket holder, unless otherwise noted on the event. Children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Age Restrictions may apply to certain events.

name: 1st SUMMIT ARENA at Cambria County War Memorial

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM Tuesdays & Thursdays and 90 minutes prior to the start of all ticketed events.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, Mastercard, Discover, Cash
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will call is available starting 90 minutes before the event.

parkingDetail: Public parking at the arena is not available, with the exception of a limited number of handicapped parking spaces. Private parking available throughout downtown Johnstown, including the Renaissance parking garage on Vine & Walnut Streets, and another garage along Walnut Stret near the Cambria County Library.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Yes, accessible seats are available for all events. If you need assistance with accessible seating, please call the box office at 814-536-5156 or email boxoffice@1stSummitArena.com

generalInfo.generalRule: ·No reentry to the building after leaving the premises. A designated smoking area will be made available to patrons. ·No outside food or beverage will be allowed into the building. ·No professional cameras (any camera with a removable lens) without proper credentials established beforehand. ·No audio or video recording devices will be allowed in the building. ·All patrons are subject to searches at the doors for all events. Clear bags that are 12 inches x 12 inches or smaller are permitted, but will be subjected to a search. Signs are not permitted if they are deemed to interfere with the view of other fans. No weapons or laser devices of any kind are permitted.
generalInfo.childRule: Children are permitted for most events, but some events may have age restrictions. Please contact box office for more information.

name: Greek Theatre-U.C. Berkeley

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Box Office, located on the north side of the Greek Theatre, is open on the day/night of performances only. Ticket sales and will call pickup are available 1.5 hours prior to showtime. If there are still tickets available to purchase on the day of the event, you may purchase them in person at the box office. Some shows sell very quickly and do not always have tickets available on the day of the show, so we suggest you buy tickets ahead of time. Service Charge free tickets may be purchased, in advance, in person, at Cal Performances Box Office located off Bancroft St. on the UC Berkeley Campus in Zellerbach Hall. Please note: Presale tickets are not available at this box office. The Cal Performances Box Office can be reached at (510) 642-9988 and is open: TUE - FRI / 12:00PM-5:30PM SAT - SUN / 1:00PM-5:00PM CLOSED MONDAYS AND HOLIDAYS Service Charge free tickets may also be purchased, in advance, in person, at The Fox Theater Box Office located at 1807 Telegraph Avenue in Oakland. The box office is open from 12p-7p every Friday (with the exception of some holidays) and during any show at the Fox Theater.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, Mastercard, American Express & Discover
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets may be picked up at the Box Office, located at the North Gate entrance to the Greek Theatre beginning 1.5 hours prior to show time. Photo ID required.

parkingDetail: There is limited parking in and around the Greek Theatre. All lots are controlled and operated by UC Berkeley Parking & Traffic. Please plan accordingly to allow for the time necessary to find parking, as well as the time it may take to walk the necessary distance to the Greek Theatre. The closest parking structure to the Greek Theatre is located at Hearst Avenue and Gayley Road/La Loma Avenue. Other parking structures include the Lower Hearst parking lot located along Hearst Avenue between Euclid Avenue and Scenic Avenue and the Underhill Parking Structure located along College Avenue between Channing Way and Haste Street. Disabled parking is available at Upper Hearst parking garage at the corner of Hearst Ave and Gayley Road (there are two DP spaces on the lowest level entering from Hearst Ave, and several more DP spaces on the third level entering from Gayley Road). Upper Hearst parking garage has the best path of travel (one relatively level block) from the parking area to the Greek Theater. Please note that there is a curbside drop-off area on Gayley Road just north of the Greek Theater entrance for passengers with mobility disabilities who prefer to minimize the travel distance to the Greek Theatre.
accessibleSeatingDetail: This venue offers wheelchair accessible and limited mobility seating. Accessible seating is located at the front of the walkway between the lower bowl and upper bowl.

generalInfo.generalRule: The following items are NOT allowed: Alcohol, cans, bottles, ice chests, picnic baskets, lawn furniture, strollers, professional cameras or recording devices, large blankets, large bakcpacks, umbrellas, pets or weapons of any kind.
generalInfo.childRule: Due to capacity restrictions, everyone entering the venue must have a ticket and no strollers will be allowed. We discourage any infants or babes in arms.

ada.adaCustomCopy: Patrons requesting accessible seating should purchase an ADA ticket using the accessible ticket filter on the purchase page. If none are available, you may purchase another ticket at your discretion and staff will do their best to accommodate you on day of show.

name: Stormont Vail Events Center

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: The Box Office is located in front of the building between the main entrance doors to Exhibition Hall and Landon Arena. Box Office phone number 785.251.5552.
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Wednesday - Friday 10:00am until 5:00 pm. Weekends vary as events require...
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash Visa MC Discover
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call may be picked up during regular box office hours or day of show prior to start time. Must have photo ID, confirmation number, and the credit card used to purchase the tickets.

parkingDetail: There is a charge parking for most events. Price varies based on the event. Parking can be purchased in advance on the Park mobile website or app. No cash will be accepted in the parking lot. Any parking purchased on site will require a credit card or mobile pay.
accessibleSeatingDetail: There is an accessible entrance on ground level at the south end of the building. There is an elevator right inside this entrance that will take you to the concourse area. Our main entrance at the northeast end of the building is also accesible with an elevator and escalator.

generalInfo.generalRule: Smoking is prohibited in the arena, there are designated smoking areas to accommodate all patrons. No weapons or firearms, or outside food and beverages are allowed. Please see our website for our complete list of prohibited items and our clear bag policy. All patrons and items visiting the Stormont Vail Events Center are subject to search.
