boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: General Information Number: (617) 426-6912
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Non-show days: 12pm to 6pm Evening Show Weekdays: 12pm to 8:30pm Saturday: 12pm to 8:30pm Sunday: 12pm to 5:30pm (or 8:30 if there is an 8pm show) *Box Office Hours subject to change due to performance schedule.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: CASH, AMEX, VISA, MC, Travelers Checks. Personal Checks are acceptable 21 days in advance of the performance. Valid photo I.D. is required.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets are available for pick up on the day of the show during regular Box Office hours. The customer must present the credit card used to place the order and a photo I.D.

parkingDetail: There are several parking garages and open air parking lots within walking distance of the theatre. Meter parking is available but limited.
accessibleSeatingDetail: The orchestra level for Blue Man Group at the Charles Playhouse is accessible via a wheelchair lift system to assist patrons with mobility issues. A limited number of removable seats are also available for each performance to accommodate patrons with wheelchairs. These seats can be purchased by calling our box office at (617) 426-6912. Please note: balcony level seating is not wheelchair-accessible. Patrons can be dropped off and picked up in front of the theatre, but there is currently no handicapped accessible parking. Walking distance to the theatre varies based on where you're parked and can range between one and two blocks.

generalInfo.generalRule: Poncho Area: Parts of the show require that customers wear a poncho to protect clothing. Ponchos are provided by the venue. Strobe lights will be used during the performance. Blue Man Group Merchandise is available for purchase at the theatre. There is a cash bar with concessions. Restrooms are located on the first floor of the theatre.
generalInfo.childRule: Recommended for children 8 years and up. Children under 5 are not permitted in theatre. All children must have a ticket.

name: White River Amphitheatre

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: (360) 825-6200 for general information. Service Charge at venue box office is $6.00 per ticket. The Box Office is open on event days only.
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: For the safety of our employees and guests, the box office will be closed until further notice. Please keep checking back here for updates as to when we re-open. We appreciate your understanding.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Amex, Visa, Mastercard, Discover and Cash. Debit cards w/Visa or MC logo accepted. No personal checks.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Opens when venue Box Office opens. Located at Box Office adjacent to the amphitheatre main gate.

parkingDetail: Plenty of well-lit parking is available onsite. The parking fee is included in the ticket price. No fee is charged at the gate except for Star Parking. Star Parking is the paved lot closest to the entrance/exit and can be purchased on LiveNation.com. If Star Parking is available the day of the event, it will be sold at the entrance of the parking lot. Accessible parking is available on a first come first served basis in the paved lot closest to the main entrance.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available as well as hearing and sight impaired seating. Sign Interpreter available by request. Call 360-825-6200 for more information. White River Amphitheatre is a Barrier-Free facility. Entrance is at the main gate adjacent to the box office.

generalInfo.generalRule: Shows go on ** Rain or Shine ** . Covered areas of this venue are the floor, 100 and 200 levels. The general admission lawn area is uncovered. No Smoking in the reserved seating area. Policies regarding what Guests can bring to a concert can vary by event. Please call 360-825-6200 for additional information. Items not allowed at all shows: No Weapons No Laser Pointers No Hard Coolers No Alcohol or Soft Drinks No Glass or Metal Containers No Food except as described below No large Backpacks No Umbrella’s Items generally allowed, but subject to change without notice: One factory sealed plastic bottle of water One small, gallon sized, clear plastic bag with snack foods. One gallon sized soft sided collapsible cooler Small blanket, no tarps please (may not be allowed at high activity shows) Low profile beach chair - seat no higher than 9” off the ground (may not be allowed at high activity shows or if the lawn is not open) Camera Policy: At the request of the artists, as a general rule small personal cameras are allowed. Not allowed are professional cameras or cameras with detachable lens. Video cameras are not allowed. No flash photography please. CALL THE VENUE AT 360-825-6200 FOR FURTHER INFORMATION No audio recording equipment permitted. All rules are subject to change without notice based on the event. At most shows the venue also rents lawn chairs for $10.00 each. Wide variety of food and soft drinks available for purchase. Beer and wine sold in designated areas only. Liquor is sold in the River Lodge. Must be 21 and over with valid I.D. Credit cards accepted at permanent stands. ATM's available.
generalInfo.childRule: Children 24 months and under are admitted free with a paid ticket but must sit on lap.

name: Broadway Playhouse at Water Tower Place

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: The Administrative offices of the Broadway Playhouse at Water Tower Place may be reached at (312) 977-1700. For groups of 20 or more, call (312) 977-1710.
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Box office hours vary. Please call (312) 977-1700 for the current week's hours.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Box Office accepts cash, Visa, Mastercard, American Express and Discover. No personal checks, please.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets are available for pick up beginning one hour prior to showtime on the day of the event. Customer must present the credit card used to place the order, a valid picture ID, and the confirmation number.

parkingDetail: Parking is available at Water Tower Place Parking Garage, located in the lover level of Water Tower Place. Enter just west on the theatre entrance on Chestnut St.
accessibleSeatingDetail: For wheelchair accessible seating please call Broadway in Chicago at 312-977-1700 ext. 1259

generalInfo.generalRule: There are no refunds or exchanges on tickets purchased for Broadway In Chicago events. Cameras and recording devices are not allowed. Doors open 30 minutes prior to showtime. No outside food or beverages allowed.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Due to the ongoing global pandemic, and to protect the health and safety of our guests and venue staff members, the box office at Xfinity Theatre will be open on-day-of-show only. If you’d like to purchase tickets, please visit us at www.livenation.com. If you’re looking to obtain a refund for a show that was either canceled, postponed or rescheduled, please visit us at www.livenation.com/refund for more information. We look forward to seeing you at our next show at Xfinity Theatre
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, MasterCard, Visa, American Express and Discover cards
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is distributed from designated windows at the Box Office which is at the main entrance to the facility. Patrons will be asked to present their picture ID and the credit card used to make the purchase. Patrons are not permitted to leave tickets at Will Call for another party - please plan accordingly.

parkingDetail: Premier Parking is available for purchase in advance or on the day of the show (subject to availability) for most events. The Premier Parking lot is located at the main entrance to the venue at 61 Savitt Way. A Premier Parking hang tag is required for entry to the Premier Parking lot. Hang tags are available for purchase in advance or on the day of the show (subject to availability) for most events. Oversized vehicle parking is extremely limited and is sold first come first served and normally sells out on each event. Purchase in advance by adding Premier Parking to your ticket purchase when buying on LiveNation.com. Hang tags will be mailed by the venue no later than 10 days prior to the event. Premier Parking may also be purchased in advance at the Toyota Presents Oakdale Theatre Box Office in Wallingford, CT. Day of show purchases can be made at the entrance to the Premier lot - subject to availability. Rates vary according to the event and type of vehicle. Cash or credit card is accepted. ADA Accessible parking is located within the Premier Parking lot adjacent to the main gates. In an effort to provide ADA Accessible parking to our guests who need it, we require guests to display a valid ADA Accessible hangtag or license plate. ADA parking is available on a first come first served basis.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Seating for the disabled is available throughout the facility including lawn area. All wheelchair locations can be accessed via ramps. Adjacent companion seating is available subject to availability.

generalInfo.generalRule: ALL EVENTS ARE RAIN OR SHINE. There are no cancellations or refunds due to inclement weather. Re-entry to the facility is not permitted. The XFINITY Theatre is a non-smoking facility. Smoking is prohibited in the pavilion and all covered areas. All patrons are subject to search prior to entering the facility gates including the use of metal detectors. Patrons are permitted to bring outside food into the venue. Food must be in a gallon size plastic bag. Patrons are allowed to bring in one factory sealed bottle of water, up to one liter in volume (subject to artist approval). The following items are NOT permitted - Alcohol, drugs, fireworks, weapons of any type, signs or banners, coolers, glass containers, laser pointers, selfie sticks, animals (with the exception of service dogs), or backpacks. Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. Selfie sticks are not permitted in the venue. The following items MAY BE prohibited depending on the event, expected attendance or artist request: Small lawn chairs not exceeding 9" in height, blankets and umbrellas. When umbrellas are permitted they cannot be pointed. Specially designed lawn chairs are available for rent for a nominal fee.
generalInfo.childRule: Unless otherwise specified, all patrons 2 years of age and older require a ticket. Management is not responsible for artistic content and therefore we ask that parents use their discretion when deciding whether to purchase tickets for children.

PLEASE BRING A PICTURE ID, THE ACTUAL CREDIT CARD USED TO PURCHASE THE TICKETS, AND YOUR ORDER NUMBER Tickets that need to be reprinted will incur a $5.00 fee per ticket. To avoid this charge contact Ticketmaster at 800-653-8000 and report them as lost.

parkingDetail: VIP Premier Parking (up close to entrance) is available to purchase for most shows. Please check the online listings. Upgrade to VIP parking available at the Pryor Rd. entrance for most shows. General Parking is available for all shows and is included in the ticket price for most shows. There are approximately 6,000 parking spaces available. Parking lot opening times do vary. Typically lots open two hours prior to the show time. Please check with the venue regarding any questions. Please remove your valuables from plain site, close windows, and lock doors before proceeding to the venue. Cellairis Amphitheatre at Lakewood is not responsible for lost or stolen property.

generalInfo.generalRule: Camera Policy Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. NO flash photography, removable lens cameras, professional cameras or video cameras are permitted without venue approval. Please note, some artists will not allow any cameras. We will do our best to share this information in advance via our Facebook page. You may also call the main line at the venue on the show day to check for specific show information. Shoes required. NO Umbrellas. Events go on as scheduled, rain or shine. NO Backpacks. All bags are subject to search. NO Re-entry allowed. NO Selfie Sticks NO iPads or Tablets Allowed NO Cameras with removable lens or flash NO GoPros, video or audio recorders allowed Prohibited Items also include glass bottles, fireworks, alcoholic beverages, umbrellas, weapons of any kind, projectiles, lasers, coolers, and strollers. NO Food or beverage prepared off premises. However, patrons may bring one factory sealed bottle of water per person, up to one liter. Empty water bottles may also be brought in. Concessions available at venue. We offer typical event concessions: popcorn, hotdogs, fries, burgers, chicken tenders and an array of beverages. All of our meat food options have either Certified Humane, Global Animal Partnership or Animal Wefare Approved certification and our produce is sourced from local farms. We also offer a few vegetarian items.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Box Office is open during events only.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: VISA, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. We do not accept checks. The venue is cashless.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Your phone is your ticket. All tickets are delivered electronically.

parkingDetail: Valet service is available at most shows. Surface and garage parking available with skybridge access from the Green Street garage located on Clay between Main and Fannin. Additional parking information can be found via Downtown Houston's interactive parking map.

generalInfo.generalRule: For more information including door times, show times, support acts and other FAQs please visit https://www.punchlinehtx.com. Live Nation is committed to providing a safe and secure environment for our guests to enjoy their visit at our venues. There is a 2 Beverage Minimum per person inside of the showroom. Heckling, Cell Phone Usage, Video Recording and Picture taking are strictly prohibited. Doors open one hour prior to early shows and 30 minutes prior to late shows, please arrive early to the venue to allow enough time for you and your guests to move through the queue and enter the venue. We encourage you to review our safety and security information below prior to arrival at the venue. Prior to entering the venue, guests will be searched (wand or walk through metal detection and/or pat downs) to ensure that none of the restricted items enters the building. We suggest you leave valuable and unnecessary items at home. You may be asked to empty your pockets of all items so that they can be examined. All alcohol and narcotic laws will be strictly enforced. All bags will be searched, no large bags or backpacks will be allowed. Restricted Items: (Keep in mind priority number 1 is to HAVE FUN! Just please do it without the items listed below) No guns, knives, weapons, pepper spray, projectiles of any kind, or any other item that could be used to inflict harm. Replicas of any type of weapon are NOT permitted. No drugs, drug paraphernalia or illegal substances of any kind. No outside food or drinks. No personal video cameras, Go-Pros, selfie sticks, drones, masks or laser pointers. No professional photo, video, or audio recording equipment - (including detachable lenses, tripods, zooms or commercial use rigs) No unsealed liquids or gels of any kind. No jewelry or clothing that could inflict harm. No large bags over (10 x 10), backpacks, Camelbacks or Bota bags. No stuffed animals or toys of any kind. This list of prohibited items is subject to change at the discretion of venue management Zero Tolerance for Drug Use or Possession. The use or possession of any illegal drugs will not be tolerated anywhere inside or outside the venue. Security personnel and narcotics officers will be working and enforcing all drug-related laws. Do not bring any illegal substances to the event as violators will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law. If you are found impaired at the door, security will not allow you to enter the venue. Event staff reserves the right to refuse entry to anyone. Please come with a smile and be prepared to enjoy a fun filled night of knockout laughs! Safety and Medical Live Nation is dedicated to providing a safe environment. Security will be present throughout the entire event. The Security Staff will be available to assist your needs including any medical requests.
generalInfo.childRule: Punch Line Houston is an 18+ venue.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Box Office is located at the venue, on the East Side of the Billie Jean King National Tennis Center, near Parking Lot B. Please visit usopen.org for updated information regarding the US Open Box Office Hours. Box Office hours & dates are subject to change.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: NO TICKETS CAN BE LEFT AT WILL CALL.

parkingDetail: IMPORTANT PARKING INFORMATION for the US Open: TRAFFIC ALERT! PLEASE USE MASS TRANSIT! The USTA strongly recommends using public transportation throughout the US Open Event. Limited Public Parking is available at Citi Field and the South Field Lot for a fee with the exception of the dates when the Mets are playing at home. During conflict dates public parking will relocate to various lots throughout Flushing Meadows/Corona Park. These are numbered as lots 1 through 6. AVOID EXTENSIVE DELAYS & USE MASS TRANSIT! For the latest in up to date US Open transportation, parking and traffic information, please visit the US Open website usopen.org. Additionally, please visit the MTA's website for mass transit schedule and fare information at: https://new.mta.info/

generalInfo.generalRule: Arthur Ashe Stadium day and evening session tickets entitle customer to a reserved seat in Arthur Ashe Stadium for that session (day or evening) only. It also allows general admission access to all court and stadium matches for that session on a first-come, first-served basis. Evening session tickets allow access beginning at 6:00PM. Reserved tickets for Louis Armstrong Stadium are sold only for the first eight (8) day sessions and the first six (6) evening sessions. A reserved ticket entitles you to a reserved seat in Louis Armstrong Stadium and allows admission to Grandstand and field courts based on availability. A reserved Louis Armstrong ticket does not allow entrance into Arthur Ashe Stadium. Reserved tickets for Grandstand are sold only for the first six (6) day sessions. A reserved Grandstand ticket does not allow entrance into Arthur Ashe Stadium. Grounds admission tickets (sold by date) allow access to the National Tennis Center grounds including all court and stadium matches, EXCEPT Arthur Ashe Stadium. Grounds admission tickets allow access beginning at 9:30AM. We would like to take this opportunity to assure you that the safety of our patrons is our highest priority. In conjunction with federal, state and local authorities, we will have several important security measures in place at the US Open. All patrons will go through a screening process at the entry gates. There will be a limit of one bag per person admitted on to the grounds. All bags are subject to search and cannot be larger than 12"W x 12"H x 16"L. There will be no bag storage on the grounds. For a nominal charge, there is a bag storage facility outside the grounds. We recommend that ticketed fans allow extra time to enter the grounds. The existing policy of prohibiting knapsacks/backpacks, glass bottles or cans, coolers, video cameras/recording devices or any items deemed by management to be dangerous or inappropriate remains in effect. Most of the security measures being deployed will not be visible to fans. Rest assured, the US Open will be a safe, secure environment. For further information, visit: usopen.org

Clear Bag Policy To provide a safer environment for the public and significantly expedite fan entry into our venues, Rialto Theatre & 191 Toole have instituted a clear bag policy as of March 1st, 2022. The policy limits the size and type of bags that may be brought into our venues. generalInfo.generalRule: This is a tobacco/smoke free facility, there are two exterior smoking areas for patrons. No chewing gum allowed. No outside food or beverages are permitted to enter the facility. No outside food or beverages are permitted to enter the facility. Prohibited Items The following items are not permitted in the Expo Center by guests: • Cans, bottles, coolers or other similar containers Video cameras or audio recorders • Laser pens or laser products Air horns or noise makers • Weapons of any kind (this includes pocket knives) • Professional Cameras (Please note: Some shows do not allow cameras of any kind.) • Any other item deemed unacceptable by Expo Center management. Lost and Found The Expo Center provides lost and found services for guests in the Business Office located in the Main Street Lobby. Any items that are not claimed at the end of an event will be turned in at the Guest Services Desk. Items turned into Lost and Found can be claimed during regular business hours Monday – Friday 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM. The Expo Center is not responsible for any lost or stolen items. Cameras Artist request~ Use of video cameras is prohibited within the Expo Center. Cameras with no flash are permitted for certain family events, depending on the show. Cameras and recording devices are generally not permitted for special events. For more information please contact 606-444-5500. Exit and No Re-Entry Policy Exiting and re-entering the building with the same ticket is not permitted. Exceptions are only made in the case of medical situations and emergencies. Guests with medical emergencies or other guests who want to leave and then return to the building should be directed to the Guest Services Desk in the Main Street Lobby. Guest Conduct The following behavior or activities are grounds for eviction from the Expo Center: • Use of profanity or unacceptable language of any type. • Possession of illegal or unauthorized items inside the Expo Center. • Unacceptable or indecent dress. • Failure to obey or follow Expo Center smoking policies. We are a No Tobacco allowed facility. • Use of illegal substances or drugs. • Public drunkenness. • Entering or attempting to enter any "off limits" areas such as playing surface, stage area, backstage or restroom of the opposite sex. • Participating in a fight. Verbally abusing, threatening or intimidating other guests or arena employees. • The throwing of any objects or projectiles in seating areas, from balconies, ramps, stairwells or any other areas. Service Pets No pets or animals are allowed in the Expo Center with the exception of service animals.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: General Box Office Hours: Fridays from 10 AM to 4 PM Show Day Box Office Hours: Monday to Saturday Shows: 10AM until the headliner takes the stage Sunday Shows: 12PM until the headliner takes the stage The main box office is located at 2200 Encore Parkway next to the East Gate. It can be accessed both from inside and outside of the venue. Tickets can be purchased in-person at the box office when it is open, or online at www.livenation.com.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: All main concession stands take Visa/ MasterCard / Discover and American Express. All merchandise stands take all major credit cards.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will call tickets are available for pickup at the box office located 2200 Encore Parkway (outside the East Entry Gate) generally two hours prior to the showtime.There is temporary parking located in front of the box office. Please make sure that you have a photo ID matching the purchasers name to pick up tickets. Any name changes need to go through Ticketmaster Customer Service- 800-653-8000. Guests are not permitted to put tickets in will call for other guests to pick up. You will need to arrange to meet your party at the facility to deliver tickets. If tickets or passes are being left for you- they will only be left at the box office. This includes meet and greet passes, backstage passes, press passes, and tickets from the tour or other promotional company. We do not get these tickets until the day of the event close to doors so please do not try to pick them up earlier. If your tickets/passes are not in will call you will need to contact the person that left them for you to determine where they are. The box office cannot contact any member of the tour for you.

parkingDetail: There are no assigned spots on Lots A, B, C, or Premier. Physical Address- 2200 Encore Parkway Alpharetta, GA 30009. This is not the address for GPS parking directions. Instead use the following addresses to find your lot: Parking Lot A- 1755 Founders Parkway, Alpharetta, GA 30009 Parking Lot B- 1100 Sanctuary Parkway, Alpharetta, GA 30009 Parking Lot C and Premier- 11450 Maxwell Road, Alpharetta, GA 30009 VIP Parking Lot- 2300 Encore Parkway, Alpharetta, GA 30009
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is located in Orch1, Orch3, 101, 103, and 105 row WC (There is accessible seating on the General Admission Lawn: Requires only a lawn ticket, no special ticket required).

generalInfo.generalRule: Bag Policy: To reduce staff contact with guest belongings, we have implemented the following bag policy: we will allow clear plastic, vinyl or PVC tote bags no larger than 12x6x12 and/or small clutch bags 6x9. Diaper bags are permitted for guests with babies, and they must be thoroughly searched and tagged for identification upon entry. Cashless Payments: ALL points of sale including premier parking, merchandise, food & beverage will ONLY accept debit, credit or mobile pay (Apply Pay or Google Pay). For fans that wish to use cash, cash to card conversion will be available on-site. Lawn Chair Policy: Low profile chairs are allowed (seat is 9in or less from the ground). Taller camping chairs are not allowed (seat is over 9in from the ground). If you do not have a low profile lawn chair, you can rent one in advance or at the venue (limited availability on show-days). Items ALLOWED to be brought into venue: *Clear plastic, vinyl or PVC tote bagss no larger than 12inX6inX12in or small clutch bags (6inX9in). *small, personal size umbrellas *Water: Up to 1 (one) liter in a factory sealed bottle. Empty refillable aluminum and plastic water bottles are also permitted *Cameras: nonprofessional only, no detachable lenses *Lawn Chairs: low profile (seat no more than 9 inches off the ground) *Small blankets no larger than 4ftx8ft Items NOT ALLOWED to be brought into venue include, but are not limited to: *Weapons of any kind (including wallet chains, mace, pepper spray) *No frisbees nor footballs *Large or golf size umbrellas, nor umbrellas with a point on the end. *iPads, Go-Pros, drones, recording devices *Alcohol *Illegal drugs/substances *Glass containers *Cans *Coolers *Bags that do not meet the bag policy description *Laser pointers *Animals (except service animals) *Fireworks *Chains *Spikes *Food (food for dietary health issues may be allowed in a 1 (one) gallon clear plastic bag)
generalInfo.childRule: All of our events are all ages. Children 2 and under do not require a ticket but must sit on a parent's lap.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Due to the ongoing global pandemic, and to protect the health and safety of our guests and venue staff members, the box office at The Constellation Room at The Observatory will be open on-day-of-show only. If you’d like to purchase tickets, please visit us at www.livenation.com. If you’re looking to obtain a refund for a show that was either canceled, postponed or rescheduled, please visit us at www.livenation.com/refund for more information. We look forward to seeing you at our next show at The Constellation Room at The Observatory.

name: Chesapeake Employers Insurance Arena

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Monday-Friday: 11am-3pm Saturday-Sunday: Closed The box office will open 2 hours prior to event start time on event days. Box office will open 1.5 hours prior to UMBC sporting events. Doors open one hour prior to the scheduled time. Time can change per event. The box office is located at the front of the Chesapeake Employers Insurance Arena. Ticket Office windows are located outside, to the right of the main entrance doors.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets can be picked up anytime the Box Office is open. Customers must present a valid photo ID with the purchaser's name.

parkingDetail: You can park anywhere on campus. There is no charge for general parking for the Chesapeake Employers Insurance Arena. Follow directions to the open parking lots once you arrive on campus. Preferred Parking is in the Stadium Lot. Preferred Parking can be purchased in advance for select events on parkwhiz.com. Preferred Parking may be available for purchase on the day of the event, subject to availability.

generalInfo.generalRule: Bag Policy: Bags no larger than 12"x12"x8" will be permitted into Chesapeake Employers Insurance Arena. Guests who have bags larger than this size will be asked to return them to their vehicles or discard them. This is in addition to the existing policy that all bags, purses or personal items of any size are subject to search. Diaper bags or Medical bags are allowed to exceed that size limit, but will be searched. This policy is subject to change based on a show's request. Prohibited Items: Bottles or cans, backpacks or bags larger than 12"x12"x8", food coolers, outside food/beverages (baby food permitted), pamphlets, product samples, skateboards, rollerblades, bicycles, electric scooters, helmets, chairs, laptop computers, 2-way radios, balloons, permanent markers, spray paint, Cameras: no flash/professional photography, tripods or monopods, gopros, or selfie sticks, Signs/Flags/Banners/Posters: may not be larger than 11" x 17" or attached to a pole/stick Food, beverage, alcohol, cans, bottles, flasks, coolers, drugs, illegal substances Weapons, pepper spray/mace, flares, fireworks Frisbees and beach balls Laser pointers Any noise making devices (i.e. air horns, whistles, drums, plastic horns, etc.) Fireworks, illegal drugs and alcohol Audio/Video recording devices. Weapons and dangerous devices of any kind and any other items deemed unacceptable by Arena Management. The entire venue is cashless. Credit/debit cards, Apple Pay, Google Pay are accepted at the box office and concession stands. The 200 level does NOT have access via the elevator. They are only accessed by stairs

name: Blossom Music Center

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: For upcoming show information please call (330) 920-8040.
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Box Office is open on Show Days only two hours prior to show time.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: The Box Office accepts Cash, Discover, Visa, American Express and MasterCard.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets may be picked up at Will Call (box office reservation window) two hours prior to show time. Customers must present a picture ID, the actual credit card used to purchase the tickets, and confirmation number. PLEASE BRING A PICTURE ID, THE ACTUAL CREDIT CARD USED TO PURCHASE THE TICKETS, AND YOUR ORDER NUMBER.

parkingDetail: Don't want to walk from the grass parking lots?? Want to get to the show faster?? We highly recommend purchasing one of the below parking passes which will guarantee you a space in our PAVED parking lots which are CLOSER to the gates and will save you time. These are on a per show basis and can be purchased at TicketMaster.com VIP PARKING PASS (Lot A) available for purchase online until 10 days prior to the show date. Price ranges between $100 - $150 depending on the show and availability. PREMIER PARKING PASS (Lot CDE) available for purchase online until 10 days prior to the show. Price ranges between $80 - $100 depending on the show and availability. OVERSIZED PARKING is for any vehicle that takes up more than one space including party buses, limos and RVs. These passes may be available on the day of the show, but we recommend purchasing in advance for your convenience. Prices are subject to change and may increase on the day of the show. Due to heavy traffic, we encourage you to plan ahead, allow extra time, and look for alternate routes due to construction and traffic slowdowns.
accessibleSeatingDetail: ADA is available online to purchase by selecting Filters and toggling the Accessibility icon on. ADA is based on first come first serve when purchasing. A wheelchair and companion seats need to be selected to complete a transaction.

generalInfo.generalRule: PERMITTED - Items marked with (*) may have restrictions on specific shows. 1. Clear plastic, vinyl or PVC tote bags no larger than 12" x 6" x 12" or small clutch bags (4.5" x 6.5") - These do not need to be clear. 2. *Camera Policy: Small non-professional personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video, and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. Cameras must fit in a pocket, small clutch bag. The use of audio video recording is strictly prohibited. 3. *LAWN CHAIRS - Low seated lawn chairs with seat bottoms that sit no higher than 9â€  off the ground. Beach chairs are recommended; if your chair does not meet this requirement, chair rental is available for $10.4. *Blanket 5. *Factory sealed or empty plastic bottle of water up to 20oz will be the only beverage permitted into the venue. Empty bottles must have cap removed upon entry. One per person. 6. *Umbrellas that do not exceed 36â€  in diameter (no large golf style umbrellas), please be courteous of those around you. 7. Poncho/raincoats 8. *Small binoculars 9. Non-aerosol suntan lotions or bug repellent 10. Smoking is permitted with the exception of the pavilion, please be courteous of those around you. 11. *Food in a clear 1 gallon ziploc bag. One per person. 12. 20oz Factory sealed bottle of water NOT PERMITTED *Weapons, Alcohol, Illegal drugs/substances, Glass containers, Hard/Soft sided/large coolers, Laser pointers, Animals (except service animals), Fireworks, GoPros, Selfie Sticks, iPads or tablets, Video cameras, Drones, Large signs, posters or flags, In-Line skates, skateboards, bicycles or action sports equipment, Wagons or large non-collapsible stroller, Boot Spurs, Aerosol cans, Wallet chains and Carabiners, Bags that are not clear or are larger than 12" x 6" x 12". Please call 330-920-8040 for updated and show specific information. For The Cleveland Orchestra event policies please visit www.clevelandorchestra.com or call 330-920-8040
generalInfo.childRule: Ages 2 and under are permitted access to the lawn only. All ages are required to have a ticket in the pavilion.

parkingDetail: Lots are located at or near facility. Parking prices vary per lot. All lots have accessible sections with Lot 1—directly across from the venue—being the closest to the building; as you proceed toward the venue, let the parking staff know that you need accessible parking, and they will direct you. Payment may be made via credit card only.
accessibleSeatingDetail: For accessible seats in the reserved seating area, toggle on the wheelchair icon under filters to view and purchase. For lawn, purchase any lawn ticket; the lawn is accessible via the ramp. Telecommunications Device for the Deaf, TDD call, 856-365-1300 ext 24026

generalInfo.generalRule: We are a cashless facility accepting credit or debit cards only; for your convenience, cash may be converted to a card at a kiosk inside the venue; this card may be used inside or outside the facility. For your safety and convenience, we are no longer allowing lawn chairs to be brought into the venue. For most shows, one sealed bottle of water is permitted ( one liter or less). Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. Bags smaller than 6x9 are permitted; bags over 6x9 and up to 12x12x6 totes are allowed but must be clear. Bags over 12x12x6 are not permitted. All bags are subject to search. Guests have the right to refuse a bag search and the venue has the right to refuse entry. If you have any items that are not allowed into the venue, please return them to your vehicle.
generalInfo.childRule: Concerts: Children under 2 years are free if they sit on a parent's lap. Family shows: all children over 1 year old need a ticket.

parkingDetail: Premier Parking can be purchased when you purchase your concert tickets or on event day through Gate #6. Premier parking is sold online and at the entrance to the Premier parking lot. For EZ Out Parking enter through Gate 2
accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible seating is available in Sections 100,201,202,203,204 & 205. The companion seats are bolted down seats. The wheelchair seats are just a space where a wheelchair may be placed. Limited Mobility seating is available in Sections 101,203,205, & 304. These seats are located near an aisle. Sight and Hearing impaired seating is also available.

generalInfo.generalRule: ITEMS ALLOWED to be brought into the venue include: •Clear bags, clear backpacks, and clear totes no larger than 12" x 6" •Small, non-clear bags and fannypacks - no larger than 6" x 9" •Factory Sealed Water Bottle - Up to one gallon unfrozen per person, or empty reusable water bottle to fill inside* •Blankets* •Personal Misting Fan - Empty upon arrival •Sunscreen / Bug Spray (non-aerosol) •Cameras (without a detachable lens only) •E-Cigarettes & Vape Pens (Can only be used in Lawn & Plaza areas) *for select shows. ITEMS NOT ALLOWED to be brought into the venue include, but are not limited to: •Lawn Chairs •Weapons of any kind •Large Bags / Backpacks / Luggage / Computer Bags / Camera Bags •Outside food or drink - except factory sealed water •Aerosol Sunscreen •Alcohol •Coolers of any kind •Illegal drugs / substances •Glass containers •Selfie Sticks •Laser pointers •Glow sticks •Animals (except service animals) •Fireworks •Strollers •Heavy Chairs

name: Greensboro Complex

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Greensboro Coliseum Complex website: www.greensborocoliseum.com Greensboro Coliseum Advance Information Line (automated): 336-373-7474 Greensboro Coliseum Administrative Offices: 336-373-7400 Group Sales: 336-373-2632
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Advance Box Office Location at venue: An Advance Box Office is located on-site beside the Coliseum Administrative Offices along W Gate City Blvd. Advance Box Office Hours of operation: Thursday thru Saturday, 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm, also open at 12:00pm for arena event days. The dedicated facility box offices open 2 hours prior to event show-times. For events where tickets are only available at the door, the box office opens 30 minutes before door openings. Other Box Office Information: A Valid matching ID is required for all credit card purchases at the advance box office.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, American Express, Visa, MasterCard or Discover Card. A valid matching ID is required for credit card purchases.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Location at venue: Separate windows at each dedicated Venue Box Office. Hours of Operation: Will Call opens two (2) Hours prior to show-times. Other Information: An ID matching the person picking up the tickets as well as the name on the account, the credit card used to purchase the tickets and an order number are required for pick-up.

parkingDetail: Parking Location: The Greensboro Coliseum Complex maintains parking spaces in paved, lighted and managed parking lots on site at the facility. 4,800 spaces are located in the main parking lot accessible by entering the parking gates from Ellington Street and Patterson Avenue and are closest to the Amphitheater. Additional parking spaces are located in front of The Terrace and across Gate City Blvd Parking Lot at the northeast corner of Gate City Blvd and Coliseum Boulevard. RV Parking: For certain events, overnight RV parking is permitted. Space is subject to available and limited. Call 336-373-7492 to request availability and rates. Price (if applicable): Parking is charged based on the type of event scheduled and ranges from $5 to $50 per space utilized. Parking lot attendants are on duty during major events to help direct patrons with appropriate credentials to handicap and reserved spaces and to assist with regular car, RV and bus parking. RV and bus parking is charged by the number of spaces occupied. Approximate # of Parking spaces: 6,000+ on-site parking spaces are available in paved, lighted and managed parking lots. Handicapped parking (availability/location): Handicap parking spaces are located in front of each venue and are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Handicap van parking spaces are marked. Handicap parking spaces are charged accordingly along with general public parking spaces.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Greensboro Coliseum Complex is committed to meeting the needs of all guests including those that are hearing impaired, physically challenged or mobility impaired. If you require specific ADA seating accommodations, please call the Coliseum ADA Hotline at 336-218-5333. If you need other special assistance, please contact our Guest Services Manager at 336-373-7461. Greensboro Coliseum: Accessible seating is located in all levels of the Coliseum. Odeon Theater: Accessible seating is located in two sections of the Odeon Theater. Special Events Center: Accessible seating is located at the front of most 100 level sections. Visually/Hearing Impaired Seating is available in all venues. Guide dogs are permitted inside Complex facilities. The Coliseum presently maintains FM assistive listening devices which may be obtained from Guest Services. Interpreters: Interpreters are available for the hearing impaired by arranging for a minimum of 10 days prior to an event to ensure proper service and scheduling. Please call the Coliseum Guest Services Manager at 336-373-7461 to request interpreter services.

generalInfo.generalRule: Greensboro Coliseum Complex Admission Policies: All persons and items entering the Coliseum Complex facilities are subject to inspection. Visit greensborocoliseum.com/guest_services/policies for admission into and prohibited items Alcohol Sales: Beer, wine and soft drinks are all available at specific events subject to crowd management policies and procedures. Patrons are required to have a valid driver's license from any state, military ID, passport or valid North Carolina State issued ID. Out of state ID cards are not accepted
generalInfo.childRule: Minimum age for admittance if any: Parents should carefully consider whether a performance is appropriate for children before planning to attend. All events are open to the public and there are no minimum age restrictions. Only specific events will have a minimum age limit which will be communicated in local advertising. Should a young child be unable to sit quietly through a quiet event, ushers will ask the parent or child to step into the concourse until they can be quieted. Minimum age at which paid tickets are mandatory: The general policy is if a child has had their second birthday, a ticket is required. The policy supersedes numbers of seats required (i.e. - a ticket is required regardless of whether the child sits in the seat purchased or the parents lap). Select shows may require tickets for all ages or ages one year old and up to have a ticket. Booster seats are not always available and are subject to use.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: BOX OFFICE HOURS **Concert tickets are only available at the T-Mobile Park Box Office on Day of Show** Located on Edgar Martinez Drive S. and First Avenue S. the T-Mobile Park Box office is only open on game days. 12PM for games that start after 5pm, 10am for games that start earlier than 5PM The Left Field Box Office opens 2.5 hours prior to home games and can help you with Ticket Purchases or Ticketmaster orders and closes at the end of the 4th inning. GATE TIMES Gates to the T-Mobile ‘Pen open 2 hours prior to game time. All other gates open 90 minutes prior to first pitch. Gate times may vary for special events such as Opening Day, special promotions, and the Postseason. T-Mobile Park will meet or exceed the health guidelines and protocols issued by Local and State governments at the time of the event. Due to COVID-19 restrictions, changes to event status may occur. To ensure your safety, we recommend you check https://www.Mariners.com/Safety on the day of your event for the latest information on event status. By purchasing tickets to this event, unless prohibited by law, you agree to abide by the health and safety measures in effect at the time of the event, which may include, but not be limited to, wearing masks, providing proof of vaccination status and/or providing proof of negative COVID-19 test. Entry requirements and venue protocols are subject to change. Be sure to check your event venue website for the latest information.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, VISA, AMC, MC
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call tickets are held at the Home Plate Box Office (located on the south side of the ballpark, adjacent to the Home Plate Gate on Atlantic Street) and can be picked up to 2 hours prior to game time. Gate Opening Times All gates open 2 hours prior to game time.

parkingDetail: Where To Park: There are several large and many small, parking lots and garages within a short walk of the ballpark. Each lot is operated by independent owners and operators who establish their own rates and policies. Generally lots and garages closer to the ballpark will charge more for parking. Major nearby facilities include: Mariners Garage: 2,000 spaces, located just south of the ballpark on Atlantic Street and First Avenue. Garage opens 3 hours prior to game time. Disabled and Charter Bus parking can be purchased in advance by calling 206-346-4001 at least 10 business days in advance. Single game parking available in advance through Ticketmaster. Stadium Exhibition Center Garage: 2,000 spaces, located on Royal Brougham Way at First Avenue. Charter bus parking on space available bases. Call 206-254-0811 for more information. Union Station Garage: 1,200 spaces, Fourth Avenue south of Jackson Street. Call 206-254-0811 for more information. North Lot (Old Kingdome): 400 spaces featuring RV parking, located on King Street at Second Avenue. Call 206-254-0811 for information. Republic Parking: 300 spaces located on South Jackson. Home Plate Parking: 300 spaces located at First and Atlantic. There are many parking garages and lots in the central business district to the north of the ballpark that offer very reasonable evening and weekend parking rates. Garage entrances are located mostly on east-west streets. Free Metro bus service is offered as far south as Jackson Street from these locations. The Mariners discourage fans from parking on the street in the Pioneer Square or International District neighborhoods unless they are also patronizing local merchants there. It is important to read all parking restriction information posted along streets around the ballpark to avoid being ticketed or towed away. Several on-street curb locations are not available for parking or stopping before, during or after games. Please read and obey all posted signs. Violators are subject to immediate towing by the Seattle Police Department.

generalInfo.generalRule: Beverages, Bottles & Cans : No outside beverages will be permitted into Safeco Field, with the exceptions of: baby bottles/formula, unopened, soft-sided, single-serve containers of drinks (such as small milk cartons, cardboard juice boxes or foil pouches), and medication or other special needs, including specially distilled or purified water (supported by appropriate documentation). Guests may bring in empty plastic sports-type bottles and fill them at any of the 75 drinking fountains located throughout the ballpark. Food : The Mariners will allow guests to bring food into Safeco Field subject to the following limitations: All food items should be wrapped, bagged or inside a container to avoid spillage. Food that could be thrown as a projectile should be sliced or quartered (i.e. oranges, apples and other fruit) Food should be consumed in general seating or designated picnic areas. Food may not be brought into any of the ballparks restaurants, lounges or suites. Food containers must be small enough to fit under the guests seat. (This generally means no containers larger than 10"x16"x13".) Bottles, cans, thermoses and jugs are prohibited. Prohibited Items : Beverages, Bottles & Cans Thermoses, Jugs Beach Balls Helium Balloons Picnic Baskets Laser Pointers Noisemakers, Airhorns Weapons
generalInfo.childRule: Children 2 years of age and under are able to sit in parents lap free of charge for Mariners games.

generalInfo.generalRule: As a Guest of Northwest Stadium, your safety and enjoyment is our primary concern. Please note everyone entering Northwest Stadium is subject to search by our security staff as a condition of entrance to the stadium. This requires fans to enter through predetermined screening locations, which sometimes results in crowding. We apologize for this necessary inconvenience. Please be aware that the following items are prohibited inside Northwest Stadium: • Bags, including: backpacks, gym bags, duffel bags, packages, briefcases, purses, etc. • Food and beverages of any kind • Umbrellas (except in suites) • Bottles, jugs, thermoses, cans, coolers, or any other container • Animals (except for certified guide dogs) • Whistles, horns and other noise makers • Weapons, firearms • Illegal drugs • Seat cushions, folding chairs • Leafletting or distribution of any literature Only clear plastic bags not to exceed 12inches x 6inches x 12 inches are permitted inside Northwest Stadium. Additionally, small clutch bags no larger than the size of a hand may be carried separately or within the clear plastic bag. Northwest Stadium cannot provide storage for any prohibited items fans bring to the gate. Items must be returned to a fan’s vehicle or discarded. Northwest Stadium is not responsible for any discarded items. Understanding and adhering to these policies will help ensure that all fans enter Northwest Stadium in a safe and timely manner. If ticket holder elects not to consent to these searches, ticket holder will be denied entry to the stadium. We appreciate your cooperation with game day security requirements. For more information go to www.NFL.com/AllClear. Date and Time of events are subject to change. No refund will be provided if ticket holder cannot attend any rescheduled event.
generalInfo.childRule: All fans age 3 and older must have a valid ticket for Washington Commanders games. Policy is subject to change for other events at Northwest Stadium. For additional information call 301-276-6000

ada.adaCustomCopy: Accessible seats may be purchased in advance online for all Northwest Stadium events. Additional accommodations to fit your needs may be requested at the event by visiting any box office or guest services booth within Northwest Stadium.

One bag per guest. - One factory sealed plastic bottle, one liter , containing a non-alcoholic beverage (not frozen) per guest. CAMERA/VIDEO POLICY: In general, small digital and disposable cameras are allowed in the venue for most shows. Video recorders, flash photography, removable lens cameras, and iPads/Kindles/E-Readers/GoPros are NOT permitted. The venue has the right to restrict ALL CAMERAS, at any time, without prior warning. The following items are NOT permitted: - Glass containers, cans, alcoholic beverages - Coolers, backpacks or oversized bags/purses - Audio or video recording equipment - Professional cameras, including iPads/Kindles/E-Readers/GoPros Any lawn chairs - Umbrellas, Pets, Stickers, Skateboards, Aerosol Cans, Tables, Barbecues - Laser pointers, wallet chains, knives or weapons ALL POLICIES ABOVE ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE ON AN EVENT-BY-EVENT BASIS The venue has the right to restrict any items at any time without prior warning. name: Bethel Woods Center for the Arts

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: For information, call 1-845-583-2000. To buy tickets 1-800-745-3000
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Bethel Woods Box Office opens in early spring for the first concert on-sale of the season. Open daily Monday-Saturday 10:00 am-5:00 pm during the summer concert season. Open until approximately 9:00 pm on event days until posted show time. Open 2 and a half hours prior to show time on Sundays with a scheduled event.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Amex, Visa, MC, Discover
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets may be picked up at Will Call (box office reservation window) 2 ½ hours prior to show time. Customers must present the actual credit card used when they place the order, picture id, and confirmation number.

parkingDetail: There is no additional charge for parking at Bethel Woods. Ample parking is available adjacent to Hurd Road. Parking for patrons with disabilities is available in designated areas in the North Lot. Bethel Woods Center for the Arts prides itself in being a safe, family friendly environment. In order to provide for the highest level of safety and convenience for our guests, we have established the following guidelines for our parking lot areas. Tailgating is allowed in the parking areas; however, there are NO tents or canopies permitted. Barbequing is permitted on the pavement with gas-fired grills only-no charcoal grills. State Law prohibits the sale of tickets or any unauthorized merchandise in the parking lot. Parking at Bethel Woods is for the convenience of concert or museum ticket holders only. Distribution of unauthorized pamphlets, flyers, or any other item is strictly prohibited. There is no overnight parking at Bethel Woods.
accessibleSeatingDetail: There are ADA accessible seats for this venue available online, at Ticketmaster outlets, charge by phone and the box office.

generalInfo.generalRule: There is a no re-entry policy upon exiting. Each guest in the pavilion must be a ticket holder with an assigned seat. All shows are “Rain or Shine” and will not be cancelled due to inclement weather. Main gates open approximately 1 hour prior to performance show time. Most of the Bethel Woods campus is designated NON-SMOKING. Bethel Woods has designated smoking areas along the top-rear of the lawn seating area walkway. Please limit smoking to those designated areas.
generalInfo.childRule: Children under 2 are admitted free on the lawn without a separate admission ticket.

ada.adaPhones: For further information on purchasing accessible tickets, call (845) 583-2050.
ada.adaCustomCopy:
Accessible seating is reserved for the exclusive use of individuals with disabilities and their guests.  Purchase or use of these seating locations by non-disabled individuals is strictly prohibited and can result in ejection and/or forfeiture of ticket price.  If you have any questions regarding accessibility at Bethel Woods Center for the Arts please contact our Box Office at (845)-583-2050.
There are two types of seating available for purchase:
Patron with Disability:  Transfer from Wheelchair to Seat
Patron with Disability:  Your Wheelchair as Actual Seat
Wheelchair accessible seating is for those who use their wheelchair as the actual seat.  Transfer patron seating is reserved for those guests who need accessible seating but are not wheelchair users.

Tickets for patrons with accessible needs, subject to availability, may be purchased in the following ways:
1.  Order online (Hit the back button below):
A.  Get to the order form for the event you wish to purchase.
B. When the order form is displayed, choose the type of seating you wish to purchase and quantity of tickets you require.
2.  Call the Bethel Woods Center for the Arts Box Office at (845)-583-2050.
3. Go directly to the Bethel Woods Center for the Arts Box Office during regular business hours.
If you have any questions regarding accessibility at Bethel Woods Center for the Arts please contact our Box Office during regular business hours at (845)-583-2050.

generalInfo.generalRule: What can I bring? Due to artist restrictions, permitted and non-permitted items are subject to change without notice. We regret any inconvenience this may cause. Camera Policy: Small personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Professional cameras with detachable lenses are not allowed. Audio/Video recorders are not allowed. Food/Beverages: You are allowed to bring in food for personal consumption as long as it fits in a one-gallon ziplock bag (No coolers of any kind are allowed). You are also allowed to bring one 1 gallon factory sealed plastic water bottle. We now have a clear bag policy. All bags coming into the venue need to be clear plastic/vinyl and measure no larger than 12"x12"x6". Lawn chairs can vary greatly in size and shape, so as a courtesy to our guests, Hollywood Casino Amphitheatre - St. Louis offers low-back lawn chairs for rent that do not hinder the view of other guests. No outside chairs of any kind are allowed in the venue. Blankets are allowed in. Umbrellas: Small umbrellas without a metal tip are allowed in the venue. Larger umbrellas or umbrellas with metal tips are not allowed. Strollers and baby carriers are allowed. Only Umbrella-style strollers are allowed in reserved seating. All other strollers and carriers types are only allowed in the lawn. If a regular size stroller or carrier is brought into the venue, and the guest has reserved seating, they will be required to check it in at the gates. Other Items Not Allowed: Weapons of any kind; Alcohol and/or controlled substances; Glass, metal, cans, soft drinks, fireworks, frisbees, pets, laser pens/pointers, banners/signs with sticks; Any other item that may pose a threat to other guests, amphitheater staff, or performers.
generalInfo.childRule: For most performances, children under the age of two years may be admitted free but the child MUST sit on a lap. To occupy a seat, a child MUST have a ticket. Please do not bring pumpkin seats, playpens, etc. They will NOT be allowed into the venue.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Due to the ongoing global pandemic, and to protect the health and safety of our guests and venue staff members, the box office at Darien Lake Amphitheater will be open on day-of-show only. The box office opens in tandem with the parking lots, approximately 3 hours prior to doors. If you'd like to purchase tickets, please visit us at www.livenation.com. If you're looking to obtain a refund for a show that was either canceled, postponed or rescheduled, please visit us at www.livenation.com/refund for more information. We look forward to seeing you at our next show at Darien Lake Amphitheater.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: American Express, Discover, MasterCard, and Visa. Checks are not accepted. Cash is accepted at the box office only. All concession and merchandise stands take credit and debit only. In the event you are not carrying a credit or debit card, you can exchange cash for a card at our reverse ATM located in the South Concourse near the merch booth. Staff will also be available on site at the Guest Services Booth in the South Concourse and the merch booth in the North Concourse to exchange cash for card, dollar for dollar, without any service fees.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Darien Lake Amphitheater no longer offers tickets to be held at will call as an option during purchase.

parkingDetail: The cost of general admission parking is included in the price of your concert ticket. Please show your concert ticket as you enter the Theme Park parking lot (entrance located off Route 77). Parking for guests with disabilities near the main entrance gate is also available for all shows. Follow designated signage upon entering the main parking lot. Parking is available on a first-come, first-serve basis. Parking upgrades are available at an additional charge for E-Z Out, Premier, and Front Row Parking. Oversized vehicles, including RVs, buses and limos, should utilize the oversized parking section. Oversized parking requires a paid parking pass that can be purchased as an upgrade.
accessibleSeatingDetail: The venue is wheelchair accessible.

generalInfo.generalRule: Items allowed in the venue: Clear plastic, vinyl or PVC tote bags no larger than 12" x 6' x 12", OR a small clutch bag (4.5" x 6.5"). Blankets. Food Items - (1) 1-gallon clear bag/person, water - (1) 1-gallon factory sealed bottle/person, bug Spray and Sunscreen - non-aerosol ONLY, umbrellas (36" or shorter; no metal tips), and cameras (non-professional only; no detachable lenses). Items NOT allowed in the venue: Lawn chairs of any kind (lawn chairs are available for rent), coolers of any kind, weapons of any kind, alcohol, illegal drugs/substances, glass containers or cans, bags that are not clear or are larger than 12" x 6" x 12", laser pointers, animals (except service animals), fireworks. Note: These guidelines are subject to change. Please call the venue for more information.
generalInfo.childRule: Children age two and under are admitted free into the amusement park and all events. For our patrons with reserved seating to events and small children, one child per lap please.

name: Arvest Bank Theatre at the Midland
The Showroom at the Golden Nugget
BankPlus Amphitheater at Snowden Grove

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: For the safety of our employees and guests, the box office will be closed until further notice. Please keep checking back here for updates as to when we re-open. We appreciate your understanding.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Cash, Visa, Mastercard & Discover
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Location : Box Office Opens : 2 hours prior to show

parkingDetail: Location : On site
accessibleSeatingDetail: This is an accessible venue

generalInfo.generalRule: Alcohol BankPlus Amphitheater offers a wide variety of alcoholic beverages for purchase during your time at the venue, from mixed drinks to wine to beer. A number of craft beers will be offered on site as well. Must be 21 years of age or older and provide a valid ID. You are not permitted to bring in any alcoholic beverages into the venue. Animals - Service BankPlus Amphitheater’s policy - consistent with the ADA standard definition - limits a "service animal" to a dog that is individually trained to do work or perform tasks for an individual with a disability. Under ADA standards, "comfort," "therapy," or "emotional support animals" do not meet the definition of a service animal. BankPlus Amphitheater can request specific documentation and/or advanced notice for service animals. ATM ATM’s are located in the main north plaza, near the Box Office and Merch tent. Bag Inspections All bags will be searched upon entry. Guests have the right to refuse a bag search and the venue has the right to refuse entry. If you have any items that are not allowed into the venue please return them to your vehicle or discard them into the appropriate trash receptacles at the entry gates. Please refer to the Permitted Items section for more information. Banners and Signs Signs larger than 8.5 X 11 in are not permitted into the venue. This size is a standard sheet of paper. We do not allow in banners or signs that are larger than this due to the potential to block other guests view of the performance. All signs must be appropriate in nature and not be a distraction to the artist. Box Office The Box Office is open only on event days at the venue. For most event days the box office will open at noon and remain open until the main act goes on stage. Tickets can be purchased for any BankPlus Amphitheater event during the hours of operation. Camera Policy SUBJECT TO CHANGE - The standard venue policy allows camera phones, disposable cameras, and small digital cameras. Any camera that has a detachable lens will be considered professional and not allowed in. If the camera lens zooms out of the camera more than 1 inch, it will be considered a professional camera and will not be allowed in. Some artists do not permit cameras so please check back for the show you will be attending to ensure that cameras will be allowed in. Cancellation Policy Cancellations can occur in the event of severe weather, artist cancellation, or an act of God. In the event of a show cancellation local media will be notified and any information about a potential reschedule will be made available. Refunds will be available at the point of purchase. Conceal and Carry BankPlus Amphitheater does not allow weapons of any kind in the venue. No patron will be allowed to enter the venue with a weapon. The venue will not secure weapons and will not take responsibility for any weapons left in vehicles. Credit/Debit Cards All concession and merchandise stands take all major credit cards - additionally, please see ATM's for cash locations on site. Drinking Water Guests are permitted to bring in One (1) factory sealed bottle of water up to one gallon in size for most events. Aluminum bottles, refillable plastic water bottles, and Camelbak type containers are not permitted, unless otherwise noted within the specific event information. Ejections Any guest that is violating venue policy or the law will be ejected from the facility at the sole discretion of Venue Management. Emergency In the event of an emergency while on site - BankPlus Amphitheater has trained paramedics to assist with any medical issues. First Aid is located on the north side of the venue near the merch tent and entry gates. Additionally, any staff member with a radio can dispatch First Aid to the location needed. Southaven Police are on site during events as well, in the event additional assistance is needed. BankPlus Amphitheater works closely with the City of Southaven to ensure that we are up to date on any dangerous weather or potential crowd related issues. In the event of a weather emergency - we will communicate with guests that are inside of the facility as well as guests on their way to the venue. Fan Assistance If you need assistance while at an event, please visit our Guest Services tent located inside the North entry gates near First Aid and Merch. Fast Lane For certain events, fast lane upgrades may be available for an additional charge. The fast lane allows you access to a private entrance, enabling you to skip the line at the main gate. Group Ticket Sales BankPlus Amphitheater offers group ticket sales. If you have a large party of 10 or more that plan on attending a show please contact our Venue Sales team: Madison Saltalamacchia, (504) 561-7011 / madisonsalt@livenation.com Guests with Disabilities Live Nation and BankPlus Amphitheater strive to ensure that all guests have a great time at our venue. If you need additional assistance while onsite please make sure you let a member of the Guest Services team know. - Ticketing- Accessible tickets can be purchased online via www.livenation.com. It’s not necessary to call the box office to place an order as all accessible tickets are available online. Look for the logo on the “Find Tickets” page to view all available accessible seats. Accessible seating is available in every price range, but be advised it does occasionally sell out. We have limited seating available for guests on the day of the event, so it’s important to plan ahead and to secure accessible seating when purchasing tickets. - Day of Show Parking- Accessible Parking is located in the West parking lot accessible via Getwell Rd.. - Unexpected Needs- if you have had an injury or illness that prevents you from using the original seat you purchased we strongly recommend going through www.livenation.com to exchange all tickets for accessible seating. We will have a very limited number of seats available on the day of the show for such issues, and we cannot guarantee we will be able to seat you. However, if you arrive on site and need to exchange your purchased ticket for an accessible seat please go to the box office and they will be able to assist you with this request. Please remember that accessible seating allows for the guest and one companion. The companion is still required to purchase their own ticket. Lawn Chairs Lawn chairs are not permitted at BankPlus Amphitheater Lost or Stolen Tickets Please report any lost or stolen tickets to Ticketmaster as soon as you are aware they are missing or destroyed. If a ticket needs to be reprinted during the event, guests can visit the box office and have their ticket reprinted. Please note: we are only able to accommodate reprints for tickets that were purchased from an authorized Ticketmaster/Live Nation retailer. Lost and Found If you lose an item while you are at an event- you can visit our Guest Services tent located inside the entry gates near First Aid and the Merch tent to see if it has been turned in. BankPlus Amphitheater retains a list of all lost and found items following each event. Please call (901) 577-9063 and leave a detailed description of the lost item in advance to see if your item has been found - Please do not come out to the venue without calling to coordinate item pick up as we will not be available to assist you. Medical Assistance First Aid is located on the north side of the venue near the entry gates and merch tent. BankPlus Amphitheater has trained medical personnel that are able to assist with any issue you encounter. Ambulances are on site throughout the duration of the event and can transport guests, if needed. If you have a condition that requires the use of a needle for medication while you are onsite, please do so in First Aid to ensure the syringe is properly disposed of. Merchandise Merchandise will be available for all concerts at our Merch Tent located in the North Plaza near First Aid and the entry gates. All concert gear is property of the artist and the venue has no responsibility related to the craftsmanship or style of any merchandise. Please make sure you check that you have the correct size and there are no defects in the shirt before you walk away from the stand. The venue cannot assist with replacing or refunding any merchandise after the event has ended. Parking Paid parking lots are available on the north and south sides of the venue. Premium Parking (closest to the entry gates) is available as well. Please follow parking signs upon arrival. Cash and Credit Cards are accepted. Permitted Items Guests are permitted to bring in the following - ALL ITEMS ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE BASED ON THE DISCRETION OF THE ARTIST - - Clear Bag policy - Cameras: see camera policy above - 1 Factory sealed bottle of water per person up to a gallon in size - we may ask you to remove the cap upon entry. - Extra clothes - Sunscreen and bug spray in non-aerosol containers - Blankets - no larger than 10’x10’ - Stadium seating cushions - Six pack size soft sided coolers - Poster Tubes Non Permitted Items - Illegal drugs - Umbrellas - All lawn chairs and furniture - Beverages other than water - no soda, alcohol, juice, or energy drinks - Weapons of any kind, including mace. - Wallet chains - Pocket knives - Fireworks - Electronics (excluding cell phones) including but not limited to: laptops, iPads, Kindles, video games, GoPro's etc. - Hard coolers or coolers on wheels - Sports equipment of any kind (Baseballs, footballs, tennis balls, frisbees, etc) - Hula Hoops - Laser Pointers - Selfie Sticks - Inflatables of any kind Premium / VIP Seating If you are interested in purchasing our season seats within the reserved section or within our VIP boxes, please contact Madison Saltalamaccia in the Premium Seat Sales department at (504) 561-7011 / madisonsalt@livenation.comNeither the venue receptionist nor the box office can answer questions regarding pricing or availability for these locations. Restrooms Restrooms are located on both sides of the venue with additional portable locations near the back of the lawn. Re-Entry Re-Entry is not permitted at BankPlus Amphitheater unless otherwise instructed by venue management. Please ensure that everything needed for the event is brought in at time of entry. If you do leave at any point in the evening - you will not be allowed rentry without a new ticket. Please note: If you are ejected from the venue due to a policy violation there will be no re-entry allowed. Security Venue security is located throughout the facility to ensure a safe and secure environment. All security personnel can assist with any safety concerns. Please visit our Guest Services tent with any questions or concerns or if any additional assistance is needed. Strollers Strollers are not permitted at BankPlus Amphitheater due to concerns they can become a trip hazard and the fact that there is nowhere to securely store them. Umbrellas Umbrellas are never permitted in BankPlus Amphitheater. VIP Club The VIP Club is a private lounge with an outside patio for our box seat and season ticket holders. The club will open at doors and remain open until 1 hour after the event has ended. VIP Club guests have access to private restroom facilities, dedicated parking and entry, as well as premium liquor and beer selections. Weather All shows are rain or shine. In the event of severe weather (including lightning or severe high winds), a concert may be delayed, postponed, or cancelled depending on the severity of the threat.. Please monitor BankPlus Amphitheater social media channels for weather and show status updates. If severe weather threatens while patrons are onsite, BankPlus Amphitheater will also make announcements via the PA system, video screens, and event staff.

You can choose to take prohibited items back to your car or surrender them to security. Once an item is surrendered, it cannot be reclaimed. Prohibited Activities The following activities are not allowed on the raceway property: Solicitation for donations Unauthorized selling or buying of event tickets Unapproved selling of merchandise or services Unapproved distribution of any item Unapproved entertaining (organized concerts not approved by the raceway are prohibited) Smoking Policy: For the health and comfort of all guests, smoking is prohibited in all seating areas, suites, concession stand lines, eating areas and restrooms. Guests may smoke on the ground level concourse behind the Main Grandstand and away from the seating areas in the Turns 2, 3, 7 and 9 Terraces. Electronic cigarettes, vapor cigarettes and cigars are subject to the same restrictions. Guests who fail to comply with this policy will be asked to leave the facility.

accessibleSeatingDetail: Our facility is ADA compliant as required by the laws set forth by the powers that be. Level 1 is the area that a person with disabilities will be accommodated with complete access throughout level 1 which has the same aspects as the rest of the facility. It allows access to the restroom with handicap stalls as well as access to the bar / food areas and has easy access to the dance floor which has ramps and complete exiting capabilities. Disabled smokers can be accommodated at the exit door. There are tables available and on hold for disabled patrons if they are wanting to purchase a seat. Those tables are tables 26-30 on the left. If it is a general admission ticket they are looking for there is not a special reserved general admission area. Everyone is first come, first serve. Sometimes we have general admission only events which also are first come, first serve. The back of the dance floor is a fine place to view a concert for everyone, I believe it to the best place in the house. If it is VIP that you are looking for please purchase a VIP seat and email info@wildbillsatlanta.com with your contact information and we will make sure you are assisted into the VIP area. Note that sometime VIP is all put on hold due to sound equipment stacks and isn't always on tap for purchase. I hope this helps in your buying decision.

It is STRONGLY suggested that you call the Toyota Business Office at 530-742-5200 on the day of the show you are attending to get the specific policies for that event. name: Outlaw Field at the Idaho Botanical Garden

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: ExtraMile Arena Box Office: 208-426-1766
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: ExtraMile Arena Box Office (Monday - Friday, 10am-5pm) 208-426-1766 (Ticket Sales)
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets purchased online or over the phone will be given the option for Will Call to be picked up at the ExtraMile Arena Box Office (M-F 10am-5pm). On the day of the event, tickets not already picked up will be available at the Will Call table one (1) hour before gates open in front of the Idaho Botanical Garden Administrative Office. Photo ID of original purchaser REQUIRED. You may also choose to manage your own tickets with the e-Ticket (print-at-home or mobile) option. Suite Tables purchased through the ExtraMile Arena will be available to pick up on the day of show at the Will Call table (1) hour before gates open.

parkingDetail: Parking is free, but limited. Parking staff will direct you to available spots. We encourage patrons to bike, car pool or use public transportation. We encourage guests to go green and ride their bikes to the event.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Concerts are presented on a grass park like setting. All guests are either seated on the grass with blankets or in low back chairs. A limited number of spaces are held in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act. There will be a wheelchair accessible designated seated area on the field. Parking staff will direct concertgoers with mobility impairment disabilities to a closer parking area. Please communicate your needs with parking staff. We encourage all guests with special needs to contact ExtraMile Arena Box Office at 208-426-1766 and every reasonable effort will be made to accommodate.

generalInfo.generalRule: All concerts are held RAIN OR SHINE. Be prepared for extremes such as heat, wind, or rain. Dress accordingly, as the temperature may drop noticeably after sunset. No umbrellas. No re-entry. Cameras with removable lenses, video cameras & recording devices are prohibited. Firearms are prohibited. Food & beverage will be available for sale. You are welcome to bring a cooler & pack your own picnic. No alcohol, knives, or glass containers may be brought inside. On-site cooking or barbecues are not allowed. Low back chairs are welcome (8" max from ground to front of seat bottom/30" max to top of chair back in highest position). Please call the ExtraMile Arena box office at 208-426-1766 for Outlaw Field Reserved Garden Suite tickets.
generalInfo.childRule: Children 2 years old and younger do not need tickets

parkingDetail: We recommend that you park in the McKinley Avenue parking structure next to the Music Instruction Building located directly across from Emens Auditorium. Parking is free in these structures if you arrive one hour prior to performance time. Handicapped parking spaces are located on the east drive adjacent to Emens and in the parking garage east of Emens. Individuals requiring drop off service may be permitted by police officer to enter circle drive in front of Emens to let off passengers unable to walk long distances.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Please call 1-877-993-6367 during box office. Wheelchair accessible seating is located throughout the auditorium. Infared listening systems are available at the box office for our hearing impaired patrons. They will gladly make arrangements for interpreters. Please make requests through the box office at least 2 weeks prior to the performance.
