boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Concert and event schedules can be obtained by calling Chateau Ste. Michelles Visitor Information Line at (425) 488-1133 or visiting them online at www.ste-michelle.com
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The North and South Gate Box Offices open 2 hours and 30 minutes prior to each show.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Chateau Ste Michelle is a cashless venue. If you need to convert your cash at the venue, please visit our Guest Services Hut located to the left of the North Gates after the doors open. ?
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is available for pick up at the North and South Gate Box Offices starting 2 hours prior to the show. Please bring your confirmation number and the purchasers photo ID to claim your tickets. If you are having an issue with your tickets, stop by either Box Office for assistance.

parkingDetail: Chateau Ste. Michelle has limited on-site parking available for purchase, prices may vary, credit card only.?Guests are?highly encouraged to carpool and to utilize Off-Site parking, which is available at 15300 Redmond-Woodinville Rd NE and includes a free shuttle to the venue before and after the show. Offsite parking is $20 per vehicle, credit card only. Chateau Ste. Michelle also has bike parking available for guests riding bikes to the venue.?Accessible parking is available at both the on-site and off-site parking lots. For information about accessible pick-up and drop-off options,?please email TimNicholson@LiveNation.com. RV parking and camping on the estate are strictly prohibited.
accessibleSeatingDetail: Chateau Ste. Michelle?Amphitheatre?features accessible seating in its reserve seating sections and accessible pathways that lead to its general admission (GA) lawn. The reserve seating areas feature 10 accessible wheelchair spaces with companion seats dispersed throughout the reserved seating sections. Each wheelchair space is located adjacent to an accessible route. The GA lawn area features festival style first come, first served seating on the amphitheater lawn. Access to the GA lawn area is provided by ADA compliant paved sidewalks, but the seating area itself is a natural grass surface and may be difficult to traverse. Chateau Ste. Michelle reserves?an area?near the center of the GA lawn area on accessible routes and with prime viewing angles for customers with mobility disabilities.?This area is?available on a first come, first served basis and will be opened to all audience members five minutes before the start of a show. Customers with mobility disabilities may sit anywhere on the GA lawn to the extent they are comfortable doing so. Event staff are available to assist. If you have questions about the accessibility of the Chateau Ste. Michelle?Amphitheatre,?please email?TimNicholson@LiveNation.com. ?

generalInfo.generalRule: All concerts are performed outside, without cover, and are held rain or shine. Reserved ticket seating is in provided chairs located directly in front of the stage. General Admission ticket seating is directly on the lawn. You may bring blankets or low chairs. No cameras, tape recording or video recording or digital devices are allowed. These items will be confiscated. Pets (excluding service dogs) are not permitted on the winery grounds. Pets left inside a vehicle are not allowed. Barbecues, candles, and open flames are strictly prohibited. Gates open approximately two (2) hours prior to each performance. Please visit Chateau Ste Michelles website for a full list of permitted and not permitted items. https://www.ste-michelle.com/visit-us/summer-concerts/faq
generalInfo.childRule: A ticket is required for children ages 3 and older. Children under the age of 3 are free with a ticketed adult in the General Admission area. In the reserve section a ticket is required for all attendees regardless of age.

generalInfo.generalRule: No cameras, video cameras, or recording devices of any kind are allowed in the venue. No outside food, drinks, coolers or water jugs are allowed. Vendors will have food and drinks available for purchase inside the venue. No weapons of any kind are allowed in, including persons with concealed weapon permit and off-duty peace officers. This also includes mace, pepper spray, knives and any kind of stun gun. Concrete Street employees, police officers, state troopers, and sheriff deputies will be at every event to ensure customer safety. No wallet chains, metal chokers, chain belts or umbrellas are allowed inside the venue. No chairs are allowed to be brought into the venue. Concrete Street will have chairs available for rent inside the venue (for select events.) All purses, backpacks, and persons are subject to search upon entry. Anyone posing a danger to themselves or others will be escorted out of the park. Anyone under the age of 21 consuming or attempting to purchase alcohol will be escorted out of the park. Concrete Street does not condone or endorse body surfing or moshing of any kind.
generalInfo.childRule: Children six (6) and under get in free with a paid adult in general admission area only. For reserved seating, EVERYONE must have a ticket.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: **SUBJECT TO CHANGE** Non-Game Day Monday to Friday: 10AM to 5PM Saturday/Sunday: Closed Game Days 1:10 Game: Box Office is open from 9AM to 3:10PM 3:05 Game: Box Office is open from 9AM to 5:05PM 3:10 Game: Box Office is open from 9AM to 5:10PM 6:10 Game: Box Office is open from 9AM to 8:10PM 6:15 Game: Box Office is open from 9AM to 8:15PM 7:10 Game: Box Office is open from 9AM to 9:10PM
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: American Express, MasterCard, Visa & Discover. Ticket Windows do not accept checks.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: NEW! Ticketmaster Will Call Kiosks are available for will call pick-up on the day of the game! There are 2 will call kiosks located at each of the following gates: Gate 3, Gate 4, & Gate 5. Simply bring the credit card used to purchase the tickets to the kiosk, swipe your card and wait for your tickets to print! No more waiting in long will call lines! Kiosks are currently available for day of game will call pick-up only; advance pick-up and ticket sales are NOT available at the kiosks currently. Ticketmaster Will Call (phone or internet orders) may be picked up at any open ticket window at Guaranteed Rate Field on the day of the game, or before the day of game at least 48 hours after the order was placed, during regular box office hours.

parkingDetail: Guaranteed Rate Field offers parking in lots located adjacent to the stadium both to the north and to the south. Parking can be purchased at the park or in advance for $20. Please note - all cash parking day of game is located in the south lots.
accessibleSeatingDetail: 2008 Regular Season: Accessible seating is available in all price levels. In the lower level, accessible seating is in the back of the sections, and in the upper level, accessible seating is in the front of the sections. Ticketmaster sales of accessible seating is limited to four (4) tickets. If there is a larger request for accessible seating, please direct the order to Mary Weiss at the Guaranteed Rate Field Box Office at (312) 674-1000 ext. 5244, or Laura Arenas at (312) 674-1000 ext. 5246. Accessible elevators are located at Gate 4 entrance at the corner of 35th and Shields.

generalInfo.generalRule: Guest are permitted to bring food items into the park in see-through plastic bags that can be stored underneath the seats. One sealed water bottle, 1 liter or less in size, per person may be brought into the park. Carry-in bags must be less then 16 X 16 X 8 and will be searched upon entry. No bottles cans or beverages other than water are allowed. Fans must remain in the level for which they have purchased tickets (i.e. - fans with tickets in the upper level must remain in the upper level).
generalInfo.childRule: Children who are taller than the arm of the turnstile (approximately 36 inches) require a ticket of their own. Children smaller than the arm of the turnstile do not require a ticket of their own, but they must sit on the lap of an accompanying adult.

generalInfo.generalRule: Bag Policy: Clear bag no larger than 12" x 6" x 12" Items NOT allowed: - Outside food and beverage - Clear bags larger than 12" x 6" x 12" - Clutch or purses larger than 4.5" x 8" - Backpacks - fanny packs - mesh bag - Recording devices - Video cameras - Weapons - Drones - Coolers - Confetti - Selfie sticks - Laser pointers / pens - Glass bottles or aluminum cans - Bullhorns / whistles or noise makers - Beach balls or other inflatables - Skateboards or rollerblades - Water bottles or mugs - Stools or folding chairs - Pets or animals (with the exception of service animals) Diaper bags and medical bags are permitted but are subject to full a security screening. NOTE: All bags subject to inspection Camera Policy: As a general rule, NO PROFESSIONAL CAMERAS / NO VIDEO is allowed in either the Silver Spurs Arena or the Events Center. The camera policy is up to tour management, which is different for each show held at either building. If you are thinking it is absolutely necessary to bring a camera, bring a disposable camera. This way if it is announced at the last minute that tour management is not allowing cameras, you can simply throw it away or return it to your car. Silver Spurs Arena and the Events Center are not responsible for any lost or stolen cameras. You may call 321-697-3333 the day of the event to inquire about the camera policy. name: Coors Field

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Call (303) ROCKIES for all your inquires.
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: After February 11, 2012, regular ticket office hours are Monday through Friday, 9:00am to 6:00pm, and Saturday, 9:30am to 4:00pm, with extended hours on home game days, remaining open until approximately 30 minutes after the conclusion of the game. Sunday home game days only, the ticket office will open at 9:00am remaining open until approximately 30 minutes after the conclusion of the game.
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Types of payment accepted are Cash, Check, Visa, MasterCard, American Express and Discover.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Will Call is defined as tickets left by the Colorado Rockies, tickets purchased via mail, online or telephone orders that were not mailed, and tickets left by a third party. Will Call is generally available during regular ticket office hours at the Coors Field Main Ticket Office at 20th and Blake Streets. Guests must present a photo I.D. to pick up tickets. Tickets must be left under the name of the person who will pick them up. If there is a need to change the Will Call name, the Guest must contact Will Call prior to game time at (303) 292-0200.

parkingDetail: Individual game parking passes are available in Lot B only. Lot B parking passes can be purchased in advance for $12 at the Coors Field Ticket Office, Colorado Rockies Dugout Store, by phone at 303-ROCKIES (762-5437) or online at www.coloradorockies.com . Day of game parking is available in Lot B for $13. RV and bus parking is available for $25 at 22nd and Wazee Streets, and 27th and Blake Streets. Motorcycle parking is available for $13 in Lot B. Coors Field parking lots open 2 ½ hours prior to game time.
accessibleSeatingDetail: There are approximately 1,000 accessible and companion seats available throughout Coors Field. When purchasing seats, please indicate to the ticket seller (whether ordering by phone or in person) that you require accessible seating. If you are mailing your order, indicate this request on your mail order form. Even though a game may be "sold out" for other areas, there may still be accessible and companion seating available. Despite the "sold out" status, unsold accessible and companion seating will remain reserved for persons with disabilities, with the following exception: on the day of a sellout when there are enough seats to meet the needs of our Guests with disabilities, a percentage of the unsold accessible and companion seating may be made available to the public. The remaining inventory will continue to be reserved for our Guests with disabilities. Additionally, please note that only certain areas will be sold, and there is not a specific time they will be available.

generalInfo.generalRule: Prohibited Items: 1. Alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs 2. Non-alcoholic beer or similar items 3. Glass bottles and aluminum or metal cans (including aerosol cans) 4. All hard-sided coolers and containers, regardless of size 5. All hard-sided briefcases, regardless of size 6. All soft-sided bags and containers larger than 16"x16"x8" 7. Camera tri, dual or single leg pods by non-media personnel. Video cameras are permitted as long as live game action is not recorded as specified by MLB Policy (See Cameras and Game Information Prohibition.) 8. Bota bags or wine skin 9. Sticks or clubs (including signs attached to sticks) 10. Fireworks 11. Firearms or other weapons 12. Bullhorns or noise makers 13. Confetti, soap bubbles 14. Animals (except service animals for Guests with disabilities) 15. Beachballs, balloons and other inflatables 16. Skateboards, rollerblades or shoes with wheels (Heelys) 17. Stools or folding chairs 18. Large squirt guns or super soakers 19. Fishing nets and poles 20. Any fruit or vegetable larger than a grapefruit must be sliced 21. Laser pointers 22. Insulated coolers, cups and thermoses larger than 22 oz. 23. Pizza boxes larger than personal size Permitted Items: 1. Plastic beverage containers 2. Soft-sided bags or containers 16"x 16"x 8" or smaller 3. Insulated cups or thermoses 22 ounces or smaller 4. Food items 5. Any fruit or vegetable grapefruit-sized or smaller 6. Still and video cameras (see Cameras) 7. Binoculars 8. Seat cushions and bleacher back rest 9. Umbrellas during the threat of inclement weather. In consideration of the safety and sight lines of others, please use only small, compact umbrellas (28" - 34" span). Large golf umbrellas and umbrellas with metal tips are strongly discouraged. 10. Paper or plastic cups with permitted beverages 11. Plastic baby bottles 12. Baseball bats - for the purpose of autographs; must be stored underneath the seats once the game begins 13. Brooms - 6' maximum length (only on the day of a potential sweep) 14. Potato chip or nut cardboard cans with metal tops or bottoms 15. Strollers - that fold or collapse to fit underneath seats (larger strollers may be claim-checked at the gates upon entry) 16. Motorcycle and bicycle helmets 17. Empty camel packs
generalInfo.childRule: Children two and under who are sitting on the lap of an adult do not need a game ticket. Children who have reached their third birthday must have a valid game ticket to gain entrance to the ballpark and are permitted seating access only in their ticketed location.

generalInfo.generalRule: Doors will typically open 1 hour prior to the event time noted on your ticket. However, all door times are subject to change. Prohibited bags include, but are not limited to, the following: • No commercial or flash photography of any kind is permitted. Selfie sticks are not permitted within the Theater. Camcorders or any other audio/visual equipment is prohibited unless authorized by team/promoter or performer. Specifically, the use of the following equipment is not permitted: • Lenses greater than three-and-one-half inches in length • Telephoto or zoom lenses of any kind • Interchangeable lenses of any kind • Monopods, tripods or selfie sticks

ada.adaCustomCopy:
Entrance: From Parking Lot C (accessible by taking Fort Dearborn Drive north from 31st Street) Arie Crown Theater is wheelchair accessible. Use ramps from Parking Lot C to navigate to McCormick Place, Lakeside Center and then into Arie Crown Theater.

Patrons with disabilities can also be dropped off at Gate 31 (Fort Dearborn Drive north from 31st Street, past Parking Lot C).

Patrons can obtain infrared, assistive listening devices by inquiring with any of Arie Crown's ushers. Assistive listening devices can be secured by leaving a photo ID or credit card and are free of charge.
ada.adaHours: The Box Office is only open on event days, approximately 3 hours prior to the start of the event. Hours may vary on Holidays, please call (312) 791-6900 for confirmation.
